All Words Index for Joyce

abandon

[ə'bændən], [ə'bændən]


Image Search
v. 放弃；抛弃；放纵
n. 放纵
cease to support or look after (someone); desert.
leave (a place or vehicle) empty or uninhabited, without intending to return.
condemn someone or something to (a specified fate) by ceasing to take an interest in or look after them.
give up completely (a course of action, a practice, or a way of thinking).
discontinue (a scheduled event) before completion.
allow oneself to indulge in (a desire or impulse).
complete lack of inhibition or restraint.
"her natural mother had abandoned her at an early age"
"derelict houses were abandoned"
"it was an attempt to persuade businesses not to abandon the area to inner-city deprivation"
"he had clearly abandoned all pretense of trying to succeed"
"against the background of perceived threats, the tour was abandoned"
"abandoning herself to moony fantasies"
"she sings and sways with total abandon"
Those who abandon themselves to despair can not succeed.那些自暴自弃的人无法成功。
Despite some difficulties, they're not going to abandon the plan.尽管他们遇到了一些困难,但并不打算放弃这个计划。
The cruel man abandoned his wife and child.那个狠心的男人抛弃了他的妻儿。
They abandon themselves to drinking.他们沉湎于饮酒。
He signed cheques with careless abandon.他无所顾忌地乱开支票。
The cheerleader waved his arms with wild abandon.拉拉队队长疯狂地挥舞双臂。

abduct

[æb'dʌkt], [æb'dʌkt]


Image Search
vt. 诱拐；绑走
take (someone) away illegally by force or deception; kidnap.
(of a muscle) move (a limb or part) away from the midline of the body or from another part.
"the millionaire who disappeared may have been abducted"
He had attempted to abduct the two children.他曾企图诱拐这两名儿童。
I can say you abduct a high school student.我可以告你诱拐中学生。

abominable

[ə'bɒmɪnəbl], [ə'bɑːmɪnəbl]


Image Search
adj. 讨厌的；令人憎恶的；糟糕的
causing moral revulsion.
very bad or unpleasant.
"the uprising was suppressed with abominable cruelty"
"a cup of abominable tea"
Your behaviour is abominable to me.我讨厌你的行为.
Murder is the most abominable crime.凶杀是最可恶的犯罪。
The food in the cafeteria is abominable.这家自助餐厅的膳食糟糕透了。

abstain

[əb'steɪn], [əb'steɪn]


Image Search
v. 戒绝；弃权；节制
restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.
refrain from drinking alcohol.
formally decline to vote either for or against a proposal or motion.
"abstaining from chocolate"
"most pregnant women abstain or drink very little"
"forty-one voted with the opposition, and some sixty more abstained"
He swore to abstain from smoking.他发誓要戒烟。
A high percentage of women said they had abstained from alcohol during pregnancy.很大比例的妇女称他们在怀孕期间戒了酒。
I abstained from voting.我弃权不投票。
Six countries voted for the change, five voted against, and two abstained.六个国家投票赞成改变，五个反对，还有两个弃权。
He abstained from speaking at the meeting.会上，他默不作声。

abstract

['æbstrækt], ['æbstrækt]


Image Search
existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence.
dealing with ideas rather than events.
not based on a particular instance; theoretical.
(of a word, especially a noun) denoting an idea, quality, or state rather than a concrete object.
relating to abstract art.
consider (something) theoretically or separately from something else.
extract or remove (something).
used euphemistically to say that someone has stolen something.
withdraw.
make a written summary of (an article or book).
a summary of the contents of a book, article, or formal speech.
an abstract work of art.
that which is abstract; the theoretical consideration of something.
"abstract concepts such as love or beauty"
"the novel was too abstract and esoteric to sustain much attention"
"we have been discussing the problem in a very abstract manner"
"abstract words like truth or equality"
"abstract pictures that look like commercial color charts"
"to abstract science and religion from their historical context can lead to anachronism"
"applications to abstract more water from streams"
"his pockets contained all he had been able to abstract from the apartment"
"as our relationship deepened you seemed to abstract yourself"
"staff who index and abstract material for an online database"
"an abstract of his inaugural address"
"a big unframed abstract"
"the abstract must be made concrete by examples"
We may talk of beautiful things, but beauty itself is abstract.我们尽可谈论美的事物，然而美本身却是抽象的。
He has some abstract notion of wanting to change the world.他有一种要改造世界的空想。
Abstract paintings did not appeal to him.抽象派绘画引不起他的兴趣。
The whole text of the abstract shall contain not more than 300 Chinese characters.摘要文字部分不得超过300个字。
She abstracted the main points from the argument.她把论据概括成要点。
They are trying to abstract iron from ore.他们正试图从矿石中提取铁。
There is a plan to abstract 8 million gallons of water from the river.有一个从这条河中抽取800万加仑水的计划。
She tried to abstract my attention from my work.她企图转移我对工作的注意力。

absurd

[əb'sɜːd], [əb'sɜːrd]


Image Search
adj. 荒唐的；可笑的；不合理的
n. 荒唐
wildly unreasonable, illogical, or inappropriate.
arousing amusement or derision; ridiculous.
"the allegations are patently absurd"
"gym shorts and knee socks looked absurd on such a tall girl"
He finally recovered from an absurd infatuation.他终于从荒唐的迷恋中醒悟过来。
What an absurd suggestion!多荒谬的建议啊！
We have no intention of lying down under these absurd allegations.对这些荒谬的指控我们是不甘受辱的。
It was absurd of you to suggest such a thing.你居然建议这样的事，太可笑了。
He looked absurd in that get-up.他穿著那套衣服看上去怪模怪样的。
It is absurd to argue from these premises.凭这些前提议论是不合理的。
The proposal borders on the absurd.该提议近乎可笑。
The pleading with Nora is beyond absurd.向诺拉好言相求真是荒唐得无以复加。

abuse

[ə'bjuːs], [ə'bjuːs]


Image Search
n. 滥用；恶习
vt. 滥用；辱骂；虐待
use (something) to bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse.
make excessive and habitual use of (alcohol or drugs, especially illegal ones).
treat (a person or an animal) with cruelty or violence, especially regularly or repeatedly.
assault (someone, especially a woman or child) sexually.
masturbate.
use or treat in such a way as to cause damage or harm.
speak in an insulting and offensive way to or about (someone).
the improper use of something.
unjust or corrupt practice.
cruel and violent treatment of a person or animal.
violent treatment involving sexual assault, especially on a repeated basis.
insulting and offensive language.
"the judge abused his power by imposing the fines"
"riders who abuse their horses should be prosecuted"
"he was a depraved man who had abused his two young daughters"
"he had been abusing his body for years"
"the referee was abused by players from both teams"
"alcohol abuse"
"protection against fraud and abuse"
"a black eye and other signs of physical abuse"
"young people who have suffered sexual abuse"
"waving his fists and hurling abuse at the driver"
The government has set up a working party to look into the problem of drug abuse.政府已成立工作组调查滥用毒品问题。
His political reputation was tainted by his abuse of the power.他因滥用职权而破坏了政治声誉。
He greeted me with a stream of abuse.他见到我就连声辱骂。
It's easy to abuse one's power.人容易滥用权力。
I don't consider it good for a person to be afraid of being abused.一个人怕挨骂,我看不好。
He abused his wife and children.他虐待他的妻子和孩子。

academic

[ˌækə'demɪk], [ˌækə'demɪk]


Image Search
adj. 学院的；学术的；理论的
n. 大学教师，大学生；学者，学究
relating to education and scholarship.
relating to an educational or scholarly institution or environment.
(of an institution or a course of study) placing a greater emphasis on reading and study than on technical or practical work.
(of a person) interested in or excelling at scholarly pursuits and activities.
(of an art form) conventional, especially in an idealized or excessively formal way.
not of practical relevance; of only theoretical interest.
a teacher or scholar in a college or institute of higher education.
"academic achievement"
"students resplendent in academic dress"
"an academic high school that prepares students for the best colleges and universities"
"Ben is not an academic child but he tries hard"
"academic painting"
"the debate has been largely academic"
Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema was an English painter in the academic tradition.阿尔玛·台德玛是学院派的英国画家。
With my strong academic background, I am competent.依我良好的学术背景,我能胜任。
Applicant must possess good conduct and obtain satisfactory academic results.申请者必须拥有良好品性,并考获令人满意的成绩;
During the past four years I have had a good deal of academic experience in communications technology.四年来,我掌握了丰富的通信技术上的理论知识。

access

['ækses], ['ækses]


Image Search
n. 入口；通道
n. 接近(的机会)；使用之权
vt. 进入；(电脑)存取
a means of approaching or entering a place.
the right or opportunity to use or benefit from something.
the right or opportunity to approach or see someone.
the action or process of obtaining or retrieving information stored in a computer's memory.
denoting noncommercial broadcasting produced by local independent groups, rather than by professionals.
an attack or outburst of an emotion.
approach or enter (a place).
obtain, examine, or retrieve (data or a file).
"the staircase gives access to the top floor"
"do you have access to a computer?"
"we were denied access to our grandson"
"this prevents unauthorized access or inadvertent deletion of the file"
"public-access television"
"I was suddenly overcome with an access of rage"
"single rooms have private baths accessed via the balcony"
This is the only means of access to the building.这是进入这栋楼的唯一入口。
The avalanche cut off the access to the mountain village.雪崩切断了进入山村的通道。
The only access to that building is along the track.到那座大楼的唯一通道就是沿这条小路走。
Only high officials have access to the president.只有高级官员才可以接近总统。
People in that mountain area had no access to education.那个山区的人们过去没有受教育的机会。
I demanded access to a telephone.我要求有权使用电话。
Students have full access to all resources.学生对所有资源有完全访问权。
An error occurred when we tried to access the inventory database.当我们试图进入存货数据库时，屏幕上显示出现了错误。
We can't access the Internet.我们连不上网。
She access three different files to find the correct information.她存取了三个文件以找寻所要的信息。
Branch officials can access the central data bank.分行官员可以存取中央数据库。

accommodate

[ə'kɒmədeɪt], [ə'kɑːmədeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 供给住宿；使适应；容纳；提供；顾及；调解
vi. 适应；调节
(of physical space, especially a building) provide lodging or sufficient space for.
fit in with the wishes or needs of.
adapt to.
"the cabins accommodate up to 6 people"
"any language must accommodate new concepts"
"making consumers accommodate to the realities of today's marketplace"
This hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests.这旅馆可供500位来宾住宿。
We must accommodate ourselves to circumstances.我们必须适应环境。
One flat can accommodate a family of five.一套单元房可容纳一个五口之家。
The bank is accommodating its customers more than it used to.这家银行现在给客户贷款比以前多了。
The government came up with a new economic proposal that accommodates the special needs and interests of the elderly.政府出台了一项新的考虑老年人特殊要求和利益的新经济提案。
He tried to accommodate the dispute between his two friends.他尽力调解两个朋友之间的纠纷。
Her eyes took a while to accommodate to the darkness.过了一会儿，她的眼睛才能适应黑暗。

accommodation

[əˌkɒmə'deɪʃn], [əˌkɑːmə'deɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 膳宿；和解；住处；适应
a room, group of rooms, or building in which someone may live or stay.
lodging; room and board.
the available space for occupants in a building, vehicle, or vessel.
the provision of a room or lodging.
a convenient arrangement; a settlement or compromise.
the process of adapting or adjusting to someone or something.
the automatic adjustment of the focus of the eye by flattening or thickening of the lens.
"the cost includes airfare and hotel accommodations"
"the company offers a number of guesthouse accommodations in Cape Cod"
"there was lifeboat accommodation for 1,178 people"
"the building is used exclusively for the accommodation of guests"
"management was seeking an accommodation with labor"
"accommodation to a separate political entity was not possible"
There travelling students found accommodation at moderate terms.旅游的学生们感到那儿的膳宿费是公道的。
If labour and management don't reach an accommodation there will be a strike.如果劳资双方达不成妥协，就会发生罢工。
We can provide accommodation for six people at a push.如情况需要，我们可以安排六个人的住处。
Hotel accommodation was scarce during the Olympic Games.奥运会期间，旅馆房间很难找。
I will arrange the accommodation of my plans to yours.我将调整我的计划以便和你的计划相适应。
Their spirits had learned accommodation to much more than cold.他们的心灵已经适应于比寒冷更坏得多的条件。

accompanied

[ə'kʌmpəni], [ə'kʌmpəni]


Image Search
vt. 陪伴；伴随...发生；补充；给 ... 伴奏
vi. 伴奏
go somewhere with (someone) as a companion or escort.
be present or occur at the same time as (something else).
provide (something) as a complement or addition to something else.
play a musical accompaniment for.
"the two sisters were to accompany us to New York"
"the illness is often accompanied by nausea"
"home-cooked ham accompanied by brown bread"
She asked me to accompany her to the airport.她要求我陪她到机场去。
Lightning usually accompanies thunder.闪电通常伴有雷声。
The text is accompanied by illustration.正文附有插图。
The singer was accompanied on the piano by her sister.女歌手由她姐姐钢琴伴奏。
In the singer's eyes,she accompanied magnificently.在那名歌手的眼里,她伴奏得精彩极了。

accumulate

[ə'kjuːmjəleɪt], [ə'kjuːmjəleɪt]


Image Search
v. 积累；增加；聚集
gather together or acquire an increasing number or quantity of.
gradually gather or acquire (a resulting whole).
gather or build up.
"investigators have yet to accumulate enough evidence"
"her goal was to accumulate a huge fortune"
"the toxin accumulated in their bodies"
They set out to accumulate a huge mass of data.他们开始积累大量的资料。
Dust and dirt soon accumulates if a house is not cleaned regularly.房屋不经常打扫,尘土很快就越积越多。
True poetry accumulates meaning every time it is read.真正好诗愈念涵义愈丰富。
However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the zoo felt obliged to investigate.然而，当证据日趋增多时，该动物园的专家们感到有必要进行调查。
Over the years, I had accumulated hundreds of books.多年来,我收集了几百本书。

accumulation

[əˌkjuːmjə'leɪʃn], [əˌkjuːmjə'leɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 积聚；累积；积聚物
the acquisition or gradual gathering of something.
a mass or quantity of something that has gradually gathered or been acquired.
"the accumulation of wealth"
"the accumulation of paperwork on her desk"
Accumulation of excess fluid within the interstitial spaces.过多的液体在体腔内积聚又称为积水。
The puzzle appears greater when one recalls the vast accumulation of material power available to the Habsburgs.回想一下哈布斯堡家族所能积聚和掌握的大量物质力量就更令人困惑费解。
Each of us is the accumulation of our memories.我们每个人都是我们记忆的累积。
The steady accumulation of small debts was a ball and chain to his progress.不断累积的小债务妨碍了他的发展不断累积的小债务妨碍了他的发展。

accurate

['ækjərət], ['ækjərət]


Image Search
adj. 准确的；精确的
(of information, measurements, statistics, etc.) correct in all details; exact.
(of an instrument or method) capable of giving accurate information.
faithfully or fairly representing the truth about someone or something.
(with reference to a weapon, missile, or shot) capable of or successful in reaching the intended target.
"accurate information about the illness is essential"
"an accurate thermometer"
"the portrait is an accurate likeness of Mozart"
"reliable, accurate rifles"
Hearsay definitely can't be regarded as accurate information.道听途说的决然不能算作很准确的消息。
The manager impressed on his office staff the importance of keeping accurate records.经理让办公室职员认识到做精确记录的重要性。

achieve

[ə'tʃiːv], [ə'tʃiːv]


Image Search
v. 完成；达到；实现
successfully bring about or reach (a desired objective, level, or result) by effort, skill, or courage.
"he achieved his ambition to become a journalist"
I've achieved only half of what I'd hoped to do.我希望做到的,我仅完成了一半。
Work hard, and you will achieve your goal.好好干,你就会达到自己的目标。
You will achieve your ambition if you work hard.如果你努力, 你的抱负是可以实现的。

achievement

[ə'tʃiːvmənt], [ə'tʃiːvmənt]


Image Search
n. 成就；成绩；完成；达到
a thing done successfully, typically by effort, courage, or skill.
the process or fact of achieving something.
a representation of a coat of arms with all the adjuncts to which a bearer of arms is entitled.
"to reach this stage is a great achievement"
"the achievement of professional recognition"
Effort and achievement are always in full accord.努力和成就总是相辅相承的。
You haven't realized the magnitude of her achievement.你没有认识到她这一成就的重大意义。
I felt a great sense of achievement when I reached the top of the mountain.当我到达山顶的时候，我有一种巨大的成就感。
Coming top in the exam was quite an achievement.考第一是很了不起的成绩。
Flying across the Atlantic for the first time was a great achievement.首次飞跃大西洋是一项了不起的业绩。
That task is impossible of achievement.那项任务不可能完成。
Most achievement rates were close to,or reached,100 per cent.就大部分的服务目标而言，该署几乎完全达到目标。
The achievement of this level of investment in a democratic nation is remarkable.在一个民主国家中投资达到这种高水平，是十分突出的。

acknowledged

[ək'nɒlɪdʒd], [ək'nɒlɪdʒd]


Image Search
adj. 公认的，得到普遍认可的
v. 承认，认可；告知收到（动词acknowledge的过去式和过去分词）
recognized as being good or important.
accepted as valid or legitimate.
accept or admit the existence or truth of.
(of a body of opinion) recognize the fact or importance or quality of.
express or display gratitude for or appreciation of.
accept the validity or legitimacy of.
show that one has noticed or recognized (someone) by making a gesture or greeting.
confirm (receipt of something).
"he's an acknowledged expert in the field"
"an acknowledged brand leader"
"the plight of the refugees was acknowledged by the authorities"
"the art world has begun to acknowledge his genius"
"he received a letter acknowledging his services"
"Henry acknowledged Richard as his heir"
"she refused to acknowledge my presence"
He was generally acknowledged to be the finest poet in the land.他是公认的全国最优秀的诗人。
His rare gifts and bold strategy are universally acknowledged.他的雄才大略是举世公认的。
He acknowledged it as true.他承认它是真实的。
He acknowledged that the accident was due to his negligence.他承认事故的发生是因为他的疏忽。

acquire

[ə'kwaɪə(r)], [ə'kwaɪər]


Image Search
vt. 获得；学到；取得
buy or obtain (an object or asset) for oneself.
learn or develop (a skill, habit, or quality).
achieve (a particular reputation) as a result of one's behavior or activities.
"you must acquire the rudiments of Greek"
We should try to acquire good habits.我们应该努力养成良好的习惯。
He will acquire the right to permanent residency here.他将获得这里的永久居留权。
We hope to acquire the knowledge in the happiness.我们希望在快乐中获得知识。
One can never acquire enough experience.经验是永远学不足的。
You must acquire great skills of perception.你必须学会洞察事物的高超技巧。
We should acquire more firsthand information.我们应当取得更多的第一手资料。

acquisition

[ˌækwɪ'zɪʃn], [ˌækwɪ'zɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 获得；所获之物；采集
an asset or object bought or obtained, typically by a library or museum.
an act of purchase of one company by another.
buying or obtaining an asset or object.
the learning or developing of a skill, habit, or quality.
"there were many acquisitions among travel agents"
"Western culture places a high value on material acquisition"
"the acquisition of management skills"
Life is a process about the acquisition of knowledge, wealth and happiness.生命就是一个获得知识、财富和幸福的过程。
My classmates were attracted by the library's most recent acquisitions.同学们都被图书馆最近新添的书籍吸引了。

acquit

[ə'kwɪt], [ə'kwɪt]


Image Search
v. 宣布无罪；开释；原谅；表现
free (someone) from a criminal charge by a verdict of not guilty.
conduct oneself or perform in a specified way.
discharge (a duty or responsibility).
"she was acquitted on all counts"
"all the young women in the contest acquitted themselves well"
"they acquitted themselves of their charge with vigilance"
He was acquitted of the crime.他被宣告无罪。
They tried to bribe the judge to acquit them.他们试图贿赂法官判他们无罪。
Will the court acquit him of the crime?法庭会宣判他无罪释放吗?
I acquit Edward of all essential misconduct.我原谅爱德华的所有根本过错。
He acquitted himself like a hero.他表现得像个英雄。

activate

['æktɪveɪt], ['æktɪveɪt]


Image Search
v. 激活；使活动；起动
make (something) active or operative.
convert (a substance, molecule, etc.) into a reactive form.
"fumes from cooking are enough to activate the alarm"
"activated chlorine"
You can activate the system by buttons or voice recognition.你可以通过按钮或者声音识别来激活系统。
The burglar alarm was activated by mistake.防盗铃误响了。
I think if you flip the blue switch near the bottom it will activate the air conditioner.我想，如果你把下方的蓝色开关轻轻地推上，冷气就会出来了。
These push buttons can activate the elevator.这些按钮能启动电梯。

acute

[ə'kjuːt], [ə'kjuːt]


Image Search
adj. 严重的；敏锐的；急性的；剧烈的
(of a bad, difficult, or unwelcome situation or phenomenon) present or experienced to a severe or intense degree.
(of a disease or its symptoms) of short duration but typically severe.
denoting or designed for patients with acute conditions.
having or showing a perceptive understanding or insight: shrewd.
(of a physical sense or faculty) highly developed; keen.
(of an angle) less than 90°.
having a sharp end; pointed.
(of a sound) high; shrill.
short for acute accent.
"an acute housing shortage"
"acute appendicitis"
"acute hospital services"
"an acute awareness of changing fashions"
"an acute sense of smell"
He suffers from acute depression.他患有严重的抑郁症。
This area has an acute shortage of water.这个地方缺水严重。
She has acute hearing.她有很敏锐的听力。
The doctor said that you had acute appendicitis.医生说您患的是急性阑尾炎。
The patient is complaining of acute earache.病人说耳部剧痛。

adaptation

[ˌædæp'teɪʃn], [ˌædæp'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 改编；改编成的作品；适应；【心】（感官）适应，适应性变化
the action or process of adapting or being adapted.
a movie, television drama, or stage play that has been adapted from a written work, typically a novel.
a change or the process of change by which an organism or species becomes better suited to its environment.
"the adaptation of teaching strategy to meet students' needs"
"filming her adaptation of a beloved children's book"
"living in groups is an adaptation that increases the efficiency of hunting"
This story lends itself to film adaptation.这个故事适合改编拍电影。
Scotish adaptation was made about a century later.大约一个世纪之后的出现了一个苏格兰的改编本。
I bought my son an adaptation for children of a play by Shakespeare.我给我儿子买了为儿童改编的莎士比亚剧本。
He made a quick adaptation to the new environment.他很快适应了新的环境。
Another idea is that art is a social adaptation.另一个想法是，艺术是一种对社会的适应。

adequate

['ædɪkwət], ['ædɪkwət]


Image Search
adj. 足够的；适当的；能胜任的
satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity.
"this office is perfectly adequate for my needs"
We had adequate food for a week's journey.我们有足够的食物可以做一星期的旅行。
He sought for an adequate solution to the problem.他寻求解决这个问题的适当办法。
I hope he will be adequate to the job.我希望他将胜任这一工作。

adhere

[əd'hɪə(r)], [əd'hɪr]


Image Search
vi. 遵守；坚持；粘附
stick fast to (a surface or substance).
believe in and follow the practices of.
represent truthfully and in detail.
"paint won't adhere well to a greasy surface"
"the people adhere to the Muslim religion"
"the account adhered firmly to fact"
They failed to adhere to our original agreement.他们未能遵守我们原定的协议。
We should adhere to our opinions.我们应当坚持我们的意见。
We adhere to the principle stand of marxism.我们坚持马克思主义思想原则。
The new paint won't adhere to the walls so I'll have to strip it all off and start from scratch.新涂的油漆粘不住墙壁,因此我得把它全部刮掉,重新刷过。
Paste is used to make one surface adhere to another.糨糊是用于使一个接触面粘住另一个接触面的。

adjacent

[ə'dʒeɪsnt], [ə'dʒeɪsnt]


Image Search
adj. 邻近的；毗连的；接近的
next to or adjoining something else.
(of angles) having a common vertex and a common side.
"adjacent rooms"
The house adjacent to ours has been sold.与我们家邻接的房子已经售出。
His house is adjacent to mine.他的寓所与我的相毗连。
The planes landed on adjacent runways.这些飞机在毗连的跑道上降落。
The island of Cuba is adjacent to Florida.古巴岛接近佛罗里达。
The hospital is adjacent to a church.这家医院紧挨着一座教堂。

adjustment

[ə'dʒʌstmənt], [ə'dʒʌstmənt]


Image Search
n. 调整；调节
a small alteration or movement made to achieve a desired fit, appearance, or result.
the process of adapting or becoming used to a new situation.
"I've made a few adjustments to my diet"
"for many couples there may need to be a period of adjustment"
I've made a few minor adjustments to the seating plan.我对座次表作了小小的调整。
The company made an adjustment in my salary.公司对我的薪金作了调整。
The adjustment of the interest rate will moderate.利率的调整将会放缓。
They should make adjustment to the new environment.他们应进行调整以适应新环境。
Some adjustment of the lens may be necessary.可能有必要调节一下镜头。
A small adjustment will equalize the temperature in the two rooms.稍作些调节就会使两间房内的温度相等。
The volume adjustment knob on my TV is broken.我电视机上的音量调节开关坏了。

administration

[ədˌmɪnɪ'streɪʃn], [ədˌmɪnɪ'streɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 实施；管理；行政；行政部门；任期
the process or activity of running a business, organization, etc.
the people responsible for this, regarded collectively.
the management of public affairs; government.
the management and disposal of the property of an intestate, deceased person, debtor, or other individual, or of an insolvent company, by a legally appointed administrator.
the officials in the executive branch of government under a particular chief executive.
the term of office of a political leader or government.
a government agency.
the action of dispensing, giving, or applying something.
"the day-to-day administration of the company"
"the university administration took their demands seriously"
"the inhabitants of the island voted to remain under French administration"
"the company went into administration"
"the Kennedy administration sought to use the conference to repair US prestige"
"the early years of the Reagan Administration"
"the US Food and Drug Administration"
"the oral administration of the antibiotic"
He is responsible for the administration of justice.他负责赏罚。
He works in hospital administration.他从事医院管理工作.
The company developed rapidly under his administration.在他的管理下，公司发展得很快。
Head teachers are more involved in administration than in teaching.校长的行政工作比教学工作多。
She has been looking after the, day-to-day administration.她一直在照管日常的行政工作。
I hate the prodigal administration.我痛恨铺张浪费的行政机关。
A new Presidential administration will begin soon.新一届总统任期马上就要开始了。
He tried to remedy this neglect during his own administration.他努力在他的任期内弥补这个缺陷。

adults

[æ'dʌlts], [æ'dʌlts]


Image Search
n. 成年人；成年动物；成虫
名词adult的复数
a person who is fully grown or developed.
a fully developed animal.
a person who has reached the age of majority.
behave in a way characteristic of a responsible adult, especially by accomplishing mundane but necessary tasks.
"children should be accompanied by an adult"
"I've adulted with moderate success this week by compiling invoices and billing my client"
Some adults can't relate to children.有些成年人不理解儿童的想法。
The movie is intended for adults only.这部电影只供成年人观看。
Membership of the club is restricted to adults.本俱乐部会员仅限于成年人。
The adults are mainly herbivorous.沙蜂的成虫通常是食草性的。
Inside the nest are larva, pupa, and adults - you can eat them all.幼虫、蛹还有成虫都在蜂巢内，全都可以吃。

adverse

['ædvɜːs], ['ædvɜːrs]


Image Search
adj. 不利的；逆向的；有害的
preventing success or development; harmful; unfavorable.
"taxes are having an adverse effect on production"
The judge gave us an adverse decision.法官作出对我们不利的判决。
He ignored all kinds of adverse comments about him.他不理睬各种各样对他不利的评论。
The development was adverse to our interests.这种发展与我们的利益背道而驰。
Diseases are adverse to the best growth of children.疾病对儿童的健康成长是有害的。

advocate

['ædvəkeɪt], ['ædvəkeɪt]


Image Search
v. 提倡；主张
n. 拥护者；提倡者；律师；辩护者
a person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy.
a person who pleads on someone else's behalf.
a pleader in a court of law; a lawyer.
publicly recommend or support.
"he was an untiring advocate of economic reform"
"care managers can become advocates for their clients"
"Marshall was a skilled advocate but a mediocre judge"
"they advocated an ethical foreign policy"
Many educators advocate a liberal education.很多教育家提倡通才教育。
We don't advocate learning by rote.死记硬背的学习方法，我们是不提倡的。
Many people advocate building more hospitals.许多人主张增设医院。
We advocate higher salaries for teachers.我们主张涨老师的工资。
She is a passionate advocate of education reform.她是一名教育改革的热情拥护者。
This judge is a strong advocate of prison reform.这位法官是监狱改革的坚决拥护者。
The advocate has undertaken my case.律师己接受我的案子。
He got the best advocate in town to defend him.他请城里最好的律师为他辩护。

affect

[ə'fekt], [ə'fekt]


Image Search
vt. 影响；感动；作用
have an effect on; make a difference to.
touch the feelings of (someone); move emotionally.
pretend to have or feel (something).
use, wear, or assume (something) pretentiously or so as to make an impression on others.
emotion or desire, especially as influencing behavior or action.
"the dampness began to affect my health"
"the atrocities he witnessed have affected him most deeply"
"as usual I affected a supreme unconcern"
"an American who had affected a British accent"
How does interest rate affect the price of bonds?利率如何影响债券的价格?
She was deeply affected by the sad story.她深深被那个悲伤的故事感动了。
His charm doesn't affect or impress me.他的魅力对我不起作用.

affirm

[ə'fɜːm], [ə'fɜːrm]


Image Search
vt. 证实；断言；肯定
state as a fact; assert strongly and publicly.
declare one's support for; uphold or defend.
accept or confirm the validity of (a judgment or agreement); ratify.
make a formal declaration rather than taking an oath (e.g., to testify truthfully).
(of a court) uphold (a decision) on appeal.
offer (someone) emotional support or encouragement.
give (life) a heightened sense of value, typically through the experience of something emotionally or spiritually uplifting.
"he affirmed the country's commitment to peace"
"the referendum affirmed the republic's right to secede"
"there are five common ways parents fail to affirm their children"
"it is a rich and challenging motion picture that both affirms life and emphasizes its fragility"
Scientists cannot affirm the existence of life on other planets.科学家们还不能证实在其它星球上有生命存在。
I affirm that what he said is true.我断言他所说的是实情。
They affirmed that the girl did quite a bit of reading.他们断言这个女孩子读了不少书。
I can affirm that no one will lose their job.我可以肯定，谁都不会丢掉工作。
We are not entitled to affirm or negate anything.我们没有任何权利和资格去肯定或否定任何一件事情。

Image Search

the state of having a great deal of money; wealth.
"a sign of our growing affluence"
America is a country of great affluence.美国是富裕的国家。

agenda

[ə'dʒendə], [ə'dʒendə]


Image Search
n. 议事日程
a list of items to be discussed at a formal meeting.
a plan of things to be done or problems to be addressed.
the underlying intentions or motives of a particular person or group.
an appointment diary.
"the question of nuclear weapons had been removed from the agenda"
"he vowed to put jobs at the top of his agenda"
"Miller has his own agenda and it has nothing to do with football"
This agenda will form the basis of our next meeting.本议程将成为下次会议的中心议题。
Let's go on to the next item on the agenda.我们讨论议程表上的下一项吧。
Let's thrash the matter over before putting it on the agenda.我们先把这件事仔细研究一下，再把它列入议事日程。

aggregate

['æɡrɪɡət], ['æɡrɪɡət]


Image Search
adj. 合计的；总的
n. 总计；进球总数；集料
v. （使）聚集；总计
a whole formed by combining several (typically disparate) elements.
the total number of points scored by a player or team in a series of sporting contests.
a material or structure formed from a loosely compacted mass of fragments or particles.
pieces of broken or crushed stone or gravel used to make concrete, or more generally in building and construction work.
formed or calculated by the combination of many separate units or items; total.
(of a group of species) comprising several very similar species formerly regarded as a single species.
denoting the total supply or demand for goods and services in an economy at a particular time.
form or group into a class or cluster.
collect (related items of content) so as to display or link to them.
"the council was an aggregate of three regional assemblies"
"the result put the sides even on aggregate"
"the aggregate amount of grants made"
"aggregate demand"
"the butterflies aggregate in dense groups"
"tools that aggregate data from all of the security devices are a good first step"
What were your aggregate wages last year?去年你的工资一共是多少?
The cause of unemployment was inadequate aggregate demand.失业的原因在于总需求不足。
Manager wants to know the aggregate sales in that market.经理想知道那个市场的总销售量。
The tax increases will, in the aggregate, cause much hardship.增加税收归结起来将造成很多困难。
The football team had a low goal aggregate last season.这支足球队上个赛季的进球总数很少。
This mixture of pozzolana and lime was then added to an aggregate.人们把火山灰与石灰的混合物加到集料中。
Occasionally the cells might aggregate to form lentoid bodies.偶而，细胞能聚集形成类晶体球体。
The television audience aggregated 30 millions.电视观众合计达3000万人。
The sum will aggregate a thousand dollars.总额共计一千元。

aid

[eɪd], [eɪd]


Image Search
n. 援助；帮助；救援；助手；辅助物
v. 辅助；援助；接济
help, typically of a practical nature.
financial or material help given to a country or area in need.
a person or thing that is a source of help or assistance.
a grant of subsidy or tax to a king.
help, assist, or support (someone or something) in the achievement of something.
promote or encourage (something).
Agency for International Development.
artificial insemination by donor.
"he saw the pilot slumped in his cockpit and went to his aid"
"700,000 tons of food aid"
"exercise is an important aid to recovery after heart attacks"
"women were aided in childbirth by midwives"
"diet and exercise aid healthy skin"
The regime has been propped up by foreign aid.该政权是靠外国援助维持着的。
Filled with fears all day long, he decided to seek the aid of a psychiatrist.他终日恐惧不安,决定寻求心理医生的帮助。
In his father's presidential race in 1988, George W. Bush became his father's aid.1988年在他父亲竞选总统时,小布什成为父亲的助手。
A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language.在学习一种新语言时,辞典是非常有用的工具。
We were greatly aided in our investigation by the cooperation of the police.我们在调查的过程中得到警方的大力协助。
This new medicine may aid your recovery.这种新药可以帮助你恢复健康。
He will go to aid those earthquake victims.他要去援助那些地震受害者。
The appealed for more money to aid the homeless.他们请求获得更多的资金来援助无家可归的人。
The government has taken prompt actions to aid the earthquake victims.政府即刻采取了行动救济地震灾民。
Engels aided Marx a lot in those difficult years.在那些艰难的岁月里,恩格斯慷慨地接济着马克思。

albeit

[ˌɔːl'biːɪt], [ˌɔːl'biːɪt]


Image Search
conj. 虽然(即使)
although.
"he was making progress, albeit rather slowly"
I tried, albeit unsuccessfully, to contact him.尽管未与他联系上，可是我已尽力而为了。
I hate him albeit he helped me.尽管他帮助过我，可是我还是恨他。
Answers may now be coming, albeit slowly.也许对此问题的答案就会揭晓，虽然慢了点。
Albeit fair, the girl was not sought after.那姑娘虽然漂亮,但不是被爱慕的女子。
Albeit he has failed twice, he is not discouraged.虽然失败了两次，但他并没有气馁。

alias

['eɪliəs], ['eɪliəs]


Image Search
n. 别名；化名
adv. 又被称为；另外地
used to indicate that a named person is also known or more familiar under another specified name.
indicating another term or synonym.
a false or assumed identity.
an alternative name or label that refers to a file, command, address, or other item, and can be used to locate or access it.
each of a set of signal frequencies that, when sampled at a given uniform rate, would give the same set of sampled values, and thus might be incorrectly substituted for one another when reconstructing the original signal.
misidentify (a signal frequency), introducing distortion or error.
"Eric Blair, alias George Orwell"
"the catfish—alias bullhead—is a mighty tasty fry-up"
"a spy operating under the alias Barsad"
The name is not an official host name or alias.该名称不是正式的主机名或别名。
It is not permitted for an alias to refer to another alias.不允许一个别名参考另一个别名。
He checked into the hotel under an alias.他用化名登记住进旅馆。
The thief's real name was John Smith, alias Edward Ball.这小偷的真名是约翰史密斯，化名叫爱德华鲍尔。

alibi

['æləbaɪ], ['æləbaɪ]


Image Search
n. 不在场证明或辩解；托辞
v. 辩解；找托辞开脱
a claim or piece of evidence that one was elsewhere when an act, typically a criminal one, is alleged to have taken place.
an excuse or pretext.
offer an excuse or defense for (someone), especially by providing an account of their whereabouts at the time of an alleged act.
make excuses.
"she has an alibi for the whole of yesterday evening"
"a catch-all alibi for failure and inadequacy"
"her friend agreed to alibi her"
"not once do I recall him whining or alibiing"
They've got nothing on me I've got an alibi.他们没抓我的罪证,我有不在现场的证据。
The false alibi threw the police off the scent.那个不在犯罪现场的伪证使警方失去了线索。
The alibi was fabricated by him.这种托辞是他臆造出来的。
I was disappointed that Cathy cooked up an alibi.我感到很失望的是凯瑟编造了一个托辞。

allegiance

[ə'liːdʒəns], [ə'liːdʒəns]


Image Search
n. 忠诚；效忠
loyalty or commitment of a subordinate to a superior or of an individual to a group or cause.
"those wishing to receive citizenship must swear allegiance to the republic"
The judge received their oath of allegiance.法官听取了他们的忠诚誓言。
Private members keep up their outward allegiance to the parties they belong to.议员们对各自所属的党派保持表面上的忠诚。
His allegiance has never been questioned.他的忠心是毫无疑问的。
The soldiers swore allegiance to their motherland.士兵们宣誓效忠于他们的祖国。
He abjured his allegiance to the king.他发誓不再效忠皇帝。

allocation

[ˌælə'keɪʃn], [ˌælə'keɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 分配；配置；安置
the action or process of allocating or distributing something.
an amount or portion of a resource assigned to a particular recipient.
"more efficient allocation of resources"
They said the allocation of seats was unfair.他们说席位的分配不公平。
Profits allocation is affected by many factors.摘要影响利益分配的因素是很多的。
Asset allocation is the key to achieving your goals.资产配置是实现你的目标的关键。
The companies merged to optimize the allocation of resources.为了优化资源配置，这几家公司并产了。
Market is an effective means in allocation of resources.摘要市场是配置资源的有效手段。
The regents of the planets and the stars have their allocation in the diagram of the temple and their images are carved on its walls.有控制力的行星和星体被安置在寺庙的图表里，而它们的图象也被刻在墙上。

alter

['ɔːltə(r)], ['ɔːltər]


Image Search
v. 改变；更改；阉割；切除卵巢
change or cause to change in character or composition, typically in a comparatively small but significant way.
make structural changes to (a building).
tailor (clothing) for a better fit or to conform to fashion.
castrate or spay (a domestic animal).
"Eliot was persuaded to alter the passage"
"plans to alter the dining hall"
"skirts with the hemlines altered a dozen different times"
But nothing can alter the facts.但任何东西也改变不了这些事实。
Alter Current Boot Record Serial Number.更改当前引导纪录序列号。
Marshaling the structure can transform the layout and alter the offset.封送结构可转换布局并更改偏移量。

alternative

[ɔːl'tɜːnətɪv], [ɔːl'tɜːrnətɪv]


Image Search
adj. 两者择一的；供选择的；非主流的
n. 二者择一；供替代的选择
(of one or more things) available as another possibility.
(of two things) mutually exclusive.
relating to behavior that is considered unconventional and is often seen as a challenge to traditional norms.
one of two or more available possibilities.
"the various alternative methods for resolving disputes"
"the facts fit two alternative scenarios"
"an alternative lifestyle"
"audiobooks are an interesting alternative to reading"
We have the alternative plans of having a picnic or taking a boat trip.我们在去野餐或者去乘船旅游两个计划中只能选一。
They are provided with the choice of two alternative flights.有两个航班可供他们选择。
I'd like to get some alternative music CDs for my niece.我想买一些非主流的音乐唱片给我侄女。
I had no alternative but to accept the offer.我除了接受该项提议之外，别无选择。

amalgamate

[ə'mælɡəmeɪt], [ə'mælɡəmeɪt]


Image Search
v. 合并；混合
combine or unite to form one organization or structure.
alloy (a metal) with mercury.
"he amalgamated his company with another"
"amalgamated zinc"
Our local brewery has amalgamated with another firm.我们本地的酿酒厂与另一个公司合并了。
There are plans to amalgamate the village school with a larger one nearby.有计划让乡村学校和附近一所规模较大的学校合并。

ambiguous

[æm'bɪɡjuəs], [æm'bɪɡjuəs]


Image Search
adj. 模棱两可的；含糊不清的
(of language) open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
unclear or inexact because a choice between alternatives has not been made.
"the question is rather ambiguous"
"this whole society is morally ambiguous"
He gave us an ambiguous answer .他给了我们一个模棱两可的答复。
In fact, your ambiguous words amount to a refusal.实际上,你说的那些模棱两可的话等于是拒绝。
Her account was deliberately ambiguous.她的陈述故意含混不清。
Why are you always so ambiguous about this problem?为什么你总是对这个问题含糊不清？

amble

['æmbl], ['æmbl]


Image Search
n. 溜蹄；缓行漫步
v. 缓行；溜蹄
walk or move at a slow, relaxed pace.
a walk at a slow, relaxed pace, especially for pleasure.
"they ambled along the riverbank"
"a peaceful riverside amble"
The horse is walking at an amble.这匹马正在溜蹄行走。
"Sure." I laugh, slowing to an easy amble.“当然可以，”我笑起来，减下步伐，慢慢地走。
He came ambling down the road.他沿路溜溜达达地来了.
Leakey is an infant, but old enough to amble through the canopy on his own.利基虽然是一个幼龄猩猩，但它也能在属于它自己的丛林上漫步。
Every evening,they amble along the bank.这匹马正在溜蹄行走。

amendment

[ə'mendmənt], [ə'mendmənt]


Image Search
n. 修正；修正案；改进
a minor change or addition designed to improve a text, piece of legislation, etc.
an article added to the US Constitution.
something which is added to soil in order to improve its texture or fertility.
"an amendment to existing bail laws"
"the First Amendment"
The amendment is an appendage of that contract.这个修改案是那个合同的附件。
The amendment will become effective next year.修正案将于明年生效。
That representative brought forth an amendment to the press law.那位代表提出了一项对新闻法的修正案。
He seemed to have resolved on amendment.他似乎已决心痛改前非。
The exporter may request an amendment.出口商可以要求改正。

amiable

['eɪmiəbl], ['eɪmiəbl]


Image Search
adj. 和蔼的；亲切的
having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.
"an amiable, unassuming fellow"
The amiable countenance of Mr. Pickwick was fast recovering its customary expression.匹克威克先生的和蔼的脸孔在很快地恢复着平常的表情。
The hostess received her friends with an amiable smile.女主人带着亲切的微笑迎接朋友们的到来。
You can sort out any differences you have in an amiable manner.你可以以温柔亲切的主式澄清所有的误会。

analogous

[ə'næləɡəs], [ə'næləɡəs]


Image Search
adj. 类似的
comparable in certain respects, typically in a way which makes clearer the nature of the things compared.
(of structures) performing a similar function but having a different evolutionary origin, such as the wings of insects and birds.
"they saw the relationship between a ruler and his subjects as analogous to that of father and children"
The human heart is analogous to a pump.人的心脏和泵类似。
Brains and computers are often considered analogous.人脑和电脑常被认为是类似的。

analysis

[ə'næləsɪs], [ə'næləsɪs]


Image Search
n. 分析；解析
detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.
the process of separating something into its constituent elements.
the identification and measurement of the chemical constituents of a substance or specimen.
the part of mathematics concerned with the theory of functions and the use of limits, continuity, and the operations of calculus.
short for psychoanalysis.
"statistical analysis"
"the procedure is often more accurately described as one of synthesis rather than analysis"
"samples are sent to the laboratory for analysis"
"other schools of analysis have evolved out of the original disciplines established by Freud"
His analysis of the problem showed great perception.他对该问题的分析显示出敏锐的洞察力。
We agreed with his acute analysis of the political situation.我们都同意他对政治形势的深刻分析。
Close analysis of sales figures showed clear regional variations.对销售额的仔细分析显示出明显的地区差别。
In the final analysis I think our sympathy lies with the heroine of the play.总之，我们认为我们都同情剧中的女主人公。
He had espoused the joint use of analysis and pure geometry.他赞成联合运用解析几何与纯粹几何。
Aircraft actuator system failure can be detected by analytic redundancy analysis.飞机舵机系统的机械故障可用解析余度法检测。

analyze

['ænəlaɪz], ['ænəlaɪz]


Image Search
vt. 分析；解析；研究
examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of (something, especially information), typically for purposes of explanation and interpretation.
discover or reveal (something) through detailed examination.
psychoanalyze (someone).
identify and measure the chemical constituents of (a substance or specimen).
resolve (a sentence) into its grammatical elements; parse.
"we need to analyze our results more clearly"
"I intend to analyze the sexism in such texts"
Can you analyze the structure of the sentence for me?你能给我分析一下这个句子的结构吗？
Let's analyze the problem and see what went wrong.让我们分析一下这道题，看什么地方出错了。
You should analyze the essence of the problem.你应该剖析问题的实质。
They will take the problem apart and analyze it.他们会深入剖析这个问题。
We must try to analyse the causes of the strike.我们得研究一下罢工的原因。

annual

['ænjuəl], ['ænjuəl]


Image Search
adj. 每年的；年度的；一年生的
n. 年刊；一年生植物
occurring once every year.
calculated over or covering a period of a year.
(of a plant) living for a year or less, perpetuating itself by seed.
a book or magazine that is published once a year under the same title but with different contents.
an annual plant.
"the sponsored walk became an annual event"
"an annual rate of increase"
"annual flowers"
"a Christmas annual"
"sow annuals in spring"
The firm has an annual turnover of $75 million.这家公司的年营业额为7500万美元。
Now, again, his annual trip to Paris begins.现在,他一年一度的巴黎之行又开始了。
The kind of plant is a hardy annual.这种植物是耐寒的一年生植物。
Annual or perennial herbs, or tall woody bamboos.一年生或多年生草本，或高的木质的竹子。
His essay is copied from a college annual.他的论文是从一本大学年刊上抄下来的。
Many garden plants are annuals.许多观赏植物都是一年生的。

anticipate

[æn'tɪsɪpeɪt], [æn'tɪsɪpeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 预期；提前使用；抢 ... 前
vi. 预言
regard as probable; expect or predict.
guess or be aware of (what will happen) and take action in order to be prepared.
look forward to.
act as a forerunner or precursor of.
come or take place before (an event or process expected or scheduled for a later time).
act before (someone) in expectation of what they will do; forestall.
"she anticipated scorn on her return to the theater"
"they failed to anticipate a full scale invasion"
"Stephen was eagerly anticipating the break from the routine of business"
"he anticipated Bates's theories on mimicry and protective coloration"
"I'm sorry, go on. I did not mean to anticipate you"
We anticipate that we will meet a certain amount of resistance to our plan.我们预料我们的计划会遇到一些人的反对。
I anticipate reading the book with great interest.我以极大的兴趣期待着读这本书。
It is unwise to anticipate your earnings by spending a lot of money.大量花钱提前使用自己的收入是不明智的。
They anticipate ours by just one month.他们比我们抢先了一个月。

anticipated

[æn'tɪsɪpeɪtɪd], [æn'tɪsɪpeɪtɪd]


Image Search
adj. 预期的；预先的
regard as probable; expect or predict.
guess or be aware of (what will happen) and take action in order to be prepared.
look forward to.
act as a forerunner or precursor of.
come or take place before (an event or process expected or scheduled for a later time).
act before (someone) in expectation of what they will do; forestall.
"she anticipated scorn on her return to the theater"
"they failed to anticipate a full scale invasion"
"Stephen was eagerly anticipating the break from the routine of business"
"he anticipated Bates's theories on mimicry and protective coloration"
"I'm sorry, go on. I did not mean to anticipate you"
What is your anticipated salary?你期望的月薪是多少?
We fortressed the city against the anticipated flood.我们加强了那个城市的防洪措施。
Notify the proper person well in advance of anticipated absences.如果不能来上课，请尽早通知相关负责人。
Ricky's anticipated arrival was a surprise also for Ronaldinho.卡卡的到达对罗纳尔迪尼奥来说是个惊喜。

apparent

[ə'pærənt], [ə'pærənt]


Image Search
adj. 明显的；表面上的
clearly visible or understood; obvious.
seeming real or true, but not necessarily so.
"it became apparent that he was talented"
"his apparent lack of concern"
It was apparent to all that he was guilty.众所周知，他是有罪的。
Japan's apparent lack of capitalist endeavour also has much to do with the lack of a mature financing market.显而易见,日本缺少资本家的创业精神,而这与日本没有一个成熟的融资市场也有很大关系。
She had many good qualities despite her apparent rudeness.她粗鲁是粗鲁，但还有许多优秀品质。
If she had inner doubts, it was not apparent to anyone else.她若心中生疑亦不形之于色。
She heard the news of his death with apparent unconcern.她听到他的死讯无动于衷。

apparently

[ə'pærəntli], [ə'pærəntli]


Image Search
adv. 表面上；似乎；显然
as far as one knows or can see.
"the child nodded, apparently content with the promise"
Beneath that apparently calm surface is a man of fierce temper.文静的外表掩盖着的是一个火暴脾气的人。
Apparently,he is weak,but he has hidden strength.表面上他看起来软弱，但他有隐藏的力气。
The judge distinguished between cases apparently similar.法官在表面上差不多的案件之间进行鉴别。
About 24 hours ago, I apparently got hit with it.大约24小时前,我与它似乎有击中。
Apparently it's going to rain today.今天似乎要下雨。
The speaker is apparently unaware(that) dogs are a public nuisance.发言人显然没有注意到，狗是一种社会公害。
Apparently they're intending to put up the price of water.看来他们要提高水费了。
Apparently he never wrote a letter to her.显然，他一封信也没给她写。
He was apparently much surprised at the news.他对那个消息显然感到十分惊异。

append

[ə'pend], [ə'pend]


Image Search
vt. 附加；添加
add (something) as an attachment or supplement.
"the results of the survey are appended to this chapter"
Append additional data to the file object.在文件对象中附加上其他数据。
If you hand in your report late, append a note explaining the reason for the delay.如果你的报告迟交了，附加一便条解释你迟交的原因。
We will append the picture separately.我们将分开添加图片。

appendix

[ə'pendɪks], [ə'pendɪks]


Image Search
n. 附录；附属物；阑尾
a tube-shaped sac attached to and opening into the lower end of the large intestine in humans and some other mammals.
a section or table of additional matter at the end of a book or document.
"a list of such activities was published as an appendix to the report"
There is an appendix at the back of the book.该书末尾处有一附录。
This is the appendix to the investigation report.这是调查报告的附件。
The details are clearly set out in an appendix.详细情况在一个附录里清楚列出。
He had his appendix taken out.他的阑尾割去了。
The doctor said the appendix is not important for us.那个大夫说阑尾对我们来说并不重要。

appliance

[ə'plaɪəns], [ə'plaɪəns]


Image Search
n. 器具；应用；装置；器械
a device or piece of equipment designed to perform a specific task, typically a domestic one.
an apparatus fitted by a surgeon or a dentist for corrective or therapeutic purpose.
the action or process of bringing something into operation.
"electrical and gas appliances"
"the appliance of science could increase crop yields"
The appliance carries a full-year guarantee.器具有一年的保证期。
These appliances are made of stainless iron.这些器具是用不锈钢制成的。
The appliance of electricity to household task makes housework much easier.电力应用于家务上使做家务事容易多了。
You'd better not install the appliance in a confined space.你最好不要把装置安装在密闭的地方。
The company offered the latest catalogue electrical appliance.那家公司提供了最新电力器械目录。

appreciate

[ə'priːʃieɪt], [ə'priːʃieɪt]


Image Search
vt. 欣赏；赏识；感激；领会；意识到
vi. 增值
recognize the full worth of.
be grateful for (something).
understand (a situation) fully; recognize the full implications of.
rise in value or price.
"she feels that he does not appreciate her"
"I'd appreciate any information you could give me"
"they failed to appreciate the pressure he was under"
"they expected the house to appreciate in value"
I really appreciate his complete absorption in his work.我很欣赏他对工作的极端专注。
I've decided to learn photography in order that I may better appreciate the beauty of nature.我决定学摄影以便能更好地欣赏自然的美。
Very few people really appreciate his works.没人赏识他的作品。
His talents are not fully appreciated in that company.他的才干在那家公司未受到充分赏识。
I deeply appreciate your concern.我非常感激你的关心。
I would greatly appreciate it if you would send me the application forms as soon as possible.若能尽快寄来申请表格,我将不胜感激。
It is at time like this that one really appreciates the kindness of a friend.只有在这样的时刻,一个人才会真正领会到朋友的深情厚意。
They failed to appreciate significance of the precautions.他们没有意识到这些预防措施的重要性。
Land will continue to appreciate.土地将继续增值。
Our house has appreciated by 50% in the last two years.在过去的两年中,我们的房子增值了50%25。

appreciation

[əˌpriːʃi'eɪʃn], [əˌpriːʃi'eɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 欣赏；感激；鉴识；评价；增值
recognition and enjoyment of the good qualities of someone or something.
gratitude.
a piece of writing in which the qualities of a person or the person's work are discussed and assessed.
sensitive understanding of the aesthetic value of something.
a full understanding of a situation.
increase in monetary value.
"I smiled in appreciation"
"they would be the first to show their appreciation"
"courses in music appreciation"
"the bank's lack of appreciation of their problems"
"the appreciation of the franc against the dollar"
She shows little appreciation of good music.她对于好音乐几乎没有欣赏能力。
An appreciation of art will enrich your life.艺术欣赏将会丰富你的生活
She grinned her appreciation of my help.她露齿一笑表示感激我的帮助。
Please accept this as a token of my appreciation.请接受这份表示感激的礼物。
There is an appreciation of the poet's work in the book.那本书中有对诗人作品的评论。
These shares show an appreciation of 10%.这些股票增值10%25。

approach

[ə'prəʊtʃ], [ə'proʊtʃ]


Image Search
v. 靠近；接近；接洽；要求；达到；动手处理
n. 途径；方法；接近；接洽；要求；路径；进场着陆；相似的事物
come near or nearer to (someone or something) in distance or time.
come near or nearer to (a future time or event).
(of a future time) come nearer.
come close to (a number, level, or standard) in quality or quantity.
bring nearer.
speak to (someone) for the first time about something, typically with a proposal or request.
start to deal with (something) in a certain way.
a way of dealing with something.
an act of speaking to someone for the first time about something, typically a proposal or request.
behavior intended to propose personal or sexual relations with someone.
the action of coming near or nearer to someone or something in distance or time.
an approximation to something.
the part of an aircraft's flight in which it descends gradually toward an airfield or runway for landing.
a road, sea passage, or other way leading to a place.
"the train approached the main line"
"he was approaching retirement"
"the time is approaching when you will be destroyed"
"the population will approach 12 million by the end of the decade"
"all those changes shall serve to approach him the faster to the blest mansion"
"the department had been approached about funding"
"one must approach the matter with caution"
"we need a whole new approach to the job"
"the landowner made an approach to the developer"
"feminine resistance to his approaches"
"the approach of winter"
"the past is impossible to recall with any approach to accuracy"
"the aircraft completed the approach and touched down"
"the eastern approach to the town"
He still had not the courage to approach her.他仍没有勇气靠近她。
Such people as are friendly are easy to approach.亲切之人容易接近。
She approached the bank for a loan.她向银行要求贷款。
There is no one who even approaches his talents.目前还没有谁的能力能与他媲美。
Workers, above all, will know how to approach the problem correctly .工人们最懂得怎样正确地处理这个问题。
Narration should become a basic approach to preschool education.叙事应是幼儿教育的基本途径。
I like her approach to the problem.我喜欢她解决这个问题的方法。
High walls forbid all approach.高墙遮断，难以接近。
The company makes an approach to the supermarket chain.该公司已与超级市场的联营店接洽。
They walked together slowly along the solitary and broken approach.他们正在顺着这条冷落的、支离破碎的路径往前走。
The airplane made a faulty landing approach.飞机着陆出错。
That's the nearest approach to an apology you'll get from him.那是他所能作出的最似歉意的表示。

appropriate

[ə'prəʊpriət ], [ə'proʊpriət]


Image Search
adj. 适当的；相称的
vt. 占用；拨出(款项)
suitable or proper in the circumstances.
take (something) for one's own use, typically without the owner's permission.
devote (money or assets) to a special purpose.
"a measure appropriate to a wartime economy"
"his images have been appropriated by advertisers"
"there can be problems in appropriating funds for legal expenses"
You will be informed of the details at the appropriate time.在适当的时候将把详情告诉你。
It is not easy to choose clothes which are appropriate to your beautiful figure.选择与你漂亮的体型相称的服装是不容易的。
She again entreated his forgiveness for so selfishly appropriating the cottage她为自己这么自私地占用了这座农舍而再次恳求他的原谅。
The government has appropriated some funds for education.政府拨出了一些款项用作教育基金。

approximated

[ə'prɒksɪmət], [ə'prɑːksɪmət]


Image Search
adj. 近似的；大约的
v. 接近；约等于
come close or be similar to something in quality, nature, or quantity.
estimate or calculate (a quantity) fairly accurately.
"a leasing agreement approximating to ownership"
"I had to approximate the weight of my horse"
This is just an approximate figure.这仅仅是个近似值。
We are entirely justified in using the approximate theory.我们用近似理论完全正当。
He spent approximate two hours searching the photo.他用了大约两小时来寻找这张照片.
The approximate number of students in the school is 300.这所学校的学生数大约为300人。
Production costs approximate to $100,000 .生产成本接近十万美元。
The color of the curtains approximates that of the rug.窗帘的颜色和地毯相近。
The cost of the project will approximate $10,000.这个项目的成本大约为一万美金。

arbitrary

['ɑːbɪtrəri], ['ɑːrbətreri]


Image Search
adj. 任意的；专制的；武断的；霸道的
based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
(of power or a ruling body) unrestrained and autocratic in the use of authority.
(of a constant or other quantity) of unspecified value.
"his mealtimes were entirely arbitrary"
"arbitrary rule by King and bishops has been made impossible"
My choice was quite arbitrary.我的选择相当随意。
I'm not used to your arbitrary standards.我不习惯你们那些随心所欲的标准。
Dictators are arbitrary rulers.独裁者即独断专横的统治者。
This is an arbitrary decision.这是个武断的决定。

area

['eəriə], ['eriə]


Image Search
n. 面积；地区，地段；区域；领域
a region or part of a town, a country, or the world.
a space allocated for a specific purpose.
a part of an object or surface.
the extent or measurement of a surface or piece of land.
a subject or range of activity or interest.
a sunken enclosure giving access to the basement of a building.
"rural areas of New Jersey"
"the dining area"
"areas of the body"
"the area of a triangle"
"the key areas of science"
"a bicycle padlocked to the area railing"
The farm has an area of 100 square kilometers.这个农场占地100平方公里。
The area of the office is 35 square meters.办公室的面积是35平方米。
This area has not been covered by the communication net.这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。
We are going to build a school in this area.我们准备在这个区域内建一所学校。
His special interest lies in the area of literature.他对文学领域特别感兴趣。

arid

['ærɪd], ['ærɪd]


Image Search
adj. 干燥的；不毛的；枯燥的；无趣的；没有生气的
(of land or a climate) having little or no rain; too dry or barren to support vegetation.
lacking in interest, excitement, or meaning.
"hot and arid conditions"
"his arid years in suburbia"
The broom grows down the arid sandhill.金雀草蔓延在干燥的沙丘下。
It is difficult to grow fruit in arid desert areas.在干燥的沙漠地带栽培水果很困难。
How can people make a living in this arid area?这片不毛之地上的人们怎么谋生呢？
The audience soon grew tired of his arid speech.没多久听众对他枯燥无味的演说就感到厌腻了。
He is tired of the arid studies that have produced nothing new.他对这些没有新意的枯燥乏味的研究感到厌倦。

arrears

[ə'rɪəz], [ə'rɪrz]


Image Search
n. 到期未付之债；拖欠的款项；待做的工作
名词arrear的复数形式.
money that is owed and should have been paid earlier.
"he was suing the lessee for the arrears of rent"
They were in arrears with their mortgage, so their home was repossessed.他们未按时还按揭贷款，所以房子被收回了。
I have fallen into arrears with my rent.我已经拖欠租金了。
As a result, the arrears stay unpaid.那些老板拖欠的工资至今尚未付清。
I have to clear off arrears of work and correspondence.我必须处理积压的工作和信件。
I'm in arrears with the housework.我的家务事还拖著呢。

ascent

[ə'sent], [ə'sent]


Image Search
n. 上升；上坡路；晋升；提升
a climb or walk to the summit of a mountain or hill.
an upward slope or path.
an instance of rising through the air.
a rise to an important position or a higher level.
"the first ascent of the Matterhorn"
"the ascent grew steeper"
"the first balloon ascent was in 1783"
"his ascent to power"
This was the third phase of his ascent.这是他上升的第三阶段。
They made a successful ascent of the mountain.他们成功地登上了山。
The last part of the ascent is very steep.最后一段上坡路很陡。
The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.这位老人攀登这条陡峭的上坡路有困难。
Getting ready for a slow ascent is more likely.作好准备慢慢地升迁的可能性更大。
His rapid ascent in the social scale was surprising.他的社会地位提高之迅速令人吃惊。
For if this occurred, it could interfere with the ascent of nature.因为如果这一切发生，就会妨碍大自然的提升。

aspects

['æspekts], ['æspekts]


Image Search
方面；方位；外观；外貌（aspect的复数）
a particular part or feature of something.
a specific way in which something can be considered.
a particular appearance or quality.
the positioning of a building or thing in a specified direction.
the side of a building facing a particular direction.
a particular position of a planet or other celestial body relative to another, as measured by angular distance.
a grammatical category or form that expresses the way in which time is denoted by the verb.
(of a planet) form an aspect with (another celestial body).
"the financial aspect can be overstressed"
"from every aspect, theirs was a changing world"
"the air of desertion lent the place a sinister aspect"
"a greenhouse with a southern aspect"
"the front aspect of the hotel was unremarkable"
"the sun in Aries formed an adverse aspect with Uranus in Capricorn"
"the semantics of tense and aspect"
"the sun is superbly aspected by your ruler Mars on the 19th"

assailant

[ə'seɪlənt], [ə'seɪlənt]


Image Search
n. 攻击者
a person who physically attacks another.
She was unable to get to grips with her assailant.她无力与袭击她的人扭打。
The doctor fought with his assailant until he ran away.医生和他的攻击者打起来，直到把那人打跑。

assembly

[ə'sembli], [ə'sembli]


Image Search
n. 集会；集合；议会；装配；与会者；聚集在一起的人；[计]汇编
a group of people gathered together in one place for a common purpose.
a group of people elected to make laws or decisions for a particular country or region, especially the lower legislative house in some US states.
the action of gathering together as a group for a common purpose.
a regular gathering of the teachers and students of a school.
a signal for troops to assemble, given by drum or bugle.
the action of fitting together the component parts of a machine or other object.
a unit consisting of components that have been fitted together.
the conversion of instructions in low-level code to machine code by an assembler.
"an assembly of scholars and poets"
"the Connecticut General Assembly"
"a decree guaranteeing freedom of assembly"
"catcalling occurred during the assembly"
"a car assembly plant"
"the tail assembly of the aircraft"
The assembly of students takes place in the auditorium.学生们在大礼堂举行集会。
He rang the bell for school assembly.他敲钟通知全校集合。
Each state had a governor and a state assembly.每一州都有一个州长和州议会。
Jack was assigned to the assembly shop of the factory.杰克被分配到厂里的装配间工作。
The former president addressed a large assembly.前总统向众多的与会者讲了话。
It has all the flexibility of assembly code. 它具备汇编语言的所有灵活性。

assessment

[ə'sesmənt], [ə'sesmənt]


Image Search
n. 评价；评估；评定
the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
"the assessment of educational needs"
His assessment of the situation was spot-on.他对形势判断得很正确。
Your assessment is substantially correct.你的估计基本正确。
It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth.这个评估很有道理，可能相当正确。
Continuous assessment is made of all students' work.对全体学生的功课作出连贯性的评定。

assigned

[ə'saɪnd], [ə'saɪnd]


Image Search
v. 分配；转让；把…归因于（assign的过去式和过去分词）
adj. 给定的；赋予的，已知的
allocate (a job or duty).
appoint (someone) to a particular job, task, or organization.
designate or set (something) aside for a specific purpose.
attribute something as belonging to.
transfer (legal rights or liabilities).
"Congress assigned the task to the agency"
"she has been assigned to a new job"
"managers happily assign large sums of money to travel budgets"
"it is difficult to decide whether to assign the victory to Goodwin"
"they will ask you to assign your rights against the airline"
They've assigned their best man to the job.他们选派了最合适的人做那项工作。
The task assigned, dangerous or otherwise, must be finished as scheduled.所指派的工作，危险或不危险，必须如期完成。
The professor was assigned headmaster of the school.教授被任命为这所学校的校长。
All the students are assigned to suitable jobs.所有的学生都分到了合适的工作。
Soon they assigned him to a new post.不久他们把他派到一个新的工作岗位上。
The teacher has assigned each of us a holiday task.教师给我们每个人都分配了假日的工作。
The two large classrooms have been assigned to us.这两间大教室已经分配给我们了。
They assigned his odd behavior to his ill health.他们把他的古怪行为归因于健康不佳。

assistance

[ə'sɪstəns], [ə'sɪstəns]


Image Search
n. 援助；帮助
the action of helping someone with a job or task.
the provision of money, resources, or information to help someone.
"the work was completed with the assistance of carpenters"
"plans offering financial assistance to employers"
We are ready to render them economic assistance.我们愿意向他们提供经济援助。
He gave the assistance to me when I was in trouble.我有麻烦时,他向我伸出援助之手。
You can not rely on his assistance.你不能指望他能帮助你。
I really appreciate your assistance.衷心感谢您的帮助。

assume

[ə'sjuːm], [ə'suːm]


Image Search
vt. 假定；设想；承担；(想当然的)认为；假装
suppose to be the case, without proof.
take or begin to have (power or responsibility).
seize (power or control).
take on (a specified quality, appearance, or extent).
take on or adopt (a manner or identity), sometimes falsely.
"you're afraid of what people are going to assume about me"
"he assumed full responsibility for all organizational work"
"the rebels assumed control of the capital"
"militant activity had assumed epidemic proportions"
"Oliver assumed an expression of penitence"
Let's assume it to be true.让我们假定这是真的。
We assume his guilt.我们假定他是有罪的。
They assumed their operational positions.他们设想了自己在实施中的作用。
I am not afraid to assume the responsibility.我不怕承担责任.
She was in arrogance to assume she would win every time.她认为每次都能赢，未免太自大了。

assumptions

[ə'sʌmpʃnz], [ə'sʌmpʃnz]


Image Search
n. 假设，臆测（名词assumption的复数形式）
a thing that is accepted as true or as certain to happen, without proof.
the action of taking or beginning to take power or responsibility.
the reception of the Virgin Mary bodily into heaven. This was formally declared a doctrine of the Roman Catholic Church in 1950.
the feast in honor of this, celebrated on August 15.
arrogance or presumption.
"they made certain assumptions about the market"
"the assumption of an active role in regional settlements"
These assumptions are clearly contrary to realism.这些假设显然是与现实不符的。
My assumptions about this show were wrong.我对这个表演的假设是错的。

assurance

[ə'ʃʊərəns], [ə'ʃʊrəns]


Image Search
n. 保证，担保；确信；自信；保险
a positive declaration intended to give confidence; a promise.
confidence or certainty in one's own abilities.
certainty about something.
insurance, specifically life insurance.
"he gave an assurance that work would not recommence until Wednesday"
"she drove with assurance"
"the crowd’s assurance of Joe’s guilt"
He gave me assurance in black and white.他给了我书面保证。
I have full assurance of his honesty.我完全相信他的诚实。
He gave me a definite assurance that the repairs would be finished tomorrow.他给我确切保证，修理将于明日完工。
They were waiting with assurance for me to discover the truth for myself.他们自信地等待我自己发现事实真相。

atmosphere

['ætməsfɪə(r)], ['ætməsfɪr]


Image Search
n. 大气；空气；气氛；气压
the envelope of gases surrounding the earth or another planet.
the air in any particular place.
a unit of pressure equal to mean atmospheric pressure at sea level, 101,325 pascals.
the pervading tone or mood of a place, situation, or work of art.
a pleasurable and interesting or exciting mood.
"part of the sun's energy is absorbed by the earth's atmosphere"
"we couldn't breathe in the dusty atmosphere of his apartment"
"the hotel is famous for its friendly, welcoming atmosphere"
"a superb restaurant, full of atmosphere"
The burning of fossil fuels results in the pollution of the atmosphere.矿物燃料的燃烧导致了大气污染。
The atmosphere of the city is very much polluted.那个城市的空气受到严重污染。
The atmosphere is very stuffy here and can we open a window?这里的空气很闷,咱们能打开一扇窗吗？
The atmosphere changed as soon as she walked in.她一进来气氛就变了。
The atmosphere over dinner was warm and friendly.用餐时洋溢著热情友好的气氛。
The atmosphere pressure gradient is an inverse measure of the spacing of the isobars on a weather map.气压梯度与天气图上等压线的间隔大小成反比。
The water droplets ejected by the gun expand in the atmosphere because it is at lower pressure than the air used to make the droplets.由于大气气压比造雪炮中气压低，雪炮中的水滴被喷射到空气中。

atrocity

[ə'trɒsəti], [ə'trɑːsəti]


Image Search
n. 暴行；残暴
an extremely wicked or cruel act, typically one involving physical violence or injury.
a highly unpleasant or distasteful object.
"war atrocities"
"the house was a split-level atrocity"
People were annoyed by his atrocity.他的暴行激怒了人们。
This atrocity shocked the world opinion.这暴行使全世界舆论感到震惊。
I am shocked by the atrocity of this man's crimes.这个人行凶手段残忍狠毒使我震惊。

joined, fastened, or connected to something.
full of affection or fondness.
married or having an established romantic or sexual partner; not single.

(of an organization or body) affiliated to another larger organization or body.
fasten; join.
fasten (a related document) to another, or to an email.
include (a condition) as part of an agreement.
join (someone or something) without being invited.
appoint (someone) for special or temporary duties.
attribute importance or value to.
(of importance or value) be attributed to.
seize (a person's property) by legal authority.
"please complete the attached form"
"during his visit, Mark became increasingly attached to Tara"

"I attach a copy of the memo for your information"
"the Commission can attach appropriate conditions to the operation of the agreement"
"they were all too ready to attach themselves to you for the whole day"
"I was attached to another department"
"he doesn't attach too much importance to radical ideas"
"great importance attaches to the family role"
"the court attached his wages for child support"
Fill in the attached form, and fax it off to us.填好随函所附的表格,并传真给我们。
This middle school is attached to a teachers' college.这所中学附属于一所师范院校。
He is deeply ~ to his father.他深爱着他父亲。
We've grown very attached to this village and wouldn't want to move.我们渐渐喜欢上了这个村庄，不想离开了。

attained

Image Search
v. 达到；获得

He attained perfection in landscape painting.他的山水画达到了炉火纯青的地步。
The colony has now attained nationality.这块殖民地现已获得独立。
Not by age but by character is wisdom attained.智慧获得不在年高，而在个性。
The colony has now attained nationality.这块殖民地现已获得独立。
Not by age but by character is wisdom attained.智慧获得不在年高，而在个性。

attitudes


Image Search
n. 态度
名词attitude的复数形式.
a settled way of thinking or feeling about someone or something, typically one that is reflected in a person's behavior.
a position of the body proper to or implying an action or mental state.
truculent or uncooperative behavior; a resentful or antagonistic manner.
individuality and self-confidence as manifested by behavior or appearance; style.
the orientation of an aircraft or spacecraft, relative to the direction of travel.
a position in which one leg is lifted behind with the knee bent at right angles and turned out, and the corresponding arm is raised above the head, the other extended to the side.
"she took a tough attitude toward other people's indulgences"
"the boy was standing in an attitude of despair, his chin sunk on his chest"
"I asked the waiter for a clean fork, and all I got was attitude"
"she snapped her fingers with attitude"
His attitudes toward him were out of envy.他对他的态度是因为嫉妒。
Those shifting attitudes bewilder me.那些犹豫不定的态度令我为难。
His social attitudes are being questioned.他的处世的态度受到质疑。
He was consistent in his attitudes.他的态度是前后一致的。

attributed

['ætrɪbjuːt], ['ætrɪbjuːt]


Image Search
vt. 把 ... 归于
n. 属性；标志；象征；特征
regard something as being caused by (someone or something).
ascribe a work or remark to (a particular author, artist, or speaker).
regard a quality or feature as characteristic of or possessed by (someone or something).
"he attributed the firm's success to the efforts of the managing director"
"the building was attributed to Frank Lloyd Wright"
"ancient peoples attributed magic properties to certain stones"
Most historians attribute such declines to wars and conquests.大多数的历史学家把这样的衰亡归于战争和征服。
Many people's success can be attributed to hard work and a bit of luck.很多人的成功都可以归于勤奋加上一点儿运气。
Public perception can also create a legal right for an attribute of a product.公众的认知也能为产品的某个属性创造法律权利。
The attribute that indicates that the same copy of a routine cannot be used by another task.一种属性，表示某一例行程序的同一副本不能被另一个任务使用。
A scepter is the attribute of power.权杖是权力的标志。
Lightning bolts are an attribute of Zeus.闪电是宙斯的象征
Grounding is a necessary attribute to ascension.根植是提升的必要特征。

author

['ɔːθə(r)], ['ɔːθər]


Image Search
n. 作家；作者
vt. 编写；创作
Author.
n. 上帝
a writer of a book, article, or report.
someone who writes books as a profession.
the writings of a professional author.
an originator or creator of something, especially a plan or idea.
be the author of (a book or piece of writing).
be the originator of; create.
"he is the author of several books on the subject"
"my favorite authors are Kurt Vonnegut and Aldous Huxley"
"I had to read authors I disliked"
"the authors of the peace plan"
"she has authored several articles on wildlife"
"the concept has been authored largely by insurance companies"
This book shows that he is an ingenious author.这本书表明他是一个有创造力的作家。
The book was translated without the sanction of the author.这本书未经作者许可就给翻译了。
The book is authored by six leading historians.这本书由六名权威的历史学家编写而成。
He authored two best-sellers.他写过两部畅销书。
God is the author and approver of sin, for sin is the accomplishment of His will.上帝是罪的始创者，罪既然成就上帝的旨意，因此是上帝喜悦的。
Through them you can vicariously enter into the experience of the author, gaining a fresh, new perspective on the vastness of God's creation and the depths of the human spirit.透过书本，你会进入作者的心灵世界，对上帝广大的创造，和人类精神的层次有新的体认。

authority

[ɔː'θɒrəti], [ə'θɔːrəti]


Image Search
n. 权力；官方；当局；职权；权威
the power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
the right to act in a specified way, delegated from one person or organization to another.
official permission; sanction.
a person or organization having power or control in a particular, typically political or administrative, sphere.
the power to influence others, especially because of one's commanding manner or one's recognized knowledge about something.
the confidence resulting from personal expertise.
a person with extensive or specialized knowledge about a subject; an expert.
a book or other source able to supply reliable information or evidence, typically to settle a dispute.
"he had absolute authority over his subordinates"
"military forces have the legal authority to arrest drug traffickers"
"the money was spent without congressional authority"
"the health authorities"
"he has the natural authority of one who is used to being obeyed"
"he hit the ball with authority"
"she was an authority on the stock market"
"the court cited a series of authorities supporting their decision"
The government is the highest authority in the country.政府是国家的最高权力机构。
Authorities say the fires do look suspicious.官方表示，火灾看起来确实很奇怪。
Both the authorities and the media wondered whether insider dealing had been going on.官方跟媒体都在怀疑这里面是不是存在内幕交易。
The authorities did not interfere with us.当局不干涉我们。
The new building must be financed by the local authority.新大楼的建筑资金必须由地方当局提供。
These documents ensure to you the authority you need .这些文件使你获得你需要的职权。
We see him as an authority on the subject.我们把他看作为这方面的权威。

authorize

['ɔːθəraɪz], ['ɔːθəraɪz]


Image Search
vt. 批准；委托；授权
give official permission for or approval to (an undertaking or agent).
"the government authorized further aircraft production"
The committee authorized the payment of the money.委员会批准该款之支付。
I've been authorized by the court to repossess this property.我得到法庭认可重新拥有这笔财产。
I have authorized him to act for me while I am away.我已经委托他当我不在的时候代我处理。
He confidentially authorized me to act for him while he was abroad.他信任地委托我在他出国期间代行他的职务。
The President authorized him to do that.总统授权他办那件事。

automatically

[ˌɔːtə'mætɪkli], [ˌɔːtə'mætɪkli]


Image Search
adv. 自动地；机械地
(with reference to a device or process) by itself with little or no direct human control.
(with reference to a firearm) continuously until the ammunition is exhausted or the pressure on the trigger is released.
without conscious thought or attention; spontaneously.
as a necessary and inevitable result of a fixed rule or particular set of circumstances.
"the kettle automatically switched off when it boiled"
"the recovered weapons had been illegally modified to fire fully automatically"
"although I used my best Italian, the receptionists automatically replied in English"
"his passport was automatically revoked"
The generator shuts off automatically.这台发动机能自动停止运转。
The supermarket doors shut automatically.超级市场的门是自动关的。
Pelting is done automatically by machines.剥皮是机器自动完成的。
Once installed, this heater operates automatically.一旦安装好以后，这加热器就会自动地运行。

available

[ə'veɪləbl], [ə'veɪləbl]


Image Search
adj. 可利用的；可得到的；有空的；有效的；<贬>【政】有资格的，适合的
able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
(of a person) not otherwise occupied; free to do something.
not currently involved in a sexual or romantic relationship.
"refreshments will be available all afternoon"
"the nurse is only available at certain times"
"the larger the pool of available singles the greater your chance of finding someone special"
Do you have a room available?你们有空房间吗？
The swimming pool is available only in summer.这个游泳池只在夏天开放。
All sorts of lamps are available in that shop.在那家商店可买到各式各样的灯具。
The Prime Minister was not available for comment.首相无暇作出评论。
When will the plumber be available?管道工什么时候有空?
This film ticket is no longer available.这张电影票不再有效。
The round trip ticket is available for two months.返程票两个月有效。

avalanche

['ævəlɑːnʃ], ['ævəlæntʃ]


Image Search
n. 雪崩；大量
v. 雪崩
a mass of snow, ice, and rocks falling rapidly down a mountainside.
a large mass of any material moving rapidly downhill.
a sudden arrival or occurrence of something in overwhelming quantities.
a cumulative process in which a fast-moving ion or electron generates further ions and electrons by collision.
(of a mass of snow, ice, and rocks) descend rapidly down a mountainside.
engulf or carry off by an avalanche.
undergo a rapid increase in conductivity due to an avalanche process.
"an avalanche of mud"
"we have had an avalanche of applications"
"the climbers were avalanched down the south face of the mountain"
The avalanche whelmed the small mountain village.雪崩淹没了小山村。
Three climbers are safe after the avalanche.雪崩过后，三个登山者平安无事。
He was buried by an avalanche and had to be dug out.他遇雪崩被埋住了，得把他挖出来。
What a precarious situation we were in when the avalanche started!雪崩发生的时候我们的处境多么危险啊！
They were killed by an avalanche in the Swiss Alps.他们在瑞士阿尔卑斯山的一次雪崩中罹难。
The editorial office received an avalanche of mail.编辑部收到大量的信件。
Higher still the snow was ready to avalanche.在更高处积雪随时都会崩塌。

avenge

[ə'vendʒ], [ə'vendʒ]


Image Search
vt. 为 ... 报复； 报仇
inflict harm in return for (an injury or wrong done to oneself or another).
inflict harm on behalf of (oneself or someone else previously wronged or harmed).
"his determination to avenge the murder of his brother"
"we must avenge our dead"
How was he to avenge the one without outraging the other?怎样才能为这一个进行报复而不冒犯那一个呢？
Avenge the slain forefather by vanquishing Major Duke.报复杀害的祖先主要由击败杜克。
He swore by Jupiter to avenge his father's death.他对天发誓，要给他爸爸报仇。
He will avenge the people on their oppressor.他将为人民向压迫者报仇。

[ə'weə(r)], [ə'wer]


Image Search

having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
