They issued a new edition of Lu Xun's works.他们发行了鲁迅著作的一个新版本。

eerie

['ɪəri], ['ɪri]


Image Search
adj. 怪诞的；可怕的；奇异的；害怕的
strange and frightening.
"an eerie green glow in the sky"
The eerie glow filled the cabin as the pressure built around them.当压力在他们周围建造的时候，怪诞的赤热装满了小屋。
The sky had an eerie yellow-orange hue, with the sun glowing behind a peculiar haze.天空呈现出怪诞的橘黄色调，太阳隐在一层奇异的雾霭后透出昏黄的光晕。
Near an ear, a nearer ear, a nearly eerie ear.靠近一只耳朵，一只近一些的耳朵，一只近乎可怕的耳朵。
So what's so eerie about this name?但这名字有什麽可怕的呢？
An eerie wind blew through the assembled throng.一阵奇异的风吹过拥挤的人群。
Churning mist adds an eerie ambiance to your Halloween table.搅动的薄雾给你的万圣节餐桌添加了一种奇异的气氛。

either

['aɪðə(r)], ['iðər]


Image Search
adj. 任一的；两方的
pron. 任一
adv. 也（用于否定句中）
conj. 或者（常用于either...or...的结构中）
used before the first of two (or occasionally more) alternatives that are being specified (the other being introduced by “or”).
used to indicate a similarity or link with a statement just made.
for that matter; moreover (used to add information).
one or the other of two people or things.
each of two.
"either I'll accompany you to your room, or I'll wait here"
"you don't like him, do you? I don't, either"
"I was too tired to go. And I couldn't have paid my way, either"
"there were no children of either marriage"
"the road was straight with fields of grass on either side"
The thief was put in the police car with a policeman on either side of him.窃贼被送到警车上，身旁各坐着一个警察。
You may take either of the roads.两条路你随便走哪一条。
It's not as heavy, either.这也不那么重。
If you do not go, I shall not go either.你不去，我也不去。
I will go on business either this week or next week.我将在这星期或下星期出差。
Either we will find a supply, or we will make the goods.我们或是寻求供货，或者自己制造。

elements

['elɪmənts], ['elɪmənts]


Image Search
n. 要素，元素；基本原则；恶劣天气
element的复数形式
a part or aspect of something abstract, especially one that is essential or characteristic.
a small but significant presence of a feeling or abstract quality.
the rudiments of a branch of knowledge.
a group of people of a particular kind within a larger group or organization.
an entity that is a single member of a set.
each of more than one hundred substances that cannot be chemically interconverted or broken down into simpler substances and are primary constituents of matter. Each element is distinguished by its atomic number, i.e., the number of protons in the nuclei of its atoms.
any of the four substances (earth, water, air, and fire) regarded as the fundamental constituents of the world in ancient and medieval philosophy.
one of the four substances (earth, water, air, or fire) considered as a person's or animal's natural environment.
the weather, especially strong winds, heavy rain, and other kinds of bad weather.
(in church use) the bread and wine of the Eucharist.
a part in an electric teapot, heater, or stove that contains a wire through which an electric current is passed to provide heat.
on some electric typewriters, a ball with raised letters that print when the keys are pressed.
"the death had all the elements of a great tabloid story"
"it was the element of danger he loved in flying"
"legal training may include the elements of economics and political science"
"extreme right-wing elements in the army"
"for the islanders, the sea is their kingdom, water their element"
"there was no barrier against the elements"
Water is composed of the elements hydrogen and oxygen.水是由氢元素和氧元素组成的。
What a sensational story! It has all the elements of a soap opera.多麽耸人听闻的事! 具备连续剧的一切要素。
The two elements are synthesized by a chemical process.这两种元素已经化学合成。
These are inactive elements.这些是惰性元素。
Honesty, industry and kindness are elements of a good life.诚实、勤劳和善良是幸福生活的要素。
Battle was joined, shortly after ten o'clock, with advance elements of two enemy divisions.10点钟过后不久，就同敌方两个师的先遣部队接上了火。
If the atoms of all these elements just stayed apart from each other, there be only about105 different things in the world.如果所有这些元素的原子都彼此不组合的话，世界上大约就只有105种不同的东西了。
You must understand the elements of mathematics before we can proceed further.你必须先弄懂数学基础知识，我们才能进一步学习。

eliminate

[ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt], [ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt]


Image Search
v. 除去；剔除；忽略；淘汰
completely remove or get rid of (something).
exclude (someone or something) from consideration.
murder (a rival or political opponent).
exclude (a person or team) from further participation in a sporting competition following defeat or inadequate results.
remove (a variable) from an equation, typically by substituting another that is shown by a different equation to be equivalent.
generate or remove (a simple substance) as a product in the course of a reaction involving larger molecules.
expel (waste matter) from the body.
"a policy that would eliminate inflation"
"the police have eliminated Larry from their inquiries"
"security agents have started a campaign to eliminate some of the government's opponents"
"the Bears were eliminated from the playoffs in the first round"
You must eliminate an unknown quantity.你必须消去一个未知数。
Let us eliminate all uncertain on thought.让我们从思想上消除一切疑惑。
We must eliminate unnecessary steps and get directly to the point.我们必须忽略不必要的步骤,直接切入主题。
Their team was eliminated in the first round.他们队在第一轮就被淘汰了。

elusive

[i'luːsɪv], [i'luːsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 难懂的；难捉摸的；难找的；逃避的
difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
difficult to remember or recall.
"success will become ever more elusive"
"the elusive thought he had had moments before"
Number is a crucial but elusive concept in English teaching and learning.数是英语教学中的一个关键而又难以捉摸的概念。
The Abominable Snowman who haunts the imagination of climbers in the Himalayas is hardly more elusive.常使喜马拉雅山的攀登者浮想联翩的雪人也不比此更难以捉摸。
Men like to pursue an elusive woman, like a cake of wet soap in a bathtub- even men who hate bath.男人们喜欢追逐那些象浴缸里的湿肥皂般难以捉摸的女人，即使是讨厌洗澡的男人也无不如此。
He spent a year prospecting for the elusive metal.他花了一年的功夫去勘探那种很难到手的金属。
Interpol have searched all the corners of the earth for the elusive hijackers.国际刑警组织已在世界各地搜查在逃的飞机劫持者。

emerged

[i'mɜːdʒ], [i'mɜːrdʒ]


Image Search
vi. 浮现；(由某种状态)脱出；(事实)显现出来
move out of or away from something and come into view.
become apparent, important, or prominent.
(of facts or circumstances) become known.
recover from or survive a difficult or demanding situation.
(of an insect or other invertebrate) break out from an egg, cocoon, or pupal case.
"black ravens emerged from the fog"
"Philadelphia has emerged as the clear favorite"
"reports of a deadlock emerged during preliminary discussions"
"the economy has started to emerge from recession"
A wonderful idea emerged in my mind.我的脑海里浮现出一个极妙的想法。
Man has gradually emerged from barbarism into civilization over the long history.在悠久的历史长河中人类逐渐脱离野蛮状态而进入文明。
Many facts emerged as a result of the investigation.调查结果,许多事实暴露出来。

emphasis

['emfəsɪs], ['emfəsɪs]


Image Search
n. 强调；重点；[语]加强语气
special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
stress laid on a word or words to indicate special meaning or particular importance.
vigor or intensity of expression.
"they placed great emphasis on the individual's freedom"
"he spoke with emphasis and with complete conviction"
They put emphasis on making to quota this quarter.他们强调要达到这一季的配额。
Our English course places great emphasis on conversational skills.我们的英语课程非常重视会话技能。
In recent years, the emphasis has moved away from punishing drug addicts towards helping them.最近几年,重点从惩罚吸毒者转移到救助他们。
You put too much emphasis on the last syllable.你把最后一个音节读得太重。

empirical

[ɪm'pɪrɪkl], [ɪm'pɪrɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 经验主义的；以观察或实验为根据的
based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
"they provided considerable empirical evidence to support their argument"
His science was generally empirical and often bad.他的科学一般来自经验。
Inquiry into the nature of things based on logical reasoning rather than empirical methods.自然科学基于逻辑推理而不是凭经验得来的方法来探究事物的本质。
Unboundedness has a greater empirical credibility.无界性有更大的经验可信性。
The Sprint phase is an empirical process.冲刺阶段是一个完全根据经验的过程。
He is involved in an empirical study.他参与了一项实验研究。

employee

[ɪm'plɔɪiː], [ɪm'plɔɪiː]


Image Search
n. 雇员
a person employed for wages or salary, especially at nonexecutive level.
This employee was dismissed for laziness.这名雇员因为懒惰而被解雇。
Their situations are now reversed as employee has become employer.他们双方的地位转换了，雇员成了雇主。
The boss struck off 100 dollars from the salary of the employee as fine.老板从这个雇员的工资里扣除100美元作为罚款。

empower

[ɪm'paʊə(r)], [ɪm'paʊər]


Image Search
vt. 授权；使能够
give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
"nobody was empowered to sign checks on her behalf"
"movements to empower the poor"
The lawyer was empowered to pay all her bills.律师已被授权偿付她的一切帐单。
The new laws empower the police to stop anybody in the street.新法令授予警察可以在街上截停任何人的权利。
The new laws empower the police to search private house.新的法律使警察得以搜查私人住宅。
Modern science and technology empower human beings to control natural forces more effectively.现代科学技术使人类能更有效地制服自然。

enable

[ɪ'neɪbl], [ɪ'neɪbl]


Image Search
vt. 使能够；使可能
give (someone or something) the authority or means to do something.
make possible.
make (a device or system) operational; activate.
"the evidence would enable us to arrive at firm conclusions"
"a number of courses are available to enable an understanding of a broad range of issues"
Listening to music enables us to feel relaxed.听音乐能使我们放松。
A dog's ears enable it to hear the least sound.狗的耳朵使它能听到极细微的声音。
This train will enable me to get there in time.这列火车能使我及时到达那儿。
Hobbies may enable you to make many friends.业余爱好能够使你结识很多朋友.
Training will enable you to find a job.培训将使你找到工作。

encompass

[ɪn'kʌmpəs], [ɪn'kʌmpəs]


Image Search
vt. 围绕；包围；包括；完成
surround and have or hold within.
include comprehensively.
cause (something) to take place.
"a vast halo encompassing the Milky Way galaxy"
"no studies encompass all aspects of medical care"
"an act designed to encompass the death of the king"
The prison is encompassed by high walls.监狱被高墙围绕着。
The voices of people and sounds of cars encompass his path.他在路上听见四面八方都是人声车声。
The general arts at the university encompass a wide range of subjects.大学文科包括的科目非常广泛。

encounter

[ɪn'kaʊntə(r)], [ɪn'kaʊntər]


Image Search
n. 意外的相见；邂逅；遭遇
v. 遭遇；遇到；偶然碰到
unexpectedly experience or be faced with (something difficult or hostile).
meet (someone) unexpectedly.
an unexpected or casual meeting with someone or something.
a confrontation or unpleasant struggle.
"we have encountered one small problem"
"his close encounter with death"
If both participate, it may be an actual encounter of bodiless consciousness.如果是双向的，这会是一个真实的与灵魂的相见。
A fortunate encounter brought us together.一次幸运的邂逅使我们相识。
It was a bloody encounter between the two armies.这是那两军之间的一次激烈的遭遇战。
Don't be afraid to encounter risks.不要害怕遭遇危险。
Otherwise, we will encounter grave difficulties.否则便将遇到极大的困难。
I encountered an old friend at Rome.我在罗马邂逅了一个老朋友。

encountered

[ɪn'kaʊntəd], [ɪn'kaʊntəd]


Image Search
adj. 遇到的；遭遇的
动词encounter的过去式和过去分词.
unexpectedly experience or be faced with (something difficult or hostile).
meet (someone) unexpectedly.
"we have encountered one small problem"
The first person she encountered was Mr. Smith.她遇到的第一个人是史密斯先生。
The record encountered by this database operation is not an object.数据库操作遇到的记录不是一个对象。
Her range of weaponry could easily decimate any convoy she encountered.她强大的武器装备可以轻易地让任何和她遭遇的护航舰队灰飞烟灭。
Ok, to its credit the River of Fire was appropriate, and all the demons we encountered were very cool.好吧，其实那火焰之河还是很衬景的，而且我们一路上遭遇的那些恶魔们也很酷。

endanger

[ɪn'deɪndʒə(r)], [ɪn'deɪndʒər]


Image Search
vt. 危及；危害
put (someone or something) at risk or in danger.
"he was driving in a manner likely to endanger life"
It was foolish to endanger your life in that way.用那种方式危及你的生命是愚蠢的。
Development of the area would endanger wildlife.开发这一地区将会危及到野生生物。
Overworking can endanger your health.工作过度可能会危害你的健康。
He did it in the knowledge that it might endanger his life.他做那件事时知道它可能危害他的生命。

energy

['enədʒi], ['enərdʒi]


Image Search
n. 精力；活力；能源
the strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity.
a person's physical and mental powers, typically as applied to a particular task or activity.
power derived from the utilization of physical or chemical resources, especially to provide light and heat or to work machines.
the property of matter and radiation which is manifest as a capacity to perform work (such as causing motion or the interaction of molecules).
a degree or level of energy possessed by something or required by a process.
"changes in the levels of vitamins can affect energy and well-being"
"a collision in which no energy is transferred"
"gamma rays at different energies"
Young people usually have more energy than the old.青年人通常比老年人精力充沛。
Don't waste your time and energy on trifles.别把你的时间和精力浪费在琐事上。
Auckland is a city full of energy.奥克兰是个充满活力的城市。
The industry felt the effects of the energy crisis.该工业受到能源危机的影响。
He gave a lecture on the use of solar energy.他就太阳能的利用作了一场讲演。

enforcement

[ɪn'fɔːsmənt], [ɪn'fɔːsmənt]


Image Search
n. 执行；强制；实施
the act of compelling observance of or compliance with a law, rule, or obligation.
"the strict enforcement of environmental regulations"
The police are responsible for the enforcement of the law.警察负责执法。
Effective enforcement can only flow from good laws.要有效地执行知识产权权利，就必定要有完善的法律。
The enforcement of compulsory pilotage shall be stipulated by MOTC by order.强制引水之实施，由交通部以命令定之。
Some countries stress the enforcement powers laid down by Chapter VII.一些国家重点强调第七章规定的强制权力。
Law enforcement cannot responsibly stand aloof.实施法律不能袖手旁观。
The enforcement of this law will clear the way for further reform.该项法律的实施将进一步扫除改革的障碍。

engage

[ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ], [ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ]


Image Search
v. 雇佣；啮合；与……交战；答应；订婚；预定；参加；从事
occupy, attract, or involve (someone's interest or attention).
cause someone to become involved in (a conversation or discussion).
arrange to employ or hire (someone).
pledge or enter into a contract to do something.
reserve (accommodations, a place, etc.) in advance.
participate or become involved in.
establish a meaningful contact or connection with.
(with reference to a part of a machine or engine) move into position so as to come into operation.
(of fencers or swordsmen) bring (weapons) together preparatory to fighting.
enter into conflict or combat with (an enemy).
(of a writer, artist, or their works) morally committed to a particular aim or cause.
"he plowed on, trying to outline his plans and engage Sutton's attention"
"he was engaged as a trainee copywriter"
"he engaged to pay them $10,000 against a bond"
"he had engaged a small sailboat"
"organizations engage in a variety of activities"
"the teams needed to engage with local communities"
"the clutch will not engage"
The restaurant decide to engage a pop singer.餐馆决定雇用一名流行歌手。
If the big gear did not engage with the small one,the machine would refuse to work.如果大齿轮与小齿轮不相啮合的话，机器就不会工作。
Our orders are to engage (the enemy) immediately.我们的命令是立即(与敌军)开战。
I will engage to manage the business if you will engage to provide the capital.如果你答应出资本，我答应经管这个生意。
Jack and Anne are engaged.杰克和安妮订婚了。
I have engaged a room at this hotel.我已经在这个旅馆里预订了一个房间。
I have no time to engage in the debate.我没时间参加辩论。
Is it wise to engage in active sports at your age?我这样的年纪积极参加体育活动是否明智？
They engage in the study of music.他们从事音乐研究。
Those who engage in mental work are also workers.从事脑力劳动的人也是劳动者。

engulf

[ɪn'ɡʌlf], [ɪn'ɡʌlf]


Image Search
vt. 吞没；席卷；吞噬
(of a natural force) sweep over (something) so as to surround or cover it completely.
eat or swallow (something) whole.
"the cafe was engulfed in flames"
"the toad can engulf nestling birds"
The waves engulfed the boat.大浪吞没了小舟。
The stormy sea engulfed the small motor sailboat.汹涌的大海吞没了那艘小机帆船。
The country was engulfed in civil war.该国陷入内战。
A wave of grief engulfed them.一阵悲伤吞噬了他们。

enhanced


Image Search
adj. 加强的；提高的
动词enhance的过去式和过去分词形式.
intensify, increase, or further improve the quality, value, or extent of.
"his refusal does nothing to enhance his reputation"
To be sure, these enhanced penetration concepts could be applied to nuclear munitions as well.当然，这类加强的钻地技术同样可应用在核弹上。
Even though the weather systems are intensifying and governments do involve themselves with trying to control weather, still dear ones everything is enhanced and in Divine Order.即使天气系统强化和政府它们自己试图努力控制天气，但是亲爱的朋友一切是提高的并且在神性的秩序里。
Mahler was, like Bruckner, the bearer of a transcendental mission, a spiritual sage and guide, master of an inspired tonal language enriched and enhanced by himself.马勒和布鲁克纳一样，肩负着灵界的高尚使命，是一位精神上的智者和向导，一位不断自我丰富与提高的通灵的音乐语言大师。

enigma

[ɪ'nɪɡmə], [ɪ'nɪɡmə]


Image Search
n. 难以理解的事物；谜；谜一般的人
a person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
I've known him for many years, but he remains something of an enigma to me.我与他相识多年，他仍然难以捉摸。
It is an enigma to me.它对我来说是个迷。
It is the enigma of life itself that you desire me to solve.你要我解决的是人生之谜。
Faraway space is an enigma to people.遥远的太空对人类来说是一个谜。
The queer behavior of the child was an enigma, even to its parents.那个孩子古怪的行为，甚至对其父母亲来说都是个谜。
He is an enigma to all of us.对我们而言，他是个神秘莫测的人物。
She never yielded and never became an enigma.她从不屈服，从来没有成为一个不可思议的人。

enormous

[ɪ'nɔːməs], [ɪ'nɔːrməs]


Image Search
adj. 巨大的；庞大的
very large in size, quantity, or extent.
"the possibilities are enormous"
Long ago enormous animals lived on the earth.很久以前，地球上生活着巨大的动物。
She stood alone on the enormous stage.她孤零零地站在巨大的舞台上。
They overlooked the enormous risks involved.他们忽略了暗含的巨大危险。
The sight of such an enormous crowd astonished us.看到如此庞大的人群我惊讶万分。
I was enormous when I was carrying my first baby.我怀头胎的时候非常胖。

ensure

[ɪn'ʃʊə(r)], [ɪn'ʃʊr]


Image Search
vt. 担保；保证；使安全；确保
make certain that (something) shall occur or be the case.
make certain of obtaining or providing (something).
make sure that (a problem) shall not occur.
"the client must ensure that accurate records be kept"
"she would ensure him a place in society"
We have worked closely with the Deaf community first, on passage of ADA, and most recently, to ensure that the Act is enforced.我们最近经常在ada路边的聋人社会附近工作，可以担保该法案得到了实施。
I can't ensure that he will be there on time.我不能担保他会及时到那儿。
This medicine will ensure you a good night's sleep.这药保证能让你好好睡一觉。
People should wash regularly to ensure personal hygiene.人们应经常洗澡以保证个人卫生。
The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies.医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。
We must ensure the purity of drinking water.我们必须确保饮用水的纯净。
If you want to ensure that you catch the plane, take a taxi.你要想确保能赶上那班飞机，就坐出租车去吧。

entities

['entəti], ['entəti]


Image Search
n. 实体；存在；本质
a thing with distinct and independent existence.
existence; being.
"Church and empire were fused in a single entity"
"entity and nonentity"
A corporation is treated by the law as an entity.法人在法律上被视为一个实体。
It describes the change in an entity's state.它描述了一个实体的状态变化。

enumerate

[ɪ'njuːməreɪt], [ɪ'nuːməreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 数；列举；枚举
mention (a number of things) one by one.
establish the number of.
"there is not space to enumerate all his works"
"the 2000 census enumerated 10,493 households in the county"
We found more children at the circus than we could enumerate.我们见到数不清的孩子在看马戏。
Can you enumerate the capitals of the50 states?你能把五十州的首府列举出来吗？
Let me enumerate many flaws in your hypothesis.让我列举你前提中的许多谬误。
Provide the path of the root folder to enumerate.提供要枚举的根文件夹的路径。
An error occurred while trying to enumerate all available policies.试图枚举所有可用的策略时出错。

environment

[ɪn'vaɪrənmənt], [ɪn'vaɪrənmənt]


Image Search
n. 环境；外界
the surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
the setting or conditions in which a particular activity is carried on.
the overall structure within which a user, computer, or program operates.
the natural world, as a whole or in a particular geographical area, especially as affected by human activity.
"a good learning environment"
"a desktop development environment"
She is not used to the new environment.她对新环境不习惯。
We are required by environment protecting department to use anthracite.环保部门要求我们使用无烟煤。
At one time, children didn't have to learn any more than how to cope with their physical environment.曾经有一段时间,儿童除了学习适应外界环境以外,什么都不学。

epic

['epɪk], ['epɪk]


Image Search
n. 史诗；叙事诗
adj. 史诗的；叙事诗的；宏大的；壮丽的
a long poem, typically one derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the history of a nation.
the genre of epic poems.
a long film, book, or other work portraying heroic deeds and adventures or covering an extended period of time.
relating to or characteristic of an epic or epics.
heroic or grand in scale or character.
particularly impressive or remarkable.
"the romances display gentler emotions not found in Greek epic"
"a Hollywood biblical epic"
"England's national epic poem Beowulf"
"his epic journey around the world"
"the gig last night was epic"
That movie was an epic about the Roman Empire.那电影是一部有关罗马帝国的史诗般的作品。
The Odyssey is an epic of ancient Greece.《奥德塞》是古希腊的一首史诗。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
It is perhaps the best of epic fantasies.这也许是史诗奇幻小说中最好的。
Scott described the making of an epic film.斯科特介绍了这一史诗般影片的制作过程。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
These epic processes melted and reprocessed vast amounts of rock and concentrated chemical elements in new ways.在这个宏大的过程中，岩石被融化，再生，以新方式聚集化学元素。

equation

[ɪ'kweɪʒn], [ɪ'kweɪʒn]


Image Search
n. 相等；均衡；方程式；等式
a statement that the values of two mathematical expressions are equal (indicated by the sign =).
the process of equating one thing with another.
a situation or problem in which several factors must be taken into account.
a symbolic representation of the changes which occur in a chemical reaction, expressed in terms of the formulae of the molecules or other species involved.
"the equation of science with objectivity"
"money also came into the equation"
The equation of wealth with happiness can be dangerous.把财富与幸福等同起来是很危险的
I can't make this equation come out.我不会解这个方程式。
What does x represent in this equation?这个方程式中的x代表什么?
The professor wrote an equation on the blackboard.教授在黑板上写了一个等式。

equipment

[ɪ'kwɪpmənt], [ɪ'kwɪpmənt]


Image Search
n. 设备；装备；器材
the necessary items for a particular purpose.
the process of supplying someone or something with items necessary for a particular purpose.
mental resources.
a man's genitals.
"office equipment"
"the construction and equipment of new harbor facilities"
"they lacked the intellectual equipment to recognize the jokes"
The government has an interest in importing scientific equipment.政府对引进科学设备非常感兴趣。
We should make a better use of the existing equipment.我们应该更好地利用现有设备。
The equipment must be bought from a supplier approved by the company.设备必须从公司认可的供应商那里购买。
The Army is auctioning off a lot of old equipment.军队正在把大量旧装备拍卖掉。
I tried to fix the equipment but I failed.我想把机器修理好，但是失败了。

equivalent

[ɪ'kwɪvələnt], [ɪ'kwɪvələnt]


Image Search
adj. 等价的 相等的
n. 相等物
equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
having the same or a similar effect as.
belonging to the same equivalence class.
a person or thing that is equal to or corresponds with another in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
the mass of a particular substance that can combine with or displace one gram of hydrogen or eight grams of oxygen, used in expressing combining powers, especially of elements.
"one unit is equivalent to one glass of wine"
"some regulations are equivalent to censorship"
"the French equivalent of the FBI"
Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word `home'?法语中有没有和英语home完全一样的对应词?

erosion

[ɪ'rəʊʒn], [ɪ'rəʊʒn]


Image Search
n. 腐蚀；侵蚀；减少，流失
the process of eroding or being eroded by wind, water, or other natural agents.
the gradual destruction or diminution of something.
the gradual destruction of tissue or tooth enamel by physical or chemical action.
a place where surface tissue has been gradually destroyed.
"the problem of soil erosion"
"the erosion of support for the party"
"patients with gastric erosions"
Therefore, the corrosion was caused by erosion of rainwater during ocean shipping.因此，这些腐蚀是海运途中雨水的浸蚀造成的。
The erosion of beach here is serious.这里海岸的腐蚀很严重。
The cement petrified after many years' erosion.经过多年的侵蚀，水泥石化了。
The erosion of the soil is damaging the forest.土壤侵蚀使得森林遭到了破坏。
Deposition is the counterpart of erosion.淤积是侵蚀的对应面。
The rock is resistant to weathering and erosion.这种岩石不易风化和侵蚀。

error

['erə(r)], ['erər]


Image Search
n. 错误；过失；误差；谬误
a mistake.
the state or condition of being wrong in conduct or judgment.
a misplay by a fielder that allows a batter to reach base or a runner to advance.
a measure of the estimated difference between the observed or calculated value of a quantity and its true value.
a mistake of fact or of law in a court's opinion, judgment or order.
"spelling errors"
"the crash was caused by human error"
"the decisions of the appeal committee disclosed no error of law"
He overlooked a spelling error on the first page.他没有看出第一页中有个拼写错误。
An alert listener will have noticed the error.耳朵尖的人能听出这个错。
Every man is liable to error.人人都可能犯错误。
The accident was caused by human error.这宗事故是人为过失造成的。
Human error invoked the disaster.人的过失带来灾难。
Error analysis of the measurement system is given.给出了次测量系统的误差分析。
After several repetitions there still remains an error.重复数次之后仍然存在误差。
Custom without reason is but ancient error.习俗没有道理，古代谬误而已。
Divination is made up of a little error and superstition, plus a lot of fraud.占卜是由一些谬误和迷信构成，再加上大量的欺骗。

established

[ɪ'stæblɪʃt], [ɪ'stæblɪʃt]


Image Search
adj. 确定的；建立的；制定的
动词establish的过去式和过去分词形式.
having been in existence for a long time and therefore recognized and generally accepted.
(of a plant) having taken root; growing well.
(of a church or religion) recognized by the government as the national church or religion.
set up (an organization, system, or set of rules) on a firm or permanent basis.
initiate or bring about (contact or communication).
achieve permanent acceptance or recognition for.
introduce (a character, set, or location) into a film or play and allow its identification.
show (something) to be true or certain by determining the facts.
ensure that one's remaining cards in (a suit) will be winners (if not trumped) by playing off the high cards in that suit.
"the ceremony was an established event in the annual calendar"
"the British established a rich trade with Portugal"
"the two countries established diplomatic relations"
"the principle of the supremacy of national parliaments needs to be firmly established"
"establish the location with a wide shot"
"the police established that the two passports were forgeries"
She is reading a book that challenges established beliefs.她在读一本对确定的信念表示异议的书籍。
Each article was then reviewed, abstracted, and classified using an established evidence scoring system.利用确定的证据评分体系对每一篇文章复习、摘要、分类。
They adhere to the accepted or traditional and established faith.他们坚守被接受的或传统的和业已建立的信念。
Established rights are to be respected.既定权力必受尊重。
Established practices are difficult to modify.既定的惯例是很难更改的。

estate

[ɪ'steɪt], [ɪ'steɪt]


Image Search
n. 财产；遗产；房地产；状态；庄园
an extensive area of land in the country, usually with a large house, owned by one person, family, or organization.
a housing or commercial development.
a property where coffee, rubber, grapes, or other crops are cultivated.
all the money and property owned by a particular person, especially at death.
a class or order regarded as forming part of the body politic, in particular (in Britain), one of the three groups constituting Parliament, now the Lords spiritual (the heads of the Church), the Lords temporal (the peerage), and the Commons. They are also known as the three estates.
a particular class or category of people in society.
a particular state, period, or condition in life.
"in his will, he divided his estate between his wife and daughter"
"the spiritual welfare of all estates of men"
"programs for the improvement of man's estate"
The residue of estate belongs to his son.剩余财产属于他的儿子。
He settled part of his estate on his son.他把部分财产转让给儿子了。
The old man left an estate of two million dollars when he died.那老人去世时留下二百万美元的遗产。
He owns a large estate in Scotland.他在苏格兰有大量地产。
There is no reason to believe that people of every estate will support the political platform.没有理由相信社会各阶层的人都会拥护这个政纲。
He has a beautiful estate near London.他在离伦敦不远处有一个美丽的庄园。

estimate

['estɪmət], ['estɪmət]


Image Search
n. 估价；估计
v. 估计；估价；评价
roughly calculate or judge the value, number, quantity, or extent of.
an approximate calculation or judgment of the value, number, quantity, or extent of something.
a written statement indicating the likely price that will be charged for specified work or repairs.
a judgment of the worth or character of someone or something.
"the aim is to estimate the effects of macroeconomic policy on the economy"
"at a rough estimate, our staff is recycling a quarter of the paper used"
"compare costs by getting estimates from at least two firms"
"his high estimate of the poem"
This is an outside estimate of the price.这是最高的估价。
Your estimate was rejected by the seller.你的估价单被卖家回绝了。
This is a safe estimate.这是个有把握的估计。
We need to make an accurate estimate beforehand.我们需要事先作出准确的估计。
I estimate it will take three months to build the bridge .我估计建造这座桥得用3个月时间。
Statisticians can estimate the highest expected winds.统计人员能估计最大风速。
He estimates his losses at two million.他估计他的损失为两百万元。
The medicare cost is estimated to be one billion dollars.老年医疗保健费用估计为十亿美元。
It's impossible to estimate his abilities yet.目前评价他的能力是不可能的。
He is highly estimated among his colleagues.同事们对他的评价很高。

ethical

['eθɪkl], ['eθɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these.
morally good or correct.
avoiding activities or organizations that do harm to people or the environment.
(of a medicine) legally available only on a doctor's prescription and usually not advertised to the general public.
"ethical issues in nursing"
"can a profitable business be ethical?"
"an expert on ethical investment"
You can't divorce science from ethical questions.不能把科学与伦理问题截然分开。
Her behavior is alien to our ethical values.她的行为和我们的伦理标准格格不入。
They teach the relativity of all ethical ideas.他们宣扬一切道德观念的相对性。
Some medicine we need is ethical drug which you can't buy without a prescription.我们需要的一些药是处方药,没有处方你是买不到的。

ethnic

['eθnɪk], ['eθnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 种族的；民族的；有民族特色的
n. 少数民族的一员
relating to a population subgroup (within a larger or dominant national or cultural group) with a common national or cultural tradition.
relating to national and cultural origins.
denoting origin by birth or descent rather than by present nationality.
characteristic of or belonging to a non-Western cultural tradition.
neither Christian nor Jewish; pagan or heathen.
a member of an ethnic minority.
"leaders of ethnic communities"
"two playwrights of different ethnic origins"
"ethnic Albanians in Kosovo"
"ethnic dishes"
Canada is a multicultural country. Regardless of your ethnic origin, you will feel at home in Canada;加拿大是一个多元文化国家,无论你为何种族,在加拿大你都会感到安适;
Along the way, tourists can see the Tujia ethnic minorities tilling the land.沿着这条路,旅游者可以看到土家族的人在耕地。
That's why you can find almost every kind of ethnic food in America.那也就是为什么在美国你几乎可以看到所有不同民族的食物。
Now all the 55 ethnic minorities have their own college students,and some even are master's and doctor's degree holders.目前，55个少数民族都有了本民族的大学生，有的还有了硕士生和博士生。
This music would sound more ethnic if you played it in steel drums.如果你用钢鼓演奏, 这首乐曲将更具民族特色。

[ɪˌvælju'eɪʃn], [ɪˌvælju'eɪʃn]


Image Search

"the evaluation of each method"
The product needs an expert evaluation.这种产品需要专家评估。
We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.我们需要对这套新体系做出一个正确的评价。

eventually

[ɪ'ventʃuəli], [ɪ'ventʃuəli]


Image Search
adv. 最后；终于
in the end, especially after a long delay, dispute, or series of problems.
"eventually, after midnight, I arrived at the hotel"
It was a long journey, but we eventually arrived.旅程很长，但我们最后还是到达了。
He struggled with his assailants and eventually drove them off.他同攻击他的人进行搏斗，最后把他们赶走了。
She eventually got back the book she had lent him.她终于收回了借给他的书。
Eventually the fire was under control.火势终于被控制住了。

evidence

['evɪdəns], ['evɪdəns]


Image Search
n. 证据；证词；根据；迹象
v. 证明；证实
the available body of facts or information indicating whether a belief or proposition is true or valid.
information given personally, drawn from a document, or in the form of material objects, tending or used to establish facts in a legal investigation or admissible as testimony in court.
signs or indications of something.
be or show evidence of.
"the study finds little evidence of overt discrimination"
"without evidence, they can't bring a charge"
"there was no obvious evidence of a break-in"
"that it has been populated from prehistoric times is evidenced by the remains of Neolithic buildings"
There wasn't enough evidence to prove his guilt.没有充分的证据能证明他有罪。
Evidence weighted against the defendant.证词很不利于被告。
It is a statement in conflict with other evidence.这一陈述与其他证词不一致。
Have you any evidence to support this statement?你这种说法有根据吗?
Experiment shows no evidence of the production of explosive forces.实验表明,丝毫没有产生爆炸力的迹象。
When the ship reached port, it bore abundant evidence of the severity of the storm.船抵港时，船上满是受到暴风雨肆虐的痕迹。
His answer evidenced a guilty conscience.他的回答证明他良心有愧。
The volcano is still active, as evidenced by the recent eruption.正如最近的喷发所证明，火山仍很活跃。

evident

['evɪdənt], ['evɪdənt]


Image Search
adj. 明白的；明显的
plain or obvious; clearly seen or understood.
"she ate the cookies with evident enjoyment"
Now it became evident that he spoke two languages at once.现在我才明白，原来他心里一套表面一套。
Inertia is evident in our every day experiences.惯性在我们日常生活中是很常见的。
The purpose may not be immediately evident.这种目的不一定显而易见。
The rationale for the present study is evident.该研究的理论基础是明显的。
He looks at twelve children with evident pride.他带着明显的得意看着12个儿女。

evolution

[ˌiːvə'luːʃn], [ˌiːvə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 进化；发展；演变
the process by which different kinds of living organisms are thought to have developed and diversified from earlier forms during the history of the earth.
the gradual development of something, especially from a simple to a more complex form.
the giving off of a gaseous product, or of heat.
a pattern of movements or maneuvers.
the extraction of a root from a given quantity.
"the forms of written languages undergo constant evolution"
"silk ribbons waving in fanciful evolutions"
Charles Darwin and Alfred Russell Wallace discovered evolution independently.查尔斯·达尔文和阿尔弗雷德· 罗素·华莱士各自独立地发现了进化论。
Within 30 years,humans could be debating whether to take charge of their own evolution.不出30年，人类将讨论是否要掌控自身的进化。
Our watchword is: ‘Evolution, not revolution’.我们的口号是: ‘要循序渐进,不要剧烈变革’。
Our political institutions are in continuous evolution.我们的政治制度正在不断发展中。
In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution.在政治上，英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。
Do you know about the evolution of a seed into a plant?你知道从种子发展成为植物的过程吗？

exalt

[ɪɡ'zɔːlt], [ɪɡ'zɔːlt]


Image Search
v. 赞扬；提升；加强
hold (someone or something) in very high regard; think or speak very highly of.
raise to a higher rank or a position of greater power.
make noble in character; dignify.
"the party will continue to exalt its hero"
"this naturally exalts the peasant above his brethren in the same rank of society"
"romanticism liberated the imagination and exalted the emotions"
All the people of whom you and I are the rag-tag and bobtail, all the camp followers of western civilization, we have taken it for granted that even if we did not live up to those exalted ethical standards, we did a great deal better than anyone else.我们所有的人，包括你和我这样的下层平民，以及所有西方文明的依附者都认为，即使我们尚未达到那些崇高的道德标准，我们也还是是比别的任何人都干得好得多。
He was exalted to the position of general manager.他被提升到总经理的职位。

exceed

[ɪk'siːd], [ɪk'siːd]


Image Search
vt. 超过；超出
vi. 领先
be greater in number or size than (a quantity, number, or other measurable thing).
go beyond what is allowed or stipulated by (a set limit, especially of one's authority).
be better than; surpass.
"production costs have exceeded $60,000"
"the Tribunal's decision clearly exceeds its powers under the statute"
"catalog sales have exceeded expectations"
His knowledge of history exceeds mine.他的历史知识超过我。
Demand began to exceed supply.开始供不应求。
The fine shall not exceed $300.罚款不超过三百美元。

excluded

[ɪk'skluːd], [ɪk'skluːd]


Image Search
vt. 排除；阻止；拒绝接受
deny (someone) access to or bar (someone) from a place, group, or privilege.
keep (something) out of a place.
remove from consideration; rule out.
prevent the occurrence of; preclude.
"women had been excluded from many scientific societies"
"apply flux to exclude oxygen"
"computer software is excluded from the mandatory 15-year write-off"
"clauses seeking to exclude liability for loss or damage"
At this stage we cannot entirely exclude the possibility of staff cuts.在目前这个阶段,我们还不能完全排除裁员的可能性。
I mean the last thing we would think about is to exclude the children from this plan.我的意思是,我们绝不会考虑把孩子们排除在这个计划之外的。
Thick curtains help to exclude street noises.厚窗帘有助于隔绝街上的噪音。
The court excluded the improperly obtained evidence.法院不接受非正常渠道获得的证据

exhibit

[ɪɡ'zɪbɪt], [ɪɡ'zɪbɪt]


Image Search
v. 展览；陈列；展示；表现
n. 展品；展览
publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
(of an artist) display one's work to the public in an art gallery or museum.
publicly display the work of (an artist) in an art gallery or museum.
manifest or deliberately display (a quality or a type of behavior).
show as a sign or symptom.
an object or collection of objects on public display in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
an exhibition.
a document or other object produced in a court as evidence.
"only one sculpture was exhibited in the artist's lifetime"
"she was invited to exhibit at several French museums"
"no foreign painters were exhibited"
"he could exhibit a saintlike submissiveness"
"patients with alcoholic liver disease exhibit many biochemical abnormalities"
"the museum is rich in exhibits"
"people flocked to the exhibit in record-breaking numbers"
Many unearthed cultural relics were exhibited at the museum.博物馆展出了许多出土文物。
He was given a whole room to exhibit his paintings.整个房间用来展览他的画作。
She exhibited great powers of endurance during the climb.她在攀登过程中表现出极大的耐力。
They deprecated the new exhibit.他们很不赞成新展品。
The exhibit will be open through February, 2004.展览将一直开放到2004年2月。

expansion

[ɪk'spænʃn], [ɪk'spænʃn]


Image Search
n. 膨胀；扩展；扩充
the action of becoming larger or more extensive.
extension of a state's territory by encroaching on that of other nations, pursued as a political strategy.
a thing formed by the enlargement, broadening, or development of something.
the increase in the volume of fuel on combustion in the cylinder of an engine, or the piston stroke in which this occurs.
"the rapid expansion of suburban Washington"
"German expansion in the 1930s"
"the book is an expansion of a lecture given last year"
Metals undergo expansion when heated.金属加热时会膨胀。
The thermostat is based on the fact that different metals have different coefficients of expansion.恒温器是以不同的金属有不同的膨胀系数这一事实为根据的。
His economic policies paved the way for industrial expansion.他的经济政策为工业的扩展铺平了道路。
The time has come for the firm to consolidate after several years of rapid expansion.公司经过几年的迅速发展之後，该整顿一下了。
This book is an expansion of the play he wrote before.这本书是他以前写的剧本的扩充。

a strong belief that something will happen or be the case in the future.
a belief that someone will or should achieve something.
one's prospects of inheritance.
another term for expected value.
"reality had not lived up to expectations"
"students had high expectations for their future"

expend

[ɪk'spend], [ɪk'spend]


Image Search
vt. 花费；消耗
spend or use up (a resource such as money, time, or energy).
"we do not need to expend energy working on our marriage"
He lived high and expended largely.他生活讲究，花费很大。
He has expended much time and energy on that experiment.他已经花费许多时间、金钱在那实验上。
The soldiers expended all their ammunition in that fight.士兵在那场战斗中用尽了所有的弹药。
I had expended much time on the work but they told me it's useless.我花了很多时间在这件工作上，他们却告诉我说这是无用的。

expert

['ekspɜːt], ['ekspɜːrt]


Image Search
n. 专家；能手
adj. 熟练的；内行的
a person who has a comprehensive and authoritative knowledge of or skill in a particular area.
having or involving authoritative knowledge.
"a financial expert"
"he had received expert academic advice"
She is a reputable expert.她是个有声望的专家。
According to expert opinions, they gave up the experiment immediately.根据专家们的意见，他们马上放弃了这项试验。
He is an expert in unarmed combat.他是徒手格斗的能手。
The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill.外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去。
To her expert eye, the painting was terrible.她以内行的眼光看，这幅画糟透了。
Could you give me your expert advice?你可以给我一些专业意见吗?

expiration

[ˌekspə'reɪʃn], [ˌekspə'reɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 终止；期满；呼出；呼气
the ending of the fixed period for which a contract is valid.
the end of a period of time.
exhalation of breath.
"the expiration of the lease"
"the expiration of three years"
This Contract shall be terminated on the expiration date.劳动合同期满，即行终止。
A contract subject to a time of expiration is extinguished at such time.附终止期限的合同，自期限届满时失效。
The expiration of contract is coming.合同快到期了。
When is the expiration of your driving license?你的驾驶执照何时到期？
This ticket has passed its expiration date, and so it is now invalid.这张票已过了有效期，现在作废了。

explicit

[ɪk'splɪsɪt], [ɪk'splɪsɪt]


Image Search
adj. 明确的；清晰的；清楚的；露骨的
stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.
(of a person) stating something in a clear and detailed way.
describing or representing sexual activity in a graphic fashion.
the closing words of a text, manuscript, early printed book, or chanted liturgical text.
"the speaker's intentions were not made explicit"
"let me be explicit"
"explicit photos showing poses and acts"
They gave explicit reasons for leaving.他们明确地说出了离开的原因。
A man can try his best to perfect and improve himself only if he has strong desires and explicit goal.只有怀着强烈的欲望,有着明确的目标,一个人才能竭尽全力去完善自我,提升自我。
He has an explicit understanding of this.他对这个了解得很清晰。
He gave me explicit directions on how to get there.他清清楚楚地告诉我怎样到达那里。
This film will never pass the censors, because it is too sexually explicit这部电影一定不能通过审查这一关,因色情过于露骨。

exploitation

[ˌeksplɔɪ'teɪʃn], [ˌeksplɔɪ'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 开发；开采；剥削；利用
the action or fact of treating someone unfairly in order to benefit from their work.
the action of making use of and benefiting from resources.
the fact of making use of a situation to gain unfair advantage for oneself.
"the exploitation of migrant workers"
"the Bronze Age saw exploitation of gold deposits"
"this administration's exploitation of the fear of crime"
Excessive exploitation makes the soil barren.过度开发使这些土地变得贫瘠了。
The government has a monopoly of oil exploitation in that country.在那个国家，政府独占石油开采权。
Generally speaking, mineral exploitation is a feast-or-famine industry.一般来说，开矿这种事业不是大大成功便是彻底失败。
The boss made a fortune by means of exploitation.这个老板是靠剥削发的财。
He is unscrupulous in his exploitation of people.他肆无忌弹地剥削人民。
The capitalist system reposes on the exploitation of the labouring people.资本主义制度建立在剥削劳动人民的基础上。

export

['ekspɔːt], ['ekspɔːrt]


Image Search
n. 输出；出口；输出品；输出存储器的信息
v. 输出；出口；带走，运走；从存储器输出信息
send (goods or services) to another country for sale.
spread or introduce (ideas and beliefs) to another country.
transfer (data) in a format that can be used by other programs.
a commodity, article, or service sold abroad.
sales of goods or services to other countries, or the revenue from such sales.
the selling and sending out of goods or services to other countries.
of a high standard suitable for export.
"we exported $16 million worth of mussels to Japan"
"the Greeks exported Hellenic culture around the Mediterranean basin"
"wool and mohair were the principal exports"
"meat exports"
"the export of Western technology"
"high-grade export coal"
Prohibition was laid on the export of coal.禁止煤炭输出。
The company's gearing up for the big export drive.公司正为大规模输出作好准备。
Consultancy, insurance and tourism are also parts of the export trade.咨询,保险及旅游也是出口贸易的一部分。
Export had suffered during the last six months.前6个月内，出口已蒙受损失。
Oil has supplanted coffee as our main export.原油已经取代咖啡成为我们的主要出口货物。
Sugar is one chief export of China.糖是中国的主要输出品之一。
The blood can also export waste products from the tissues.血液还能从身体组织里输出废物。
Africa is exporting beef to Europe.非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。
They sell to the home market,but they don't export.他们向国内市场销售,但不出口。

exposure

[ɪk'spəʊʒə(r)], [ɪk'spoʊʒər]


Image Search
n. 暴露；揭露；胶片；曝光时间；(在电视、报纸等媒体上的)亮相；挨冻
the state of being exposed to contact with something.
a physical condition resulting from being outside in severe weather conditions without adequate protection.
experience of something.
the action of placing oneself at risk of financial losses, e.g., through making loans, granting credit, or underwriting insurance.
the revelation of an identity or fact, especially one that is concealed or likely to arouse disapproval.
the publicizing of information or an event.
the action of exposing a photographic film to light or other radiation.
the quantity of light or other radiation reaching a photographic film, as determined by shutter speed and lens aperture.
the direction in which a building faces; an outlook.
"the dangers posed by exposure to asbestos"
"he died of exposure at 8,000 feet"
"his exposure to the banking system"
"she took her life for fear of exposure as a spy"
"scientific findings receive regular exposure in the media"
"a camera that would give a picture immediately after exposure"
"the exposure is perfect—a gentle slope to the southwest"
Exposure of the body to strong sunlight can be harmful.身体受烈日暴晒会造成伤害。
Her skin was dry after exposure to the wind.经过风吹后她的皮肤很干。
His election toppled down due to the exposure of his bribery.他的竞选因为受贿被揭露而失败了。
How many exposures have you left?还剩多少底片没有照？
I used a long exposure for this one.我这张照片用的曝光时间长。
Her new movie has had a lot of exposure in the media.她的新片媒体有很多报道。
The girl is very pleased to take exposure on TV singing program.这个女孩对在电视歌唱节目上露面非常高兴。
He nearly died of exposure on the cold mountain.他在寒冷的高山上差一点没有冻死。

expressly

[ɪk'spresli], [ɪk'spresli]


Image Search
adv. 清楚地；特意地；专门地
explicitly; clearly.
for a specific purpose; solely.
"she was expressly forbidden to use the stove"
"the house was expressly built for entertaining"
I expressly told him I wouldn't go.我清楚地告诉他,我不愿去。
I told you expressly to lock the door.我明白地对你说过要锁上门。
You were expressly told not to touch my papers.已经明确地告诉过你不要动我的文件。
The rule was introduced expressly for this purpose.这项规则是为此特意提出的。
This ship was designed expressly for exploring the Arctic waters.这艘船是为考察北极水域而特意设计的。
Icame expressly to bring it to you.我是专门来给你送东西的。
We came here expressly to see the sunrise.我们到这里来就是为了看日出。
It is an article written expressly for the paper.这是专门为该报而撰写的文章。

external

[ɪk'stɜːnl], [ɪk'stɜːrnl]


Image Search
adj. 外来的；外部的；外面的；表面的
n. 外观；外部；外界事物
belonging to or forming the outer surface or structure of something.
relating to or denoting a medicine or similar substance for use on the outside of the body.
coming or derived from a source outside the subject affected.
coming from or relating to a foreign country or an outside institution.
(of hardware) not contained in the main computer; peripheral.
(of storage) using a disk or tape drive rather than the main memory.
the outward features of something.
features that are only superficial; inessentials.
"the external walls"
"for external application only"
"for many people the church was a symbol of external authority"
"responsibility for defense and external affairs"
"the place has all the appropriate externals, such as chimneys choked with ivy and windows with jasmine"
This news program only covers external events.这一新闻节目只报道国外消息。
The external sector performance also improved significantly during the period.在此期间,我国的涉外经济成绩斐然。
This force takes two forms, one internal and one external.这个权力有两种形式:一种是对内的,一种是对外的。
All his injuries are external.他受的伤都是外伤。
The external features of the building are very attractive.这座建筑物的外观是很吸引人的。
These load cells are specially designed with small external dimensions.这些测力元件精心设计了小外观尺寸。
He is just listening in external of that room.他正在那房间的外面留神听着。

extinct

[ɪk'stɪŋkt], [ɪk'stɪŋkt]


Image Search
adj. 灭绝的；熄灭的；消亡的
(of a species, family, or other larger group) having no living members.
no longer in existence.
(of a volcano) not having erupted in recorded history.
no longer burning.
(of a title of nobility) having no qualified claimant.
"trilobites and dinosaurs are extinct"
"an extinct language"
"his now extinct pipe"
This is an extinct species of fish.这是一种已经灭绝的鱼。
This species will be extinct in a few decades.几十年后这个物种将会灭绝。
An extinct volcano can no longer erupt.一个灭绝的火山已不能再爆发。
My hope of getting some employment was extinct.我要找到工作的希望落空了。

extort

[ɪk'stɔːt], [ɪk'stɔːrt]


Image Search
v. 勒索；敲诈；强要
obtain (something) by force, threats, or other unfair means.
"he was convicted of trying to extort $1 million from a developer"
Weep over is the behavior which threaten to extort.哭泣是恐吓勒索的行为。
The blackmailer tried to extort a large sum of money from him.勒索者企图向他敲诈一大笔钱。
The police used torture to extort a confession from him.警方对他严刑逼供。

extract

['ekstrækt], ['ekstrækt]


Image Search
vt. 摘录；提取；拔出；榨出；选取
[计算机] 提取.
n. 摘录；精华；榨出物
remove or take out, especially by effort or force.
obtain (something such as money or an admission) from someone in the face of initial unwillingness.
obtain (a substance or resource) from something by a special method.
select (a passage from a piece of writing, music, or film) for quotation, performance, or reproduction.
derive (an idea or the evidence for it) from a body of information.
calculate (a root of a number).
a short passage taken from a piece of writing, music, or film.
a preparation containing the active ingredient of a substance in concentrated form.
"the decayed tooth will have to be extracted"
"I won't let you go without trying to extract a promise from you"
"lead was extracted from the copper"
"the table is extracted from the report"
"the desire to extract meaningful lessons from a few experiments"
"an extract from a historical film"
"vanilla extract"
She extracted passages for the students to translate.她选了些短文让学生翻译.
She extracted a small notebook from her handbag.她从手提包里取出了一个小笔记本。
He tried to extract his pole from the mud.他试图用力将杆子从泥中拔出来。
It takes a major operation to extract money from a minor poet.要从小诗人那儿榨出钱来，得施行一次大手术。
Bratti means to extract the utmost possible amount of pleasure.布拉蒂决计从生活里榨出尽可能多的快乐来。
I would like to quote two extracts from the book.我很想引用这本书的两段文字。
The following extract is taken from her new novel.下面一段摘自她的新小说。
Cooperating with the extract liquid, the result is better.配合精华液使用，效果更佳。
Moisture dry skin with natural ingredients, apricot kemel oil and dewberry extract.含黑莓和杏仁天然萃取精华。

['fæsɪt], ['fæsɪt]


Image Search
n. 小平面；方面；刻面
one side of something many-sided, especially of a cut gem.
a particular aspect or feature of something.
any of the individual units (ommatidia) that make up the compound eye of an insect or crustacean.
"participation by the laity in all facets of church life"
They beat us in every facet of the game.他们在比赛的每个小层面都打败了我们。
He has perfected himself in every facet of his job.他已使自己对工作的各个方面都得心应手。
Locomotion is merely one facet of action.移动只是行动的一个方面而已。
Being a well-paid business woman is only one facet of her life.高薪阶层职业妇女的身份只是她生活的一个方面。
The facet of the gem was examined.宝石的琢面检查过了。

We facilitate them to resist the enemy.我们帮助他们与敌人对抗。
The new underground railway will facilitate the journey to all parts of the city.新的地下铁路将为去城市各处提供方便。

factors

['fæktə(r)], ['fæktər]


Image Search
n. 因素；因数；因子
vt. 把 ... 因素包括进去
vi. 作为因素
a circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result or outcome.
a gene that determines a hereditary characteristic.
a number or quantity that when multiplied with another produces a given number or expression.
a number or algebraic expression by which another is exactly divisible.
any of a number of substances in the blood, mostly identified by numerals, which are involved in coagulation.
a business agent; a merchant buying and selling on commission.
a company that buys a manufacturer's invoices at a discount and takes responsibility for collecting the payments due on them.
an agent, deputy, or representative.
another term for factorize.
sell (one's receivable debts) to a factor.
"she worked fast, conscious of the time factor"
"the Rhesus factor"
The determinate factor of our economy is to control inflation.我们经济的决定性因素是控制通货膨胀。
The committee's support is an important factor in the success of the project.委员会的支持是该项目取得成功的一个重要因素。
2, 3, 4 and 6 are factors of 12.2、3、4 和6是12的因子。
A new factor appears under the integral sign.积分号内出现了一个新的因子。
After cancellation, the factor is still present in the denominator.相消后该因子仍存在于分母中。

famished

['fæmɪʃt], ['fæmɪʃt]


Image Search
adj. 极饥饿的
动词famish的过去式和过去分词.
extremely hungry.
When's lunch? I'm famished!什么时候吃午饭? 我都快饿死了！
He was so famished that golden sparks danced before his eyes.他饿得眼前直冒金花。

unlikely and unconvincing; implausible.

fare

[feə(r)], [fer]


Image Search
n. 车费；路费；乘客；食物
vi. 过活；进展；进食；旅行；行走
the money a passenger on public transportation has to pay.
a passenger paying to travel in a vehicle, especially a taxicab.
a range of food, especially of a particular type.
performance or entertainment of a particular style.
perform in a specified way in a particular situation or over a particular period of time.
happen; turn out.
travel.
"delicious Provençal fare"
"conventional Hollywood fare"
"the party fared badly in the spring elections"
"beware that it fare not with you as with your predecessor"
"a young knight fares forth"
Let me go shares with you in the taxi fare.我和你分摊计程车费吧。
She didn't have enough money for the bus fare.她的钱不够付车费。
He didn't have enough money to pay his train fare.他没有足够的钱来付火车费。
The normal return fare to New York is fifty-six.去纽约的来回票标准价是56元。
What is the fare to London and back?去伦敦来回要多少钱?
Reserve enough money for your home fare.留足你回家的路费。
The taxi-driver stopped to pick up a fare.计程车司机停下车来搭载一名乘客。
The fare in this restaurant is terrible.这家餐馆的饭菜太差了。
How would I fare in a strange city?在一个陌生的城市里，我怎么度日呢?
I think I fared quite well in the interview.我觉得我这次面试考得不错。
It is a pity that she should fare so badly.她竟吃得那么差,真可怜。

fatality

[fə'tæləti], [fə'tæləti]


Image Search
n. 死亡；灾祸；天命；致命性
an occurrence of death by accident, in war, or from disease.
a person killed by accident, war, or disease.
helplessness in the face of fate.
"shooting was heard and there were fatalities"
"news reports said one of the fatalities was an eight-year-old boy"
"the plot needs a darker sense of fatality to cover its absurdities"
There have been ten swimming fatalities this summer.今年夏季已有十人游泳遇溺。
The explosion accident caused several fatalities.爆炸事故使数人死亡。
There was a strange fatality about their both losing their jobs on the same day.他们两人同一天失去工作，真是天意叵测。
The most serious form of skin cancer has a 30% fatality rate.皮肤癌的最严重情况有30%25的致死率。

features

['fiːtʃəz], ['fiːtʃəz]


Image Search
n. 容貌；特征
名词feature的复数形式.
a distinctive attribute or aspect of something.
a part of the face, such as the mouth or eyes, making a significant contribution to its overall appearance.
a distinctive characteristic of a linguistic unit, especially a speech sound or vocabulary item, that serves to distinguish it from others of the same type.
a newspaper or magazine article or a broadcast program devoted to the treatment of a particular topic, typically at length.
a full-length film intended as the main item in a movie theater program.
have as a prominent attribute or aspect.
have as an important actor or participant.
be a significant characteristic of or take an important part in.
"safety features like dual air bags"
"a feature on Detroit's downtown fishery"
"the hotel features a large lounge, a sauna, and a coin-operated solarium"
"the film featured Glenn Miller and his Orchestra"
"his later paintings feature prominently in the exhibition"
I can recall the men's features.我回忆得起这个人的容貌。
Everyone admired the delicacy of her features.人人都羡慕她娇美的容貌。
His smile predominated his features.他的微笑是他的容貌的重要特色。
He has very regular features.他五官端正。
A rare smile lit up his stern features.他那难得一见的微笑在他死板的脸上平添一些生气。
The professor will give a lecture of geographical features.教授将要做关于地理特征的讲座。
The new car design incorporates all the latest safety features.新的汽车设计具备最新安全措施的一切特点。
The latest computer model embodies many new features.最新型的计算机具备许多新功能。

of the northern states in the Civil War.

money regularly paid to a school or similar institution for continuing services.
an estate of land, especially one held on condition of feudal service.
make a payment to (someone) in return for services.
"the gallery charges an admission fee"
"high tuition fees required by the schools"

fertile

['fɜːtaɪl], ['fɜːrtl]


Image Search
adj. 肥沃的；富饶的；能繁殖的；多产的；（创造力）丰富的
(of soil or land) producing or capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
(of a seed or egg) capable of becoming a new individual.
(of a person, animal, or plant) able to conceive young or produce seed.
(of a person's mind or imagination) producing many new and inventive ideas with ease.
(of a situation or subject) fruitful and productive in generating new ideas.
(of nuclear material) able to become fissile by the capture of neutrons.
"fields along the fertile flood plains of the river"
"Barbara carefully calculated the period when she was most fertile"
"a series of fertile debates within the social sciences"
There are fertile fields in the Nile Delta.尼罗河三角洲土地肥沃。
We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile.我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。
It was a pleasant fertile spot, well wooded and rich in pasture.那是一个富饶的，使人愉快的地方，材木苍然，牧草丰富。
This fertile land bears the hopes of the farmers.这块富饶的土地,孕育着庄稼人的希望！
Tilapia are very fertile, and reproduce several offspring every year.罗非鱼一年能够繁殖数代,生殖能力很强。
The rotation of crops keeps the soil healthy and fertile.谷物轮种使土壤保持了肥力和高质。
His paper was remarkably simple and fertile.他的评论异常简单而且内容丰富。

fidelity

[fɪ'deləti], [fɪ'deləti]


Image Search
n. 忠实；忠诚；准确性；保真度
faithfulness to a person, cause, or belief, demonstrated by continuing loyalty and support.
sexual faithfulness to a spouse or partner.
the degree of exactness with which something is copied or reproduced.
"he sought only the strictest fidelity to justice"
"the 1949 recording provides reasonable fidelity"
Waley was much more interested in readability than fidelity.韦利在翻译该书时更加关注译文的可读性，而非忠实程度。
His fidelity and industry brought him speedy promotion.他的忠于职守和勤于工作使他得到迅速晋级。
She praised his servant for his fidelity.她称赞他仆人的忠诚。
They betokened their fidelity to the leader with a vow.他们以宣誓来表示他们对领袖的忠诚。
History is more full of examples of the fidelity of dog than of friend.历史上狗儿忠诚的事例较诸朋友忠诚的事例多得多。
To achieve the requirement of high fidelity listen respectfully, rated power should be pressed according to sound of optimal listen respectfully will decide.为了达到高保真聆听的要求,额定功率应根据最佳聆听声压来确定。

file

[faɪl], [faɪl]


Image Search
n. 档案；卷宗；文件；锉刀，指甲锉
vt. 把 ... 归档；提出(申请书、议案等)
a folder or box for holding loose papers that are typically arranged in a particular order for easy reference.
the contents of a file folder or box.
a collection of data, programs, etc., stored in a computer's memory or on a storage device under a single identifying name.
place (a document) in a cabinet, box, or folder in a particular order for preservation and easy reference.
submit (a legal document, application, or charge) to be placed on record by the appropriate authority.
(of a reporter) send (a story) to a newspaper or news organization.
a line of people or things one behind another.
a small detachment of troops.
each of the eight rows of eight squares on a chessboard running away from the player toward the opponent.
(of a group of people) walk one behind the other, typically in an orderly and solemn manner.
a tool with a roughened surface or surfaces, typically of steel, used for smoothing or shaping a hard material.
smooth or shape (something) with a file.
remove something by grinding it off with a file.
pounded or powdered sassafras leaves used to flavor and thicken soup, especially gumbo.
"a file of correspondence"
"do you want to save this file?"
"the contract, when signed, is filed"
"criminal charges were filed against the firm"
"Plains Cree warriors riding in file down the slopes"
"a file of English soldiers had ridden out from Perth"
"the mourners filed into the church"
"it is possible to make the necessary notch with a file"
"when I have nothing else to do, I file my nails"
"the engine numbers were filed away"
Put this letter in the main file.把这封信放在主要文件夹中。
Would you please take a seat while I look into our file?你先坐一下,我给你查一下我们的卷宗?
Put this letter in the main file.把这封信放在主要文件夹中。
Please file those letters.请把这些信件存档。
Please file the original Articles and return the certified copies to me at the above address.请将公司大纲原件存档,并把经核实的副本按上述地址退还与我。
If a prisoner is not satisfied with the effective judgment, he may file a petition.第二十一条罪犯对生效的判决不服的,可以提出申诉。
We regret to inform you that the goods were underweight and we cannot but file a claim against you.我们很遗憾地告知你方货物重量不足,我们不得不向你方提出索赔。

final

['faɪnl], ['faɪnl]


Image Search
adj. 最终的；最后的；决定性的；不可改变的
n. 决赛；大学毕业考试；期终考试
coming at the end of a series.
reached or designed to be reached as the outcome of a process or a series of events.
allowing no further doubt or dispute.
the last game in a sports tournament or other competition, which decides the winner of the tournament.
a series of games constituting the final stage of a competition.
a series of examinations at the end of a degree course.
an examination at the end of a term, academic year, or particular class.
the principal note in a mode.
the final approach of a landing aircraft to a runway.
"the final version of the report was presented"
"the final cost will easily run into six figures"
"the decision of the judging panel is final"
"the World Cup finals"
"she was doing her history finals"
"the plane piloted by Richards was on finals"
The proposal was presented as final package deal.那项建议是作为最终的一揽子交易提出来的。
We are all satisfied with the final result.我们都对最终的结果感到满意。
This is our final offer.这是我方的最后报价。
The game is now in its final stages.这场比赛现在处于最后阶段。
Who has the final say here?这里谁有最后决定权？
The judge's decision is final.法官的判决是最终判决。
The World Cup final is being transmitted live to over fifty countries.世界杯决赛现在正向五十多个国家现场转播。
Football fever gripped the town when the local team reached the cup final.在当地的足球队打进了优胜杯的决赛圈后，全市掀起一阵足球热。

And I got the financial support after two years.两年后我终于取得了奖学金。
I hear you are in poor financial straits.我听说你处于经济困难之中。
This company was in serious financial difficulties.这家公司陷入严重的财政困难。
The journalist was probing into several financial scandals.那记者正在调查几起财务丑闻。

finite

['faɪnaɪt], ['faɪnaɪt]


Image Search
adj. 有限的
having limits or bounds.
not infinitely small.
(of a verb form) having a specific tense, number, and person.
"every computer has a finite amount of memory"
"one's chance of winning may be small, but it is finite"
The world's resources are finite.世界的资源是有限的。
Fortunately, the casualties were finite.幸运的是，人员伤亡有限。
It is quite possible that space and time are finite.很有可能空间和时间是有限的。
Any battery has a finite life span no matter what device it powers.任何电池都具有有限的寿命，无论它具有多大的能量。

the quality of bending easily without breaking.

"I enjoyed the flexibility of the schedule"
"the government has shown flexibility in applying its policy"

Stability also depends upon the flexibility of the local economy.稳定还有赖于当地经济的灵活适应性。
He stretched and loosened up so as improve flexibility.他伸展身体，做放松练习，以提高柔韧性。

The evidence against him was flimsy.指控他的证据不足信。
A close inspection of this argument would reveal how flimsy it is.仔细想想这个问题就会发现它其实毫无根据。

[ˌflʌktjʊ'eɪʃəns], [ˌflʌktjʊ'eɪʃəns]


Image Search

名词fluctuation的复数形式.
an irregular rising and falling in number or amount; a variation.
"fluctuations in the yearly values could be caused by a variety of factors"
Fluctuations are spatial and temporal in character.这种波动的特点是空间性和瞬时性的。
Turbulence or gusts produce velocity fluctuations.紊乱性或阵息性使速度产生波动。

His work is rather fluent and felicitous.他的作品十分流畅，措辞巧妙。
Her fluent movements surprised us.她那协调优美的动作让我们惊奇。

focus

['fəʊkəs], ['foʊkəs]


Image Search

v. （使）集中；聚集
the center of interest or activity.
an act of concentrating interest or activity on something.
the point of origin of an earthquake.
the principal site of an infection or other disease.
the state or quality of having or producing clear visual definition.
another term for focal point.
the point at which an object must be situated with respect to a lens or mirror for an image of it to be well defined.
a device on a lens which can be adjusted to produce a clear image.
one of the fixed points from which the distances to any point of a given curve, such as an ellipse or parabola, are connected by a linear relation.
the part of a sentence given prominence, usually for emphasis or contrast, e.g., Bob in it was Bob who came, not Bill.
(of a person or their eyes) adapt to the prevailing level of light and become able to see clearly.
cause (one's eyes) to focus.
adjust the focus of (a telescope, camera, or other instrument).
(of rays or waves) meet at a single point.
(of a lens) make (rays or waves) meet at a single point.
(of light, radio waves, or other energy) become concentrated into a sharp beam of light or energy.
(of a lens) concentrate (light, radio waves, or energy) into a sharp beam.
pay particular attention to.
concentrate.
place the focus on (a part of a sentence).
"this generation has made the environment a focus of attention"
"our focus on the customer's requirements"
"his face is rather out of focus"
"try to focus on a stationary object"
"trying to focus his bleary eyes on Corbett"
"they were focusing a telescope on a star"
"the study will focus on a number of areas in Wales"
"an opportunity to focus research on the health needs of the population"
He always wants to be the focus of attention.他总想成为注意力的焦点。
He took out the binoculars and adjusted the focus.他取出双筒望远镜并调整了焦距。
The main focus of this manual is the management of fresh ground water resources.本指南的主要中心是地下淡水资源的管理。
The noise made it hard for me to focus on work.噪音让我无法集中注意力工作。
He focused the sun's rays on the paper with a burning glass.他用取火镜使太阳光聚集在纸上。

She was unsure as yet whether he was friend or foe.她还不确定他究竟是敌是友。
They were all humbled by kobe who is their foe.视他为仇敌的对手在他面前依旧得低头。
Blood of the enemy forcibly taken, you will resurrect your foe.强行夺取的仇人之血，将使你的仇敌复活！

foil

[fɔɪl], [fɔɪl]


Image Search
n. 钝头剑；箔；陪衬物；（击剑运动用的）花剑
vt. 挫败；击退；阻挠
prevent (something considered wrong or undesirable) from succeeding.
frustrate the efforts or plans of.
(of a hunted animal) run over or cross (ground or a scent or track) in such a way as to confuse the hounds.
the track or scent of a hunted animal.
a setback in an enterprise; a defeat.
metal hammered or rolled into a thin flexible sheet, used chiefly for covering or wrapping food.
a person or thing that contrasts with and so emphasizes and enhances the qualities of another.
a thin leaf of metal placed under a precious stone to increase its brilliance.
a leaf-shaped curve formed by the cusping of an arch or circle, typically occurring in groups of three or more in Gothic tracery.
a light fencing sword without cutting edges but with a button on its point.
each of the winglike structures fitted to a hydrofoil's hull to lift it clear of the water at speed.
"a brave policewoman foiled the armed robbery"
"Errol Flynn was a dashing Mountie foiling Nazi agents in Canada"
"aluminum foil"
"the earthy taste of grilled vegetables is a perfect foil for the tart bite of creamy goat cheese"
The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.花剑，没有劈杀用的剑刀，是刺戳用兵器。
Our foil packets seal the flavour in.我们用锡纸包装以保持原味。
Aluminum foil can be used for wrapping food.铝箔用于包装食物。
This box of chocolate was wrapped round with foil.这盒巧克力用箔纸包着。
In the play, a wicked old uncle acts as a foil to the noble young prince.在剧中,邪恶年老的叔父为高尚年轻的王子扮演陪衬者的角色。
In foil and saber,only the attacking fencer can score a point.在花剑和佩剑比赛中，只有进攻方才能得分。
Only confident, people will never foil.只要有信心，人永远不会挫败。
Mr. Wang foiled their plans of inventing a new machine.王先生否决了他们关于发明新机器的计划。

"a data file in binary format"
The book has been styled in a modern format.该书已按照现代版式制作。
It's the same book,but a new format.还是那本书
The format of the meeting was such that every one could ask a question.会议安排好可让每个人都能提一个问题。
The disk is too large to format for the specified file system.磁盘过大,无法为指定文件系统进行格式化。
They formatted the conference so that each speaker had less than 15 minutes to deliver a paper.他们安排了会议以至每个演讲者有不到15分钟的时间发表演讲

formula

['fɔːmjələ], ['fɔːrmjələ]


Image Search

an infant's liquid food preparation based on cow's milk or soy protein, given as a substitute for breast milk.
a method, statement, or procedure for achieving something, especially reconciling different aims or positions.
a fixed form of words, especially one used in particular contexts or as a conventional usage.
a rule or style unintelligently or slavishly followed.
a statement that formally enunciates a religious doctrine.
a stock epithet, phrase, or line repeated for various effects in literary composition, especially epic poetry.
(usually followed by a number) a classification of race car, especially by engine capacity.
"the soft drink company closely guards its secret formula"
"an original coal tar formula that helps prevent dandruff"
"the forlorn hope of finding a peace formula"
"a legal formula"
"one of those formula tunes"
They are working on the perfection of their new paint formula.他们正在努力研制尽善尽美的新颜料配方。
What is the formula for water?水的分子式是什么？
Within the braces, you can include any formula.在大括号内,可以包含任何公式。
It's the formula for converting gallons into liters.这是加仑与升的换算公式。
There is no sure formula for success.成功并无一定之规.
His outwardly relaxed manner hides a sharp mind and a keen will to win, something he did a lot of on the nursery slopes of Formula BMW.他轻松自若的举止下隐藏着敏锐的心思和渴望胜利的决心，这在他参加宝马方程式的培养期里就已经有所体现。

"the argument is sufficiently clear that it can be formulated mathematically"

He formulated his thought clearly.他清楚确切地表达了自己的思想。
He struggled to formulate an answer.他努力字斟句酌地回答。
He thought it time to formulate some plan of action.他认为这是该筹划一些行动计划的时候了。
We can then formulate the following rules.我们可以作出下列规定。

foundation

an underlying basis or principle.
justification or reason.
the action of establishing an institution or organization on a permanent basis, especially with an endowment.

"apply moisturizer a few minutes before using foundation"
"this idea is the foundation of all modern economics"

He laid the foundation of his success by study and hard work.他通过学习和努力工作为成功打下了基础。
All these have laid a solid political foundation for consolidated national unity.所有这些为巩固国家统一奠定了坚实的政治基础。
His view is by no means without foundation.他这种看法决不是凭空产生的。
These conclusions must have some solid foundation in reality.这些结论一定有某些牢固的现实根据。
The foundation of this university took place over 100 years ago.这所大学于一百多年前创建。
