In some countries all the young men do a year's military service.有些国家，所有年轻男子都要服一年兵役。
The military were called in to deal with the riot.已将军队调来镇压暴乱。
The military has tightened its hold on the country.军方加强了对这个国家的控制。

mimic

['mɪmɪk], ['mɪmɪk]


Image Search
vt. 模仿；模拟
n. 模仿者；仿制品
adj. 模仿的；假的
imitate (someone or their actions or words), typically in order to entertain or ridicule.
(of an animal or plant) resemble or imitate (another animal or plant), especially to deter predators or for camouflage.
(of a drug) replicate the physiological effects of (another substance).
(of a disease) exhibit symptoms that bear a deceptive resemblance to those of (another disease).
a person skilled in imitating the voice, mannerisms, or movements of others in an entertaining way.
an animal or plant that exhibits mimicry.
imitative of something, especially for amusement.
"she mimicked Eileen's voice"
"they were waging mimic war"
He mimicked his uncle's voice and gestures perfectly.他把叔叔的声音和姿态模仿得惟妙惟肖。
He could mimic all the teachers' accents.他能够模仿每位老师的口音。
You would like to mimic this plan on your test environment.您需要在测试环境中模拟该计划。
One of my brothers is a wonderful mimic.我的一个兄弟很善于模仿。
He is a clever mimic who can take off most of the lectures in this college.他是一个聪明的模仿家,他能模仿学校里大部分的演讲。
This parrot is an amazing mimic.这只鹦鹉很会学舌。
Is this real antique or mimic?这真的是古董，还是仿制品？
At the international level sport is frankly mimic warfare.国际级比赛简直就是一场模拟战争。

minimal

['mɪnɪməl], ['mɪnɪməl]


Image Search
adj. 最小的；最低限度的
of a minimum amount, quantity, or degree; negligible.
characterized by the use of simple or primary forms or structures, especially geometric or massive ones.
characterized by simplicity and lack of adornment or decoration.
characterized by the repetition and gradual alteration of short phrases.
(of a pair of forms) distinguished by only one feature.
"production costs are minimal"
"minimal, simple evening dresses in luxurious fabrics"
"“p” and “b” are a minimal pair, distinguished by the feature of voicing"
The work was carried out at minimal cost.这项工作是以最少的开销完成的。
She gained only minimal recognition for her work.她的工作仅仅得到极少的赞誉。
There is a minimal quantity of imperfection in the batch.这批产品的残次品极少。
Fortunately, the storm only did minimal damage to the farmer's crops.很幸运, 暴风雨只使农民的庄稼受到轻微的损害。
Fortunately, the storm only did minimal damage.很幸运,暴风雨造成的破坏不大。

minimised


Image Search
reduce (something, especially something unwanted or unpleasant) to the smallest possible amount or degree.
represent or estimate at less than the true value or importance.
"the aim is to minimize costs"
"they may minimize, or even overlook, the importance of such beliefs"

minimum

['mɪnɪməm], ['mɪnɪməm]


Image Search
adj. 最少的；最低程度的
n. 最低限度；最小量
the least or smallest amount or quantity possible, attainable, or required.
the lowest or smallest amount of a varying quantity (e.g., temperature) allowed, attained, or recorded.
a point at which a continuously varying quantity ceases to decrease and begins to increase; the value of a quantity at such a point.
smallest or lowest.
"technical difficulties have been kept to a minimum"
"clients with a minimum of $500,000 to invest"
"this can be done with the minimum amount of effort"
That is the minimum number necessary to complete the circuit.这是完善循环的最低限度人数。
The minimum wage is 4.25 dollars an hour.最低工价为每小时四点二五美元。
Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars.修理你的汽车最低限度要100美元。
The class needs a minimum of 6 pupils to continue.这个班最低限度要六个学生才可以继续办下去。
Consolidate everything to the bare minimum.把一切巩固到最低限度的最小量。
And when I did, I tried to keep it to a minimum.吃的时候，我也要保持在最小量。

ministry

['mɪnɪstri], ['mɪnɪstri]


Image Search
n. (政府的)部；内阁；(全体)牧师
the work or vocation of a minister of religion.
the period of tenure of a minister of religion.
the spiritual work or service of any Christian or a group of Christians, especially evangelism.
(in certain countries) a government department headed by a minister of state.
(in certain countries) a period of government under one prime minister.
the action of ministering to someone.
"he is training for the ministry"
"a ministry of Christian healing"
"the Ministry of Agriculture"
"Gladstone's first ministry was outstanding"
"the soldiers were no less in need of his ministry"
She's on attachment to the Ministry of Defense.她现在隶属于国防部。
The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defense.陆海空军皆由国防部控制。
The Ministry released him on compassionate grounds.内阁因同情而将他释放。
The ministry is about to haul up the white flag.该内阁正准备认输。
Our son wants to enter the ministry.我们的儿子想做牧师。
He is training for the ministry.他正在接受培训，准备做牧师。
He felt no vocation for the ministry.他不以为做牧师是自己的天职。

minorities

[maɪ'nɒrəti], [maɪ'nɔːrəti]


Image Search
n. 少数；少数民族；未成年
the smaller number or part, especially a number that is less than half the whole number.
the number of votes cast for or by the smaller party in a legislative assembly.
a relatively small group of people, especially one commonly discriminated against in a community, society, or nation, differing from others in race, religion, language, or political persuasion.
the state or period of being under the age of full legal responsibility.
"harsher measures for the minority of really serious offenders"
"a blocking minority of 23 votes"
"representatives of ethnic minorities"
Only a minority of British households do not have a car.英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。
A small minority voted against the motion.投票反对该提议的人占少数。
The question of which state the minority group should belong to was decided by (a) plebiscite.该少数民族应归属哪一州的问题已由公民投票表决。
There are 56 minorities in our country.我国有56个少数民族。
The nationality of the minority groups in that country is still at issue.在那个国家的少数民族的国籍问题上仍有争论。
He is in his minority.他尚未成年。

misapprehension

[ˌmɪsæprɪ'henʃn], [ˌmɪsæprɪ'henʃn]


Image Search
n. 误解
a mistaken belief about or interpretation of something.
"she must have been laboring under the misapprehension that you are nice"
A quarrel often rises from a misapprehension.争吵常起于误解.
I was under the misapprehension that he was dead.我误以为他死了。
The boss's misapprehension mad her want to weep with frustration.上司的误解使得她沮丧地想哭.
I thought you wanted to see me but I was clearly under a complete misapprehension.我以为你想见我，显然完全是我误解了。

misgiving

[ˌmɪs'ɡɪvɪŋ], [ˌmɪs'ɡɪvɪŋ]


Image Search
n. 疑虑；怀疑
动词misgive的现在分词.
a feeling of doubt or apprehension about the outcome or consequences of something.
(of a person's mind or heart) fill (that person) with doubt, apprehension, or foreboding.
"we have misgivings about the way the campaign is being run"
"my heart misgave me when I saw him"
All their misgivings were driven out by the arrival of the good news.一听到这个好消息，他们一切疑虑都烟消云散了。
I have many misgivings about taking the job.我对是否接受那项工作顾虑重重。

misrepresent

[ˌmɪsˌreprɪ'zent], [ˌmɪsˌreprɪ'zent]


Image Search
v. 误称；歪曲；不合适地代表
give a false or misleading account of the nature of.
"you are misrepresenting the views of the government"
If you misrepresent what's in the plan, we will call you out.如果有人再恶意解读健保改革计划，我们会直接批评你。
Something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity.意欲歪曲一个行动真实性质的东西。
Astrologers do not misrepresent their sources of information, and make every effort to verify their accuracy.占星家不歪曲他们的信息来源，并尽一切努力，以核实其准确性。

mode

[məʊd], [moʊd]


Image Search
n. 方式；模式；样式；风格
a way or manner in which something occurs or is experienced, expressed, or done.
an option allowing a change in the method of operation of a device, especially a camera.
a way of operating or using a system.
any of the distinct kinds or patterns of vibration of an oscillating system.
the character of a modal proposition (whether necessary, contingent, possible, or impossible).
another term for mood2.
a fashion or style in clothes, art, literature, etc.
the value that occurs most frequently in a given set of data.
a set of musical notes forming a scale and from which melodies and harmonies are constructed.
"his preferred mode of travel was a kayak"
"a camcorder in automatic mode"
"some computers provide several so-called processor modes"
"in the Seventies, the mode for activewear took hold"
The country girl was not used to their lavish mode of living.这个乡下姑娘不习惯他们奢侈的生活方式。
The spacecraft was in its recovery mode.这艘飞船处于返回状态。
Her new dress is the latest mode in this season.她的新连衣裙是这一季最新的款式。
He has no intention of changing his mode of attire.他没有意愿去改变自己穿着的风格。

modified

['mɒdɪfaɪd], ['mɒdəˌfaɪd]


Image Search
adj. 修改的
make partial or minor changes to (something), typically so as to improve it or to make it less extreme.
transform (a structure) from its original anatomical form during development or evolution.
(especially of an adjective) restrict or add to the sense of (a noun).
pronounce (a speech sound) in a way that is different from the norm for that sound.
"she may be prepared to modify her views"
"the target noun is modified by a “direction” word"
It's easy to tailor views, and you can even save the modified views for later use.定制视图十分简单,您甚至可保存修改后的视图以供将来使用。
There are windows with unsaved modified documents.视窗内有未储存但变更过的文件。

modify

['mɒdɪfaɪ], ['mɑːdɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 修改；更改；缓和；修饰
make partial or minor changes to (something), typically so as to improve it or to make it less extreme.
transform (a structure) from its original anatomical form during development or evolution.
(especially of an adjective) restrict or add to the sense of (a noun).
pronounce (a speech sound) in a way that is different from the norm for that sound.
"she may be prepared to modify her views"
"the target noun is modified by a “direction” word"
We have to modify our plan a little bit.我们得对我们的计划稍加修改。
The policy was agreed by the committee, but only in a modified form.那项政策经修改后才获得委员会同意。
The union has been forced to slightly modify its position.工会被迫稍稍改变立场。
He'll have to modify his views if he wants to be elected.他要想当选就得把观点改得缓和些。
Adverbs modify verbs and adjectives.副词修饰动词和形容词。

monitoring

['mɒnɪtərɪŋ], ['mɒnɪtərɪŋ]


Image Search
n. 监视；控制；监测；追踪
动词monitor的现在分词.
observe and check the progress or quality of (something) over a period of time; keep under systematic review.
maintain regular surveillance over.
listen to and report on (a foreign radio broadcast or a telephone conversation).
check or regulate the technical quality of (a radio transmission or television signal).
"equipment was installed to monitor air quality"
"it was easy for the enemy to monitor his movements"
I prefer to deploy monitoring across the entire server at once.我选择一次性地在整个服务器上部署监视。
The practice has shown that the monitoring system is effectual.实践表明,该监督控制系统是行之有效的。
The problem was discovered during routine monitoring.在常规检测中发现了问题。
Metrics monitoring customer satisfaction that are related to supplier manufacturing are understood and tracked.了解和追踪和供应商生产有关联的顾客满意度指标。
The alignment of the polar axis and the monitoring of the guiding process require absolute accuracy.极轴的摆放及追踪过程必须十分准确。

monotonous

[mə'nɒtənəs], [mə'nɑːtənəs]


Image Search
adj. 单调的
dull, tedious, and repetitious; lacking in variety and interest.
(of a sound or utterance) lacking in variation in tone or pitch.
"the statistics that he quotes with monotonous regularity"
"soon we heard a low, monotonous wailing of many voices"
The preacher's monotonous voice put me to sleep.传教士单调的声音催我入眠。
His monotonous whistling grated on her nerves.他单调的口哨声令她的神经受不了。

moral

['mɒrəl], ['mɔːrəl]


Image Search
adj. 道德的；精神上的
n. 寓意；道德；品行；伦理
concerned with the principles of right and wrong behavior and the goodness or badness of human character.
concerned with or derived from the code of interpersonal behavior that is considered right or acceptable in a particular society.
examining the nature of ethics and the foundations of good and bad character and conduct.
holding or manifesting high principles for proper conduct.
a lesson, especially one concerning what is right or prudent, that can be derived from a story, a piece of information, or an experience.
a person's standards of behavior or beliefs concerning what is and is not acceptable for them to do.
"the moral dimensions of medical intervention"
"an individual's ambitions may get out of step with the general moral code"
"moral philosophers"
"he prides himself on being a highly moral and ethical person"
"the moral of this story was that one must see the beauty in what one has"
"the corruption of public morals"
She regards his moral faults with charity.她宽恕他的品行不端。
We differ about moral standards.我们对道德标准看法不一致。
His behavior transgressed the moral rules of the social conduct.他的行为违背了社会行为的道德准则。
It comprises two main sets of rights: the economic rights and the moral rights.版权包括两种主要的权利:经济权利和精神权利。
The moral of this story is ‘Better late than never'.这个故事的寓意是｀迟做总比不做好＇.
People can draw a moral from tales.人们可以从寓言里吸取经验教训。
You may draw your own moral from it.你可以从中得出自己的教训。
As a Puritan, he is strict in moral and religion.作为清教徒，他的道德和宗教观念都很严格。
Taking drygs is also a moral and ethical problem.用药问题也涉及到伦理道德问题。
She threw aside all her moral teachings and inhibitions.她把她所讲的伦理道德全抛到了一边。

mortal

['mɔːtl], ['mɔːrtl]


Image Search
adj. 致命的；终有一死的；不共戴天的；极度的
n. 凡人
(of a living human being, often in contrast to a divine being) subject to death.
relating to humanity as subject to death.
conceivable or imaginable.
causing or liable to cause death; fatal.
(of a battle) fought to the death.
(of an enemy or a state of hostility) admitting or allowing no reconciliation until death.
denoting a grave sin that is regarded as depriving the soul of divine grace.
(of a feeling, especially fear) very intense.
very great.
long and tedious.
a human being subject to death, often contrasted with a divine being.
a person contrasted with others regarded as being of higher status or ability.
"all men are mortal"
"the coffin held the mortal remains of her uncle"
"punishment out of all mortal proportion to the offense"
"a mortal disease"
"from the outbuildings came the screams of men in mortal combat"
"parents live in mortal fear of children's diseases"
"he was in a mortal hurry"
"for three mortal days it rained"
"an ambassador had to live in a style that was not expected of lesser mortals"
His injuries proved mortal.他的伤成了致命伤。
He received a mortal wound soon after the battle began.战争开始后不久, 他就受到了致命的重伤。
Man is mortal.人都是会死的。
The antagonisms between the two empires and systems were mortal.这两个帝国和两种制度之间，有着不共戴天的仇恨。
She lives in mortal terror of her husband's anger.她极度害怕她丈夫发脾气。
No mortal could vie with Zeus.任何凡人都没法与宙斯匹敌。

motivate

['məʊtɪveɪt], ['moʊtɪveɪt]


Image Search
vt. 激发(兴趣或欲望)；给与动机
provide (someone) with a motive for doing something.
stimulate (someone's) interest in or enthusiasm for doing something.
"he was primarily motivated by the desire for profit"
"I'm going to motivate kids to study civics"
He is just sitting there doing nothing. He needs to be motivated.他坐在那儿什么也不干,他需要一点动力去激发他。
The crime appears to have been motivated by hatred.犯罪似乎都来自于仇恨。
A good teacher is one who can motivate his students.好老师是能激励学生的老师。

motivation

[ˌməʊtɪ'veɪʃn], [ˌməʊtɪ'veɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 动机；动力；刺激；积极性
the reason or reasons one has for acting or behaving in a particular way.
the general desire or willingness of someone to do something.
"escape can be a strong motivation for travel"
"keep staff up to date and maintain interest and motivation"
bend on sth
Without direction and motivation, a person would not know what to do.一个人缺乏方向和动力就不知道该干些什么。
The most intrinsic motivation for learning is the child's spontaneous interests.学习的最为内在的刺激是儿童自发的兴趣。
They lack the motivation to study.他们缺乏学习的积极性。

mutiny

['mjuːtəni], ['mjuːtəni]


Image Search
n. 兵变；叛乱
v. 叛变
an open rebellion against the proper authorities, especially by soldiers or sailors against their officers.
refuse to obey the orders of a person in authority.
"a mutiny by those manning the weapons could trigger a global war"
There is a talk of mutiny among the sailors.水手中有种哗变的传说。
He led a military mutiny against the senior generals.他发动了一场反对高级将领的兵变。
Mutiny was effectually laid to rest for the moment.叛乱总算暂时平定了下来。
Discontent stirred the men to mutiny.不满情绪酿成了兵变。
The captain was accused of inciting other officers to mutiny.该上尉被控煽动军官叛变。

mutual

['mjuːtʃuəl], ['mjuːtʃuəl]


Image Search
adj. 共同的；相互的
(of a feeling or action) experienced or done by each of two or more parties toward the other or others.
(of two or more people) having the same specified relationship to each other.
held in common by two or more parties.
denoting an insurance company or other corporate organization owned by its members and dividing some or all of its profits between them.
"a partnership based on mutual respect and understanding"
"they were mutual beneficiaries of the settlement"
"we were introduced by a mutual friend"
"the world's oldest mutual insurance company"
Other organizations have joined the confederation for mutual benefit.其他组织为了共同的利益也加入了这个联盟。
My friend and I have mutual enthusiasm for music.我和我的朋友对音乐有着共同的爱好。
Let's give mutual support and inspiration to each other.让我们互相支持，互相鼓励。
Language differences are often a barrier to mutual understanding.语言不同,常常阻碍到彼此的了解。
Negotiations between unions and management are made more difficult by mutual distrust.工会和资方之间的谈判由于互不信任而愈加困难。

navigate

['nævɪɡeɪt], ['nævɪɡeɪt]


Image Search
vi. 航行；驾驶；操纵
vt. 航行；驾驶；横渡；<口>设法穿过，走过，经过
plan and direct the route or course of a ship, aircraft, or other form of transportation, especially by using instruments or maps.
travel on a desired course after planning a route.
(of an animal) find its way, especially over a long distance.
(of a passenger in a vehicle) assist the driver by reading the map and planning a route.
(of a ship or boat) sail; proceed.
sail or travel over (a stretch of water or terrain), especially carefully or with difficulty.
guide (a vessel or vehicle) over a specified route or terrain.
move from one accessible page, section, or view of a file or website to another.
"they navigated by the stars"
"he taught them how to navigate across the oceans"
"whales use their own inbuilt sonar system to navigate"
"we'll go in my car—you can navigate"
"we sailed out surrounded by loose ice while navigating around larger grounded icebergs"
"ships had been lost while navigating the narrows"
"she navigated the car safely through the traffic"
"the new layout makes it easier to navigate through their atlas of world maps"
The river became too narrow and shallow to navigate.河道变得又窄又浅，无法航行。
Many captains depend on electronic devices to navigate their ships.许多船长依靠电子仪器来驾驶他们的船。
Hyperlinks make it much easier to navigate through a document.超链接使到你在文档中更容易的操纵。
The large ship could not navigate the river.那艘大轮船不能在河里航行。
Many captains depend on electronic devices to navigate their ships.许多船长依靠电子仪器来驾驶他们的船。
The city's organic growth hasn't exactly made it the easiest place to navigate.这个城市有组织的发展并没有使得其成为易于驾驶的地方。
He was the first man to navigate the Atlantic alone.他是第一位单独横渡大西洋的人。
We next had to navigate a complex network of committees.我们下一步必须设法使各级委员会予以通过。
I don't like having to navigate London's crowded streets.我不愿意在伦敦拥挤的街道上穿行。

negative

['neɡətɪv], ['neɡətɪv]


Image Search
adj. 否定的；消极的；负面的；负的
n. 否定；反面意见；底片；[数]负数
vt. 否定
consisting in or characterized by the absence rather than the presence of distinguishing features.
(of a statement or decision) expressing or implying denial, disagreement, or refusal.
(of the results of a test or experiment) indicating that a certain substance or condition is not present or does not exist.
(of a person) not having a specified condition or showing traces of a specified substance in their body.
denoting a complete lack of something.
(of a word, clause, or proposition) expressing denial, negation, or refutation; stating or asserting that something is not the case.
(of a person, attitude, or situation) not desirable or optimistic.
(of a quantity) less than zero; to be subtracted from others or from zero.
denoting a direction of decrease or reversal.
of, containing, producing, or denoting the kind of electric charge carried by electrons.
(of a photographic image) showing light and shade or colors reversed from those of the original.
relating to or denoting any of the earth or water signs, considered passive in nature.
a word or statement that expresses denial, disagreement, or refusal.
a bad, unwelcome, or unpleasant quality, characteristic, or aspect of a situation or person.
a word, affix, or phrase expressing negation.
another term for negation.
a photographic image made on film or specially prepared glass that shows the light and shade or color values reversed from the original, and from which positive prints can be made.
a result of a test or experiment indicating that a certain substance is not present or a certain condition does not exist.
the part of an electric circuit that is at a lower electrical potential than another part designated as having zero electrical potential.
a number less than zero.
no (usually used in a military context).
reject; refuse to accept; veto.
disprove; contradict.
render ineffective; neutralize.
"that, I take it, was a negative answer"
"a negative test result"
"so far all the patients have tested negative for TB"
"they were described as having negative vulnerability to water entry"
"the new tax was having a very negative effect on car sales"
"the industry suffered negative growth in 1992"
"she replied in the negative"
"confidence will not be instilled by harping solely on the negative"
"the percentage of false negatives generated by a cancer test was of great concern"
"“Any snags, Captain?” “Negative, she's running like clockwork.”"
"the bill was negatived by 130 votes to 129"
"the insurer's main arguments were negatived by Lawrence"
"should criminal law allow consent to negative what would otherwise be a crime?"
Now I am afraid of getting a negative response.现在真害怕收到否定的答复。
You can't learn anything with negative attitude.你用消极的态度什么也学不到。
He conducted a negative campaign against his opponent.他对他的对手进行了负面打击。
This negative pressure phase is of short duration.负压周期的延续时间很短。
The answer to my request was in the negative.对我的请求的答复是否定的。
The negative won the debate.持反对意见的一方在辩论中获胜。
I need five enlargements from this negative.我要把这张底片放大5张。
Many students find it difficult to deal with negatives in maths than positives很多学生觉得在数学中负数要比正数难处理。
The government negatived our request for financing.政府否决了我们融资的请求。

nestle

['nesl], ['nesl]


Image Search
v. 依偎；（舒适地）安顿
settle or lie comfortably within or against something.
(of a place) lie or be situated in a half-hidden or obscured position.
"the baby deer nestled in her arms"
"picturesque villages nestle in the wooded hills"
She nestled her head on his shoulder.她将头依偎在他的肩上。
The village nestled at the foot of the hill.那村庄位于山脚下。
The child nestled up to its mother and fell asleep.孩子倚著母亲舒服地睡了。
The dog nestled up against the warm radiator.狗倚著暖烘烘的散热器。
I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels.我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。

network

['netwɜːk], ['netwɜːrk]


Image Search
n. 网点；网络；网状系统；广播公司
an arrangement of intersecting horizontal and vertical lines.
a group or system of interconnected people or things.
a complex system of roads, railroads, or other transportation routes.
a group of people who exchange information, contacts, and experience for professional or social purposes.
a group of broadcasting stations that connect for the simultaneous broadcast of a program.
a number of interconnected computers, machines, or operations.
a system of connected electrical conductors.
connect as or operate with a network.
link (computers or other machines) to operate interactively.
interact with others to exchange information and develop professional or social contacts.
"a trade network"
"a network of railroads"
"a support network"
"network television"
"specialized computers that manage multiple outside connections to a network"
"the stock exchanges have proven to be resourceful in networking these deals"
"more and more PCs are networked together"
"it's so important to network when starting a new business"
The fabrics are merchandised through a network of dealers.通过经销网点销售纺织品。
The Internet is a worldwide computer network.因特网是一个全球计算机网络系统。
She gave me a diagram of railway network.她给了我一张铁路网图解。
The broadcast was carried on national network .这个节目通过全国广播网进行广播。

neutral

['njuːtrəl], ['nuːtrəl]


Image Search
adj. 中立的；中性的；空档的；素净色的
n. 中立者；空挡位置
not helping or supporting either side in a conflict, disagreement, etc.; impartial.
belonging to an impartial party, country, or group.
having no strongly marked or positive characteristics or features.
neither acid nor alkaline; having a pH of about 7.
electrically neither positive nor negative.
an impartial or unbiased country or person.
a neutral color or shade, especially light gray or beige.
a disengaged position of gears in which the engine is disconnected from the driven parts.
an electrically neutral point, terminal, conductor, or wire.
"during the Second World War, Portugal was neutral"
"on neutral ground"
"the tone was neutral, devoid of sentiment"
"he acted as a neutral between the parties"
"she slipped the gear into neutral"
That country remained neutral in the war.那个国家在那场战争中保持中立。
He has a rather neutral character.他品性平平。
When you start the engine, be sure the car is in neutral.你在发动引擎时，一定要让汽车处于空档。
A neutral tie can be worn with a shirt of any colour.暗灰色的领带配什麽颜色的衬衣都行。
For Britain, Switzerland was a useful and friendly neutral.对英国来说,瑞士是一个有利和友好的中立国。
The car's in neutral.那汽车在空挡位置.

nevertheless

[ˌnevəðə'les], [ˌnevərðə'les]


Image Search
adv. 尽管如此；不过；仍然
conj. 然而；不过
in spite of that; notwithstanding; all the same.
"statements which, although literally true, are nevertheless misleading"
Our defeat was expected；nevertheless，it was disappointing.我们的失败是意料中的事；尽管如此,还是令人失望。
We can't take your advice. Nevertheless, thank you for putting it.我们不能接受您的建议。不过,谢谢您提出来。
Despite his injured ankle, he nevertheless succeeded in gaining the final against Germany.尽管踝骨受伤,他仍然打入了与德国队的决赛。
Nevertheless as an exceptional measure, we have decided to overlook its late submission.然而,作为一项特别措施,我们决定不计较逾期问题。
We are going nevertheless we shall return.我们要走了, 不过我们还要回来。

nimble

['nɪmbl], ['nɪmbl]


Image Search
adj. 敏捷的；伶俐的；机敏的
quick and light in movement or action; agile.
(of the mind) quick to comprehend.
"with a deft motion of her nimble fingers"
"she is well-read and intellectually nimble"
He is a nimble climber.他是个敏捷的登山者。
She knitted a pair of mittens for me with her nimble fingers.她用灵巧的双手为我织了一副手套。
The nurse sewed up the wound with nimble fingers.护士用灵巧的手指缝好了伤口。
Habits will make us have two nimble hands and a clumsy brain.习惯会使我们的双手伶俐而头脑笨拙。
He is a nimble and versatile wit.他是一个机敏而又多才多艺的才子。

nonconformist

[ˌnɒnkən'fɔːmɪst], [ˌnɑːnkən'fɔːrmɪst]


Image Search
adj. 不墨守成规的
n. 不墨守成规的人
Nonconformist.
adj. 不信奉英国国教的
n. 不信奉英国国教的人
a person whose behavior or views do not conform to prevailing ideas or practices.
a member of a Protestant church in England that dissents from the established Anglican Church.
of or characterized by behavior or views that do not conform to prevailing ideas or practices.
relating to Nonconformists or their principles and practices.
An eccentric or nonconformist person, especially a member of a counterculture.离经叛道之人反常或不符合常规之人，尤指反主流文化的成员
A Nonconformist chapel, especially a Baptist or Methodist one.非英国国教的礼拜堂基督新教徒的教堂，尤指浸信会或卫理公会教徒
Angel Clare had sadly disappointed his father, first by nonconformist views and then by sincere scruples against taking orders.安吉尔·克莱使他的父亲十分失望，先是他不信奉国教的观点，后来又顾虑重重，不愿意当牧师。

nonetheless

[ˌnʌnðə'les], [ˌnʌnðə'les]


Image Search
adv. 尽管如此(仍然)
in spite of that; nevertheless.
"it was the barest of welcomes, but it was a welcome nonetheless"
Though he's fool, I like him nonetheless.虽然他很笨, 我仍然喜欢他。
Nonetheless, the science is pushing forward at a rapid pace.尽管如此，研究正在迅速向前推进。
There are possible risks, but nonetheless, we feel it's a sound investment.有可能存在危险,但是我们仍然感到这是可靠的投资。

normal

['nɔːml], ['nɔːrml]


Image Search
adj. 正常的；正规的；精神健全的
n. 常态；标准
conforming to a standard; usual, typical, or expected.
(of a person) free from physical or mental disorders.
(of a line, ray, or other linear feature) intersecting a given line or surface at right angles.
(of a salt solution) containing the same salt concentration as the blood.
(of a solution) containing one gram-equivalent of solute per liter.
denoting a fault or faulting in which a relative downward movement occurred in the strata situated on the upper side of the fault plane.
the usual, average, or typical state or condition.
a person who is conventional or healthy.
a line at right angles to a given line or surface.
"it's quite normal for puppies to bolt their food"
"her temperature was above normal"
Everything is absolutely normal.一切完全正常。
She refused to conform to the normal social conventions.她拒绝遵从正常的社会习俗。
People who commit crimes like that aren't normal.犯这种罪的人心理都不正常.
It was several days before the floodwater sank and life returned to normal.过了几天洪水才退,生活恢复了正常。
Her temperature is above normal.她的体温高于正常标准。

norms

[nɔːms], [nɔːms]


Image Search
n. 规范
名词norm的复数形式.
something that is usual, typical, or standard.
a standard or pattern, especially of social behavior, that is typical or expected of a group.
"this system has been the norm in Germany for decades"
"the norms of good behavior in the Civil Service"
The third use of the law norms the Christian life.律法的第三个功用规范着基督徒的生活。
How can raptor-raising norms be established?怎样建立养鹰的规范？

notably

['nəʊtəbli], ['noʊtəbli]


Image Search
adv. 显著地；值得注意地；特别地
especially; in particular.
in a way that is striking or remarkable.
"a diet low in animal fat protects against potentially fatal diseases, notably diabetes"
"such a statement is notably absent from the administration's proposals"
British writer known for his essays and children's books, notably The Wind in the Willows(1908).格雷厄姆，肯尼思1859－1932英国作家，以其散文和儿童文学著名，著名的有杨柳风(1908年)
Many students were absent, notably the monitor.许多学生缺席，特别是连班长也没来。

notify

['nəʊtɪfaɪ], ['noʊtɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 通知；报告；通告
inform (someone) of something, typically in a formal or official manner.
give notice of or report (something) formally or officially.
"you will be notified of our decision as soon as possible"
"if he does not notify the occurrences, he may be guilty of nondisclosure"
Please notify us of any change of address.地址如有变动，请通知我们。
She notified us of the meeting.她通知我们开会。
We'll notify her to draw up a contract.我们将通知她起草一份合同。
They will notify her when to appear in court.他们将通知她何时出庭。
The nurse must notify the doctor if the patient shows unusual symptoms.护士需向医生报告异常情况。
Banks are also obligated to notify the Internal Revenue Service of certain questionable transactions.第三种信息来源来自银行有义务提交有关方面存在问题的报告给地方税务机关。
We will notify participants when the beta test is nearing completion.当测试接近尾声，我们会通告参与测试者。

notion

['nəʊʃn], ['noʊʃn]


Image Search
n. 观念；概念；想法；主张
a conception of or belief about something.
an impulse or desire, especially one of a whimsical kind.
items used in sewing, such as buttons, pins, and hooks.
"children have different notions about the roles of their parents"
"she had a notion to call her friend at work"
State control is a very un-American notion.实行国家控制是根本违背美国观念的。
They want a system based on the notions of personal equality and liberty.他们想要基于人的平等﹑ 自由等概念的制度。
We had a notion that he was telling a lie.我们当时的看法是他在说谎。
She dinged the notion into our ears.她老是唠唠叨叨地跟我们讲那个想法。(或：她把那个想法反反复复地灌输给我们)。
Your head is full of silly notions.你满脑子都是糊涂思想。

notwithstanding

[ˌnɒtwɪθ'stændɪŋ], [ˌnɑːtwɪθ'stændɪŋ]


Image Search
adv. 虽然；尽管
prep. 纵使
conj. 虽然
in spite of.
nevertheless; in spite of this.
although; in spite of the fact that.
"notwithstanding the evidence, the consensus is that the jury will not reach a verdict"
"I didn't like it. Notwithstanding, I remained calm"
"notwithstanding that the hall was packed with bullies, our champion played on steadily and patiently"
He went, notwithstanding he was ordered to stay.他虽被命令不许去，但还是去了。
Notwithstanding her naughtiness, I love my little girl.尽管我的小姑娘很淘气，我还是很爱她。
Notwithstanding the bad weather, the match went on.尽管天气很糟，比赛还是照常进行。
He still went home, notwithstanding the midnight.尽管已近午夜，他还是回家去了。
Many people told me not to try, but I went ahead notwithstanding.很多人都劝我不要尝试,我还是决意去做了。

nuclear

['njuːkliə(r)], ['nuːkliər]


Image Search
adj. 原子核的；原子能的；核心的
relating to the nucleus of an atom.
denoting, relating to, or powered by the energy released in nuclear fission or fusion.
denoting, possessing, or involving weapons using nuclear energy.
relating to the nucleus of a cell.
"nuclear submarines"
"nuclear nations"
"nuclear DNA"
Nuclear binding energies are strikingly high.原子核的结合能是极大的。
The college students are active to crusade against the nuclear weapons.大学生们积极投入开展反对核武器的运 动。
They decided to establish a nuclear power station.他们决定修建一所核电站。
A nuclear family consists of parents and their children only.核心家庭一般只有父母和孩子两代。

numb

[nʌm], [nʌm]


Image Search
adj. 麻木的；失去知觉的
vt. 使麻木；使失去知觉
deprived of the power of sensation.
unable to think, feel, or respond normally.
deprive of feeling or responsiveness.
cause (a sensation) to be felt less intensely; deaden.
"my feet were numb with cold"
"the tragic events left us shocked and numb"
"the cold had numbed her senses"
"vodka might numb the pain in my hand"
My fingers were so numb that I could hardly write.我的手指都麻木了几乎不能写字。
I've just been to the dentist and my face is still numb.我刚刚去看了牙医，脸上现在还没知觉呢。
The anaesthetic made his whole face go numb.麻醉药使他的整张脸失去了知觉。
His leg was numbed by the intense pain.他的腿因剧痛而麻木。
She was completely numbed by the shock of her father's death.她父亲去世造成的打击使她目瞪神呆.

oaf

[əʊf], [oʊf]


Image Search
n. 蠢人；笨拙的人
a stupid, uncultured, or clumsy person.
The oaf stumbled over the bucket, spilling all the water.那个笨手笨脚的人绊到了木桶，把水全给泼了。
You clumsy oaf that's the second glass you've broken today!你这个笨家伙--这是你今天打碎的第二个玻璃杯！

objective

[əb'dʒektɪv], [əb'dʒektɪv]


Image Search
adj. 客观的；真实的；宾语的
n. 目标；目的；[物]物镜；[语]宾语
(of a person or their judgment) not influenced by personal feelings or opinions in considering and representing facts.
not dependent on the mind for existence; actual.
relating to or denoting a case of nouns and pronouns used as the object of a transitive verb or a preposition.
a thing aimed at or sought; a goal.
the objective case.
the lens in a telescope or microscope nearest to the object observed.
"historians try to be objective and impartial"
"a matter of objective fact"
"the system has achieved its objective"
From any objective perspective,it is simply too long.从客观的角度来讲，这实在是太长了。
She gives an objective report of what has happened.她就发生的事情进行客观的报告。
He has told a story which sound not objective.他讲了听起来不真实的一个故事。
Her principal objective was international fame as a scientist.她的主要目标是当个有国际声誉的科学家。
Our ultimate objective is the removal of all nuclear weapons.我们的最终目标是消除所有核武器。
The objective is to promote conservation of natural resources.目的是加强保护自然资源。
What are the problems that must be solved to achieve this objective?为了这个目的，有些什么问题应该解决的呢?
This objective produces only very little scattered light.此物镜仅产生很小的散射光。
The paper discussed some issues on the objective amplification in a light-cutting microscope, and solved its use problems.文章主要就光切法显微镜物镜放大倍数确定问题加以阐述，解决了显微镜的使用问题。

obsolete

['ɒbsəliːt], [ˌɑːbsə'liːt]


Image Search
adj. 已废弃的；过时的
no longer produced or used; out of date.
(of a part or characteristic of an organism) less developed than formerly or in a related species; rudimentary; vestigial.
cause (a product or idea) to be or become obsolete by replacing it with something new.
"the disposal of old and obsolete machinery"
"we're trying to stimulate the business by obsoleting last year's designs"
The army plans to phase out the equipment as it becomes obsolete.军队计划淘汰这些设备，因为它们已经报废了。
This usage of the word is obsolete.这个词的此类用法已经废弃了。
The obsolete regime is about to collapse.那过时的政权即将崩溃。
You always depend on an obsolete viewpoint.你老是信赖一个过时的观点。

obtained

[əb'teɪnd], [əb'teɪnd]


Image Search
adj. 获得的
动词obtain过去式和过去分词.
get, acquire, or secure (something).
be prevalent, customary, or established.
"an opportunity to obtain advanced degrees"
"the price of silver fell to that obtaining elsewhere in the ancient world"
A promise obtained by force is legally null.一个以武力获得的契约在法律上是无效的。
The results obtained must be checked.获得的结果必须加以校核。

obvious

['ɒbviəs], ['ɑːbviəs]


Image Search
adj. 明显的；显然的
easily perceived or understood; clear, self-evident, or apparent.
predictable and lacking in subtlety.
"unemployment has been the most obvious cost of the recession"
"it was an obvious remark to make"
It is obvious that she is very clever.很明显，她挺聪明。
The embassy is an obvious target for terrorist attacks.大使馆是恐怖分子攻击的明显目标。
The merits of the scheme are quite obvious.该计画的可取之处是相当明显的。
All great truths are obvious truths. But no all obvious truths are great truths.所有伟大的真理都是显而易见的事实,但并非所有显而易见的事实都是伟大的真理。

occupational

[ˌɒkju'peɪʃənl], [ˌɑːkju'peɪʃənl]


Image Search
adj. 职业的
relating to a job or profession.
"hepatitis B may be an occupational disease for some healthcare workers"
The report pointed out that social and occupational factors normally play an important part in determining mortality.报告指出，社会与职业的因素在正常情况下对死亡就有重要影响。
Statistics on occupational mortality have been of greater value in these respects than in initiating the study of new aetiological agents.不同职业的死亡率的统计对这些方面的价值较之对于开展新的病因研究的价值更大。

occur

[ə'kɜː(r)], [ə'kɜːr]


Image Search
vi. 发生；存在；出现；想到
happen; take place.
exist or be found to be present in a place or under a particular set of conditions.
(of a thought or idea) come into the mind of (someone).
"the accident occurred at about 3:30 p.m."
"radon occurs naturally in rocks such as granite"
"it occurred to him that he hadn't eaten"
That plane crash occurred only minutes after take-off.空难在起飞几分钟后就发生了。
Misprints occur on every page.每页都有印刷错误。
A connection error might occur.可能会出现连接错误。
Didn't it occur to you that he was lying?你当时没想到他在撒谎吗？

odd

[ɒd], [ɑːd]


Image Search
adj. 奇数的；古怪的；零散的；剩余的
different from what is usual or expected; strange.
(of whole numbers such as 3 and 5) having one left over as a remainder when divided by two.
in the region of or somewhat more than a particular number or quantity.
happening or occurring infrequently and irregularly; occasional.
spare; unoccupied.
separated from a usual pair or set and therefore out of place or mismatched.
"the neighbors thought him very odd"
"she looked younger than her fifty-odd years"
"neither did she want a secret affair, snatching odd moments together"
"when you've got an odd five minutes, could I have a word?"
"he's wearing odd socks"
1,3, 5 and 7 are odd numbers.1,3, 5 和 7 是奇数。
Graphs are on even pages and tables are on odd pages.图在偶数页,表格在奇数页。
It's very odd that she didn't reply to our letter.她没有回我们的信是件很奇怪的事。
On the way, one can watch pines in all kinds of odd shapes.一路上,人们可以观赏到各种各样形态怪异的松树。
It is so odd that I am move to ask her where she get it.那东西十分希罕, 我禁不住问她是从哪里弄来的。
His formal clothes made him the odd one out in the club.他衣冠楚楚，在俱乐部中如鹤立鸡群。
He does odd jobs for me from time to time.他有时给我干点零活。

offset

['ɒfset], ['ɔːfset]


Image Search
vt. 抵消；弥补；用平版印刷
vi. 形成分支
n. 补偿；平版印刷；支派；弯管；[计]偏移量
a consideration or amount that diminishes or balances the effect of a contrary one.
the amount or distance by which something is out of line.
a short distance measured perpendicularly from the main line of measurement.
a small deviation or bias in a voltage or current.
a side shoot from a plant serving for propagation.
a spur in a mountain range.
a sloping ledge in a wall or other feature where the thickness of the part above is diminished.
a bend in a pipe to carry it past an obstacle.
a method of printing in which ink is transferred from a plate or stone to a uniform rubber surface and from that to the paper.
counteract (something) by having an opposing force or effect.
place out of line.
(of ink or a freshly printed page) transfer an impression to the next leaf or sheet.
"an offset against taxable profits"
"these wheels have an offset of four inches"
"the deficit has been more than offset by capital inflows"
"several places where the ridge was offset at right angles to its length"
The pay raise will be offset by inflation.增加的工资会被通货膨胀所抵销。
Higher mortgage rates are partly offset by increased tax allowances.抵押款提高了，其中一部分可由免税额增加而抵消。
Hedge can help them offset inventory loss when commodity price fall.在商品价格下跌时,套期保值能够帮助他们抵补存货价跌的损失。
He raised his prices to offset the increased cost of materials.他提高售价以补偿材料增加的成本。
Offset requirements also vary between these areas.补偿要求在这些地区也各有不同。

ongoing

['ɒnɡəʊɪŋ], ['ɑːnɡoʊɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 进行的；不断发展的
continuing; still in progress.
"ongoing negotiations"
The police investigation is ongoing.警方的调查在持续进行中。
This problem may be temporary or ongoing.这个问题可能是临时的或者是正在进行的。
He interrupted the ongoing discussion and announced a notice.他打断正在进行的讨论，宣读了一项通知。
The vitality of our entire team from the ongoing study.我们的活力源于整个团队的不断学习。

onset

['ɒnset], ['ɑːnset]


Image Search
n. 攻击；进攻；开始
the beginning of something, especially something unpleasant.
a military attack.
"the onset of winter"
The fierce onset of the enemy broke the ranks of the army.敌人的猛烈攻击致使全军大乱。
Our troops withstood the onset of the enemy.我们的部队抵挡住了敌人的进攻。
The onset of the enemy took us by surprise.敌人的进攻出乎我们意外。
He went to see a doctor at the onset of a fever.他开始发烧时便去看医生了。
The drug must be taken from the onset of the infection.这种药必须在感染的最初期就开始服用。

option

['ɒpʃn], ['ɑːpʃn]


Image Search
n. 选择权；可选物
v. 得到或获准进行选择
a thing that is or may be chosen.
the freedom, power, or right to choose something.
a right to buy or sell a particular thing at a specified price within a set time.
an offensive play in which the ball carrier has the option to run, pass, hand off, or lateral.
buy or sell an option on (something).
transfer a player (to a minor league team) with an option to recall him.
"choose the cheapest options for supplying energy"
"she was given the option of resigning or being dismissed"
"Columbia Pictures has an option on the script"
"his second script will have been optioned by the time you read this"
He had no option but to agree.他除了同意外别无选择。
I haven't much option in the matter.在这件事情上我无可选择。
Make a list of the various options.列出可供选择的项目。
He had optioned for a film several short stories about two policemen.他为一部影片选择了几篇关于两位警察的短篇小说。

optional

['ɒpʃənl], ['ɑːpʃənl]


Image Search
adj. 任选的
available to be chosen but not obligatory.
"a wide range of optional excursions is offered"
The insurance cover is optional.保险范围可以随意选择。
It is optional with you.那是你的自由。
The goods are optional, but only one.这些物品是可以任选的, 但只能选一个。
A 4-speed automatic transmission is optional.四段自动变速器是可自由选择的。

oracle

['ɒrəkl], ['ɔːrəkl]


Image Search
n. 神谕；神谕处；传达神谕的人；能提供可靠意见的人
a priest or priestess acting as a medium through whom advice or prophecy was sought from the gods in classical antiquity.
a place at which divine advice or prophecy was sought.
a person or thing regarded as an infallible authority or guide on something.
a response or message given by an oracle, typically one that is ambiguous or obscure.
"casting the attorney general as the oracle for and guardian of the public interest is simply impossible"
In times of difficulty, she prayed for an oracle to guide her.在困难的时候,她祈祷神谕来指引她。
The earth is the great parent of all, the stones are her bones; these we may cast behind us; this, I think, the oracle means.大地是万物之母，石头就是她的尸骨。我们可以往身后扔石头，我想神谕说的就是这个意思。
This oracle was still flourishing in 332 B.C.这个神示殿在公元前332年依然很兴旺。
They consulted the oracle at Delphi.他们在德尔斐神示所向神请示。
The message was passed by an oracle.这个信息是由传神谕者传递的。
My sister's the oracle on beauty matters.我妹妹是美容方面的大行家。

orientation

[ˌɔːriən'teɪʃn], [ˌɔːriən'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 适应；定位；情况介绍；信仰；倾向；[计]定向；（学生）迎新会
the determination of the relative position of something or someone (especially oneself).
the relative physical position or direction of something.
an animal's change of position in response to an external stimulus, especially with respect to compass directions.
familiarization with something.
a program of introduction for newcomers to a college or other institution.
a person's basic attitude, beliefs, or feelings in relation to a particular subject or issue.
short for sexual orientation.
"the child's surroundings provide clues to help in orientation"
"two complex shapes, presented in different orientations"
"their training and orientation comes out of magazine and newspaper distribution"
"she attended freshman orientation"
"his book is well worth reading, regardless of your political orientation"
I needed some orientation at this stage.我在这个阶段需要熟悉情况。
The arrangement must show a preferred orientation.排列还必须呈现特定的指向。
The following action steps are a part of the foreman's orientation of the new worker.以下内容是工头指导新工人时应采取的部分措施:介绍新的工作。
Christian Church that truly welcomes everybody disregarding your sexual orientation or denomination.一个不论宗派及性取向，真正欢迎所有人的基督信仰教会。
Second, we demonstrate that theology, specifically an orientation toward this world or heaven, determined whether religious resources were available to antislavery organizations.第二，我们说明了宗教信仰，尤其是宣扬今生或天堂的宗教，决定了宗教资源能否被废奴组织所利用。
We must hold to the correct political orientation.我们必须坚持正确的政治方向。

outcomes


Image Search
n. 产出，结果，成果（名词outcome的复数形式）
the way a thing turns out; a consequence.
"it is the outcome of the vote that counts"
Comprehensive review of end-stage renal disease dialyses outcomes research.终末期肾脏病透析治疗产出研究综述。
Government failure is government intervention that fails to improve economic outcomes.政府失灵是指政府干预并不能改善经济产出。

output

['aʊtpʊt], ['aʊtpʊt]


Image Search
n. 产量；输出功率；输出
vt. 输出(信息等)
the amount of something produced by a person, machine, or industry.
the action or process of producing something.
the power, energy, or other results supplied by a device or system.
a place where power or information leaves a system.
produce, deliver, or supply (data) using a computer or other device.
"efficiency can lead to higher outputs"
"the output of epinephrine"
"the quality of the output from the printer is very good"
"you can output the image directly to a video recording system"
Output has tripled.产量已增加到三倍。
This country ranks last in industrial output.这个国家的工业生产排名最後。
The average output of the factory is 20 cars a day.该工厂的平均产量是每天20辆汽车。
Have you got the one which has an output of 150 horsepower?你们有没有输出功率是一百五十（150）马力的?
These computers have an audio output.这些电脑有音频输出。
There is hum or noise in the speaker output.扬声器输出声带嗡嗡声或杂音。
The printer will output colour chart.打印机将会输出彩色图表。
Computers can now output data much more quickly.现在计算机能更快地输出数据。
The program will output it into a file.这个程序将把它输出到一个文件里。

outright

['aʊtraɪt], ['aʊtraɪt]


Image Search
adj. 直率的；完全的；彻底的
adv. 率直地；立刻地；彻底地
altogether; completely.
without reservation; openly.
immediately.
not by degrees or installments.
open and direct; not concealed.
total; complete.
undisputed; clear.
"logging has been banned outright"
"she couldn't ask him outright"
"the impact killed four horses outright"
"they decided to buy the company outright"
"an outright refusal"
"the outright abolition of the death penalty"
"an outright victory"
Dissatisfaction often leads to outright treason.政治上的不满常常导致断然的背叛。
The statement was an outright lie.这话是十足的谎言。
They can now establish outright dictatorship.他们现在可以建立起彻头彻尾的独裁制度了。
I told him outright what I thought of him.我坦率地向他说出我对他的想法。
If you have a complaint you should tell me outright .如果你有不满意的事你应该直率地对我说。
Most of the crash victims were killed outright.飞机坠毁的遇难者大都是立即惨死。
She own outright.她大获全胜。

ovation

[əʊ'veɪʃn], [oʊ'veɪʃn]


Image Search

a sustained and enthusiastic show of appreciation from an audience, especially by means of applause.
a processional entrance into Rome by a victorious commander, of lesser honor than a triumph.
"the performance received a thundering ovation"
The hero received a great ovation from the crowd.那位英雄受到人群的热烈欢迎。
He gets a standing ovation as he moves off stage.他离开舞台时，全体观众起立热烈鼓掌。

overall

[ˌəʊvər'ɔːl], [ˌoʊvər'ɔːl]


Image Search
adj. 全部的；总体的；全面考虑的
adv. 总的来说；总共
n. 罩衫；工作服
taking everything into account.
in all parts; taken as a whole.
a garment consisting of trousers with a front flap over the chest held up by straps over the shoulders, made of sturdy material and worn especially as casual or working clothes.
a loose-fitting coat or one-piece garment worn over ordinary clothes for protection against dirt or heavy wear.
"the overall effect is impressive"
"overall, 10,000 jobs will go"
The overall measurement of this room is 80 square meters.这个屋子的总面积是80平方米。
Please provide your overall evaluation.请给出你的总体评价。
There's been an overall improvement recently.近来各方面都有所改进。
Overall, the tone of the book is satirical.总的说来,这本书是讽刺性的。
How much will it cost overall?一共多少钱?
The shop assistant was wearing a white overall.那店员穿著白色长罩衣。

overlap

[ˌəʊvə'læp], [ˌoʊvər'læp]


Image Search
vt. 重叠；重复
vi. 有重叠部分
n. 重叠部分；重复
extend over so as to cover partly.
cover part of the same area of interest, responsibility, etc.
partly coincide in time.
a part or amount which overlaps.
a common area of interest, responsibility, etc.
a period of time in which two events or activities happen together.
"the canopy overlaps the house roof at one end"
"their duties sometimes overlapped"
"two new series overlapped"
"an overlap of about half an inch"
"there are many overlaps between the approaches"
A fish's scales overlap each other.鱼鳞是一片片上下交叠起来的。
You need to overlap the pieces of wood slightly.你需要把这些木片搭叠起来。
These two papers overlap in content.这两篇论文有交叉的内容。
The programme has been so organized that none of the talks overlap.日程做了精心安排，以使每一讲都没有重复内容。
Channel ranges must not overlap.频道范围不能重叠。
The roofs of the houses overlap in the crowded city.房子的屋顶重叠在这个拥挤的城市的上空。
There is a small overlap between the two circles.在这两个圆周有一小部分重叠。
There is a considerable overlap between the two subjects.这两门科目之间有相当多的共通之处。
His duties and mine have an overlap.他的职责和我的有部分交叉。

overrated

[ˌəʊvə'reɪt], [ˌoʊvər'reɪt]


Image Search
vt. 评价过高；高估；估价过高
have a higher opinion of (someone or something) than is deserved.
"dismissing the work as pompous and overrated"
However, we should not overrate the role of the proposed law.尽管如此，我们也不能对草案可以发挥的作用评价过高。

overseas

[ˌəʊvə'siːz], [ˌoʊvər'siːz]


Image Search

adv. 在海外
in or to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.

The overseas trade has become the main project.海外贸易成为主要的项目。
She is an overseas student in Britain.她是个在英国的外国留学生。
Over the years, hundreds of overseas students have studied at that university.几年来，几百个留学生在那所大学学习过。
He lived overseas for many years.他在海外生活了多年。
He qualified in London as a teacher of English overseas.他在伦敦取得了海外英语教师的资格。

overwhelmed

[ˌəʊvə'welm], [ˌoʊvər'welm]


Image Search
vt. 打击；压倒；使感动；淹没；打败
bury or drown beneath a huge mass.
defeat completely.
give too much of a thing to (someone); inundate.
have a strong emotional effect on.
be too strong for; overpower.
"the water flowed through to overwhelm the whole dam and the village beneath"
"his teams overwhelmed their opponents"
"they were overwhelmed by farewell messages"
"I was overwhelmed with guilt"
"the wine doesn't overwhelm the flavor of the trout"
No difficulty can overwhelm us.困难压不倒我们。
If I cannot overwhelm with my quality, I will overwhelm with my quantity.如果我不能以质量压倒，我就一定要以数量压倒。
Your kindness quite overwhelmed me.你的好意使我感激难言。
The village was overwhelmed when the floods came.这个村庄在洪水泛滥时被淹没了。
Europe's golfers completely overwhelmed the Americans.欧洲的高尔夫运动员以压倒性的优势击败了美国对手。

pacifist

Pacifist movements gathered strength in Norway.在挪威,和平主义的运动力量逐渐增强。
Ultimately he wants to revise the pacifist constitution.他最终希望修改和平宪法。
I've never met such an ardent pacifist as Terry.我从未见过像特里这样热情的和平主义者。

pacify

"the general pacified northern Italy"
She knew that he had become delirious, and tried to pacify him.她知道他已经神志昏迷起来了，极力想使他镇静下来。
He tried to pacify the protesters with promise of reform.他试图以改革的承诺安抚抗议者。
I bought an ice cream to pacify my crying daughter.我买了个冰淇淋来抚慰哭泣的女儿。

panel

['pænl], ['pænl]


Image Search

v. 嵌镶
a flat or curved component, typically rectangular, that forms or is set into the surface of a door, wall, or ceiling.
a thin piece of metal forming part of the outer shell of a vehicle.
a piece of material forming part of a garment.
a decorated area within a larger design containing a separate subject.
one of several drawings making up a comic strip.
a flat board on which instruments or controls are fixed.
a small group of people brought together to discuss, investigate, or decide on a particular matter, especially in the context of business or government.
a list of available jurors or a jury.
cover (a wall or other surface) with panels.
"a layer of insulating material should be placed between the panels and the wall"
"body panels for the car business"
"the central panel depicts the Crucifixion"
"a control panel"
"we assembled a panel of experts"
"an elegant paneled dining room"
The builders set the panel in carefully.建筑工人把嵌板小心地镶上去。
The worker will check functions of instrument panel.工人将检查仪表盘功能。
Solar panels are used to power satellites.太阳能面板用来给卫星提供动力。
The date for the panel discussion is fixed now.座谈会的日期现已确定。
The competition will be judged by a panel of experts.竞赛将由一个专家小组进行裁决。
He panelled the wall with wood.他在墙上镶上木板。

panorama

[ˌpænə'rɑːmə], [ˌpænə'ræmə]


Image Search

an unbroken view of the whole region surrounding an observer.
a picture or photograph containing a wide view.
a complete survey or presentation of a subject or sequence of events.
"the tower offers a wonderful panorama of Prague"
"the galleries will offer a full panorama of 20th-century art"
promise graciously
As we stood at the top of the mountain, a beautiful panorama spread out before us.我们登上山顶时，一幅美丽的景色展现在我们的面前。
The book presents a panorama of British history since the Middle Ages.该书概述了中世纪以来的英国历史。
Henry watched the panorama of pass people with wide eyes.亨利观看着一连串过往的人群。

pantomime

['pæntəmaɪm], ['pæntəmaɪm]


Image Search
n. 哑剧；童话剧；哑剧演员；手势
v. 打手势；演哑剧
a dramatic entertainment, originating in Roman mime, in which performers express meaning through gestures accompanied by music.
an absurdly exaggerated piece of behavior.
a ridiculous or confused situation or event.
a theatrical entertainment, mainly for children, that involves music, topical jokes, and slapstick comedy and is based on a fairy tale or nursery story, usually produced around Christmas.
express or represent (something) by extravagant and exaggerated mime.
"he made a pantomime of checking his watch"
"the drive to town was a pantomime"
"the clown candidates pantomimed different emotions"
The actor is skilled in pantomime.这个演员擅长表演哑剧。
The audience roared with laughter at the pantomime.观众被这哑剧逗得哈哈大笑。
The children were very excited by the pantomime.孩子们看了童话剧非常兴奋。
Some tourists make themselves understood abroad by pantomime.一些游客在国外通常用手势来让别人明白自己的意思。
Apes are routinely beaten into submission and forced to pantomime human behaviors that are foreign and confusing.猿类被屈打得顺从，被迫模仿对于它们来说是莫名其妙，难以理解的人类行为举止。

paradigm

['pærədaɪm], ['pærədaɪm]


Image Search
n. 范例；示范；典范；[语]词形变化表
a typical example or pattern of something; a model.
a worldview underlying the theories and methodology of a particular scientific subject.
a set of linguistic items that form mutually exclusive choices in particular syntactic roles.
(in the traditional grammar of Latin, Greek, and other inflected languages) a table of all the inflected forms of a particular verb, noun, or adjective, serving as a model for other words of the same conjugation or declension.
"there is a new paradigm for public art in this country"
"the discovery of universal gravitation became the paradigm of successful science"
"English determiners form a paradigm: we can say “a book” or “his book” but not “a his book.”"
There's no paradigm to follow in this new industry.在这个崭新的行业里没有范例可做参考。
No prevailing paradigm in science lasts forever.科学中没有任何流行范式能够存在永远。
We now see paradigms and paradigm overthrows everywhere, inside of science and out.我们现在可以随处看到典范和推翻典范的事例，无论在科学还是其他方面。
The Aristotelian paradigm prefers the frog perspective, whereas the Platonic paradigm prefers the bird perspective.亚里士多德的典范偏向蛙的眼光，而柏拉图的典范偏向鸟的眼光。

paragraph

['pærəɡrɑːf], ['pærəɡræf]


Image Search
n. 段落；节
vt. 将 ... 分段；写短评报道
vi. 写短评
a distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme and indicated by a new line, indentation, or numbering.
arrange (a piece of writing) in paragraphs.
"the concluding paragraph"
"his style deploys a lack of conventional paragraphing"
The editor struck out the whole paragraph.编辑把整段全删掉了。
You'll find the last paragraph extremely apropos.你会觉得最后一段文字极为中肯。
Look at the second paragraph on page fifteen.请看第十五页的第二段。
This point has been dealt with in the preceding paragraph.这一点在前面一段里已经交代过了。
This paragraph relates to the October Revolution.这一节内容是论述十月革命的。
Don't omit this paragraph when you write your report.写报告时不要删去这一节。
The student is ask to paragraph an essay in class.学生们被要求在课堂上给一篇文章分段。
The teacher taught the students how to paragraph an essay.老师教学生如何把一篇文章分段。
The editor asked him to paragraph.编辑让他写短评。

parallel

['pærəlel], ['pærəlel]


Image Search
adj. 平行的；相同的；类似的；并联的
n. 对比；平行线(面)；双杠；相似物
vt. 相比；相应；与 ... 平行
(of lines, planes, surfaces, or objects) side by side and having the same distance continuously between them.
occurring or existing at the same time or in a similar way; corresponding.
involving the simultaneous performance of operations.
of or denoting electrical components or circuits connected to common points at each end, rather than one to another in sequence.
a person or thing that is similar or analogous to another.
a similarity or comparison.
each of the imaginary parallel circles of constant latitude on the earth's surface.
two parallel lines (‖) as a reference mark.
(of something extending in a line) be side by side with (something extending in a line), always keeping the same distance.
be similar or corresponding to (something).
"parallel lines never meet"
"a parallel universe"
"a challenge that has no parallel in peacetime this century"
"he draws a parallel between personal destiny and social forces"
"a big concrete gutter that paralleled the road"
"the lawlessness throughout officialdom was paralleled by an increase in lawlessness on the streets"
In the parallel world, there might be an answer for everything.在平行世界里,似乎有一切的答案。
Parallel processing is the most important peculiarity in this design.其中,并行化的设计理念是该设计的最大特点。
The railway lines run parallel to the road.铁路线和那条道路平行。
My experience in this matter is parallel to yours.在这件事情上，我的经验和你的类似。
My experience in selling is parallel to yours.在销售方面,我的经验和你相仿。
Japan's macroeconomic puzzle has a microeconomic parallel.日本的宏观经济难题是与其微观经济并联的。
Elements may be connected in parallel, series, or any combination thereof.这些硅碳棒可以是并联的，串连的，或者是串并混联的。
It is inappropriate to draw such a parallel.这种比拟是不恰当的。
The trees stand in parallel with the road.这些树与公路平行。
The gymnast swung on the parallel bars.体操运动员在双杠上摆动身子。
The accuracy of the parallel increased.这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。
No one can parallel him in Math.在数学方面无人能与他匹敌。
Actually no one can parallel him in poetry.实际上，在诗歌方面无人能同他相提并论。
Her experiences parallel mine in many instances.她的经历多与我的相似。
They parallel with one another.他们相互平行。

parameters

[pə'ræmɪtəz], [pə'ræmɪtəz]


Image Search
n. 参数
a numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation.
a quantity whose value is selected for the particular circumstances and in relation to which other variable quantities may be expressed.
a numerical characteristic of a population, as distinct from a statistic of a sample.
(in general use) a limit or boundary that defines the scope of a particular process or activity.
"the transmission will not let you downshift unless your speed is within the lower gear's parameters"
"they set the parameters of the debate"
Here the autofocus parameters are adjusted.这是调整自动聚集参数。
How many parameters can be displayer in the CMLU?综合录井仪能显示多少参数？

parody

['pærədi], ['pærədi]


Image Search
n. 仿作；拙劣的模仿
v. 拙劣模仿；作模仿诗文
an imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect.
an imitation or a version of something that falls far short of the real thing; a travesty.
produce a humorously exaggerated imitation of (a writer, artist, or genre).
mimic humorously.
"the movie is a parody of the horror genre"
"he seems like a parody of an educated Englishman"
"his specialty was parodying schoolgirl fiction"
"he parodied his friend's voice"
Time is the wealth of change, but the clock in its parody makes it.时间是变化的财富。时钟模仿它,却只有变化而无财富。
She has become a grotesque parody of her former elegant self.她成为了以前那个举止优雅的自己的怪诞模仿品。
The trial was a parody of justice.这次审判是对公正的一次拙劣的模拟。
His style has often been parodied.他的风格经常被拙劣地模仿。

participation

[pɑːˌtɪsɪ'peɪʃn], [pɑːrˌtɪsɪ'peɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 参加；参与
the action of taking part in something.
"participation in church activities"
By the way, must we guarantee in any way our participation in the tender?顺便问一下，我们应为参加投标做一点保证吗？
I'd like to be excused from any further participation in the work.我希望让我不再继续参加这项工作。
I'd like to express my thanks for your participation.对于您的参加,我表示衷心的感谢。
His participation is not welcomed.他的参与不受欢迎。
We win the game because of his participation.由于他的参与，我们赢了比赛。
I look forward to your support and participation in the programme.希望大家支持并参与这项计划。

partisan

[ˌpɑːtɪ'zæn], ['pɑːrtəzn]


Image Search
adj. 偏袒的；党派性的
n. 强烈支持者；党羽；游击队员
a strong supporter of a party, cause, or person.
a member of an armed group formed to fight secretly against an occupying force, in particular one operating in enemy-occupied Yugoslavia, Italy, and parts of eastern Europe in World War II.
prejudiced in favor of a particular cause.
"newspapers have become increasingly partisan"
You must listen to both points of view and try not to be partisan.你必须兼听双方观点
The other obstacle is partisan bickering.另一个障碍是党派间的纷争。
He is a staunch partisan of the Republican Party.他是共和党的坚定支持者。
Partisan politics is often an obstruction to good government.党羽的政治阴谋常是良好政府的阻碍。
Even after the country is defeated, partisan fight the invader in the hill.即使在国家被击败之后,游击队仍在山里与入侵者抗战。
It is the partisan who drove the enemy forces out of our country.是游击队员把敌人从我们国家赶出去的。

partition

[pɑː'tɪʃn], [pɑːr'tɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 划分；隔离物
vt. 区分；隔开；分割
(especially with reference to a country with separate areas of government) the action or state of dividing or being divided into parts.
a structure dividing a space into two parts, especially a light interior wall.
the distribution of a solute between two immiscible or slightly miscible solvents in contact with one another, in accordance with its differing solubility in each.
each of a number of portions into which some operating systems divide memory or storage.
divide into parts.
divide (a room) into smaller rooms or areas by erecting partitions.
separate a part of a room from the rest by erecting a partition.
"the country's partition into separate states"
"an agreement was reached to partition the country"
"the hall was partitioned to contain the noise of the computers"
"partition off part of a large bedroom to create a small bathroom"
The key to resolve the problem is elaborate partition for time and manpower.关键的解决这人问题的方法是把时间和人力精心划分。
I could hear what he was saying on the phone through the partition.我能隔着墙听见他在电话里说了些什么。
Our office is comparted by a partition board.我们的办公室用一个隔扇分成两部分。
There is a plywood partition between the two rooms.两个房子中间有一个夹板墙。
The workers partition a room into three parts.工人们把一间房间分成三部分。
He partition off part of the room as a study.他将房间一部分隔开作书房。
We've partitioned off one end of the kitchen to make a breakfast room.我们已把厨房的一头隔开作吃早饭的房间。

partnership

['pɑːtnəʃɪp], ['pɑːrtnərʃɪp]


Image Search
n. 合伙人身份；合股；合伙经营
the state of being a partner or partners.
an association of two or more people as partners.
a business or firm owned and run by two or more partners.
a position as one of the partners in a business or firm.
"we should go on working together in partnership"
"an increase in partnerships with housing associations"
They decided to break up the partnership.他们决定终止合作关系。
Martin has taken him into general partnership in his company.马丁已让他成为公司的普通合伙人。
Last year we entered into partnership with him.我们去年和他合股。
My business was most successful when I formed a good partnership with someone else.当我与别人建立了良好的合股关系时,我的生意最兴旺发达。
She worked in partnership with her sister.她和妹妹合股经营。
I enter into partnership with him to do export business.我与他合伙做出口生意。

passive

['pæsɪv], ['pæsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 被动的；消极的
n. 被动性
accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
denoting or relating to a voice of verbs in which the subject undergoes the action of the verb (e.g., they were killed as opposed to he killed them ).
(of a circuit or device) containing no source of electromotive force.
(of radar or a satellite) receiving or reflecting radiation from a transmitter or target rather than generating its own signal.
relating to or denoting heating systems that make use of incident sunlight as an energy source.
(of a metal) made unreactive by a thin inert surface layer of oxide.
a passive form of a verb.
the passive voice.
"the women were portrayed as passive victims"
He played a passive role in the marriage.他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。
You are passive when you allow things to happen, but do nothing.当你让这些事发生,而不做任何事来阻止它,你是消极的。
Good is the passive that obeys reason.善是服从理智的被动性。
Passive tear suctioning force can be demonstrated by a Venturi tube model.被动性泪液吸引之力量，可藉由文氏管模型来解释。

pathetic

[pə'θetɪk], [pə'θetɪk]


Image Search
adj. 可怜的；不足的；感伤的；悲哀的
arousing pity, especially through vulnerability or sadness.
miserably inadequate.
relating to the emotions.
"she looked so pathetic that I bent down to comfort her"
"his test scores in Chemistry were pathetic"
We saw the pathetic sight of starving children.我们看到挨饿的儿童悲惨可怜的样子。
She dances well, but as a singer, she is pathetic.她跳舞跳得好，但唱歌就差劲了。
God! The freshmen are pathetic this year!天啊！今年的大一新生什么也不懂！
I never heard anything that sounded so pathetic.我从未听说过如此悲伤的事了。
His tears were pathetic to witness.他的眼泪引起在场人的怜悯。
It was pathetic to watch her condition deteriorate.看着她的健康状况恶化真是感到难过。
The police do not pity those poor, pathetic and helpless homeless.警察一点也不同情那些既悲哀又无助的游民。
You are nothing but a pathetic fool.你只不过是个可怜的傻瓜。

peer

[pɪə(r)], [pɪr]


Image Search
n. 同辈；同等的人；贵族
vi. 凝视；窥视
look keenly or with difficulty at someone or something.
be just visible.
come into view; appear.
a member of the nobility in Britain or Ireland, comprising the ranks of duke, marquess, earl, viscount, and baron.
a person of the same age, status, or ability as another specified person.
make or become equal with or of the same rank.
"Blake screwed up his eyes, trying to peer through the fog"
"the two towers peer over the roofs"
"he has incurred much criticism from his academic peers"
Children are easily influenced by their peers.孩子很容易受同辈影响。
He was valued by both his peer and his superiors.他的同级和上级都很器重他。
The opinions of his peers are more important to him than his parents' ideas.在他看来，他同辈人的观点比他父母的观点更为重要。
It will not be easy to find his peer.很不容易找到像他那样的人.
He was created a peer of the UK in 2005.他在2005年被封为英国的贵族。
She peers through the mist, trying to find the right path.她透过雾眯着眼看，想找出正确的路。
She peer at me over the top of her glasses.她从眼镜上方盯着我看。
The cloud of data flowing through their workstations forms a clear digital globe for them to peer into.这些云聚的数据流过他们的工作站，形成了一种清澈的数据世界，让他们能够窥视其究竟。

perceived

[pə'siːv], [pər'sːv]


Image Search
v. 注意到；觉察到；认为；理解
become aware or conscious of (something); come to realize or understand.
become aware of (something) by the use of one of the senses, especially that of sight.
interpret or look on (someone or something) in a particular way; regard as.
"his mouth fell open as he perceived the truth"
"he perceived the faintest of flushes creeping up her neck"
"if Guy does not perceive himself as disabled, nobody else should"
I plainly perceive some objections remain.我清楚地察觉到还有一些反对意见。
We can perceive his sorrow by the looks on his face.我们从他的表情中觉察出悲伤。
Indeed, this problem is greater than one may perceive.确实，这个问题远大于你所能感知到的。
They perceive television as entertainment.他们将电视视为娱乐。
Adults learn what they perceive to be useful in their life situations.成人们学他们认为对其生活情境有帮助的东西。
At first I couldn't perceive what he meant.起先我不理解他说的意思。

percent

[pə'sent], [pə'sent]


Image Search
n. 百分比
adv. 百分之 ...
adj. 百分之 ... 的
by a specified amount in or for every hundred.
one part in every hundred.
the rate, number, or amount in each hundred; percentage.
"new car sales may be down nineteen percent"
"a reduction of half a percent or so in price"
"the percent of drug users who are infected"
The number of queues repaired out of the percent detected.修复的队列数目超过检测到的百分比。
Twenty percent of the products are exported.百分之二十的产品外销。
The company's market share is 48 percent in the marketplace.这家公司的市场占有率是百分之四十八。
The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year.去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。
The millionaire has handed over 50 percent of his stock to his first son.这个百万富翁已把他一半的股票移交给他的长子。
The covering of forestry in our town is 60 percent.我们镇的森林覆盖率是百分之六十。
I am a hundred percent in agreement with you.我百分之百同意你的看法。
We give 10 percent discount for cash.现金付款，我们九折优惠。
Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.天才是靠百分之一的灵感与百分之九十九的努力。

period

['pɪəriəd], ['pɪriəd]


Image Search
n. 一段时间；周期；时期；课时；学时；句号；月经
a length or portion of time.
a portion of time in the life of a nation, civilization, etc. characterized by the same prevalent features or conditions.
a major division of geological time that is a subdivision of an era and is itself subdivided into epochs, corresponding to a system in chronostratigraphy.
one of the set divisions of the day in a school allocated to a lesson or other activity.
each of the intervals into which the playing time of a sporting event is divided.
the interval of time between successive occurrences of the same state in an oscillatory or cyclic phenomenon, such as a mechanical vibration, an alternating current, a variable star, or an electromagnetic wave.
the time taken by a celestial object to rotate around its axis, or to make one circuit of its orbit.
the interval between successive equal values of a periodic function.
a flow of blood and other material from the lining of the uterus, lasting for several days and occurring in sexually mature women who are not pregnant at intervals of about one lunar month until the onset of menopause.
a punctuation mark (.) used at the end of a sentence or an abbreviation.
added to the end of a statement to indicate that no further discussion is possible or desirable.
a set of elements occupying an entire horizontal row in the periodic table.
a complex sentence, especially one consisting of several clauses, constructed as part of a formal speech or oration.
a complete idea, typically consisting of two or four phrases.
belonging to or characteristic of a past historical time, especially in style or design.
"he had long periods of depression"
"the early medieval period"
"he is the sole owner of the trademark, period"
"a splendid selection of period furniture"
He feels completely restored to health after a period of intensive care.通过一段时间的精心照顾，他感到身体完全康复了。
The exercise period was similar to the previous study.运动周期类似前面的研究。
Childhood is a period of rapid growth.幼年是生长迅速的时期。
He teaches 10 periods a week.他每周授课10课时。
This course needs 30 periods in all, and case analysis will use 4 periods.本课程的总学时是30学时，其中4学时是让学生做案例分析。
Use a period at the end of the sentence.在一个句子的末尾用句号。
How long is your period usually?通常你的月经周期多长?

perishable

['perɪʃəbl], ['perɪʃəbl]


Image Search
adj. 易腐烂的；会枯萎的；会死的
（复数）perishables:易腐烂的东西（尤指食物）.
(especially of food) likely to decay or go bad quickly.
(of something abstract) having a brief life or significance; transitory.
things, especially foodstuffs, likely to decay or go bad quickly.
"ballet is the most perishable of arts"
Perishable goods are piling up at the docks.码头上易腐烂的货物堆积如山。
Unlike perishable agricultural products, oil can be stored in the ground.不同于易腐烂的农产品，石油可以长期埋在地下。

persevere

[ˌpɜːsɪ'vɪə(r)], [ˌpɜːrsə'vɪr]


Image Search
v. 坚持；不屈不挠
continue in a course of action even in the face of difficulty or with little or no prospect of success.
"his family persevered with his treatment"
When things get difficult, you just have to grit your teeth and persevere.遇到困难只需咬紧牙关坚持下去。
If you persevere with work, you'll succeed in the end.你如果把工作坚持下去，最终会取得成功的。
He was hopeless at French, but his teacher persevered with him.他怎么也学不会法语,可是老师仍锲而不舍地帮助他。

persistent

[pə'sɪstənt], [pər'sɪstənt]


Image Search
adj. 坚持的；连续的；固执的
continuing firmly or obstinately in a course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
continuing to exist or endure over a prolonged period.
(of a chemical or radioactivity) remaining within the environment for a long time after its introduction.
(of a part of an animal or plant, such as a horn, leaf, etc.) remaining attached instead of falling off in the normal manner.
"one of the government's most persistent critics"
"persistent rain will affect many areas"
"PCBs are persistent environmental contaminants"
He is a persistent pursuer of truth.他是个坚持不懈追求真理的人。
His great success cannot depart from his persistent effort.他取得这么大的成功和他坚持不懈的努力分不开。
A persistent cough may be a symptom of tuberculosis.持续的咳嗽可能是肺病的症候。
His persistent questions finally goaded me into an angry reply.他三番五次地问问题惹得我回答时也没有好气。

perspective

[pə'spektɪv], [pər'spektɪv]


Image Search
n. 远景；看法；透视
adj. 透视的
the art of drawing solid objects on a two-dimensional surface so as to give the right impression of their height, width, depth, and position in relation to each other when viewed from a particular point.
a picture drawn in perspective, especially one appearing to enlarge or extend the actual space, or to give the effect of distance.
a view or prospect.
the relation of two figures in the same plane, such that pairs of corresponding points lie on concurrent lines, and corresponding lines meet in collinear points.
a particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
true understanding of the relative importance of things; a sense of proportion.
an apparent spatial distribution in perceived sound.
"a perspective drawing"
"most guidebook history is written from the editor's perspective"
"we must keep a sense of perspective about what he's done"
A fine perspective opened out before us.一幅美丽的远景展开在我们眼前。
Do you agree with this perspective?你同意这个看法吗?
The painting provides us with one of the earliest examples of the use of perspective.那幅画给我们提供了采用透视画法的最早的范例。
The first row of each perspective shows its name.每个透视的第一行都显示该透视的名称。

pessimist

['pesɪmɪst], ['pesɪmɪst]


Image Search
n. 悲观主义者
a person who tends to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
a person who believes that this world is as bad as it could be or that evil will ultimately prevail over good.
"the pessimists point to ways in which life has deteriorated"
"he finds solace in the writings of pessimist philosophers"
He is a pessimist and a defeatist.他是悲观主义者，也是失败主义者。
It may be that I am a pessimist, for spring it is, not autumn, that makes me sad.因为春天而非秋天使我感到伤感，所以也许我是个悲观主义者。

petty

['peti], ['peti]


Image Search
adj. 小的；琐碎的；次要的；狭隘的
of little importance; trivial.
(of behavior) characterized by an undue concern for trivial matters, especially in a small-minded or spiteful way.
of secondary or lesser importance, rank, or scale; minor.
(of a crime) of lesser importance.
"the petty divisions of party politics"
"he was prone to petty revenge on friends and family"
"a petty official"
"petty theft"
The party split into petty factions.该党分裂成若干小派系。
The paymasters of these petty crooks are the big crime syndicates.操纵这帮小流氓的就是那个大犯罪集团。
In his short life he had run the entire gamut of crime, from petty theft to murder.他在短短的一生中,从小偷小摸到杀人,什么罪都犯过。
Don't bug me with petty details.不要讲那些琐碎的细节来烦我。
People do not discourage this kind of petty work.人们对这种次要的工作不加以阻止。
She grew tired of his petty jealousies.她越来越讨厌他那种心胸狭窄的忌妒行为。
She is very petty at times.她有时很小心眼。

phase

[feɪz], [feɪz]


Image Search
n. 相位；方面；局面；阶段；时期
vt. 逐步执行
a distinct period or stage in a series of events or a process of change or development.
a stage in a person's psychological development, especially a period of temporary unhappiness or difficulty during adolescence or a particular stage during childhood.
each of the separate events in an eventing competition.
each of the aspects of the moon or a planet, according to the amount of its illumination, especially the new moon, the first quarter, the full moon, and the last quarter.
a genetic or seasonal variety of an animal's coloration.
a distinct and homogeneous form of matter (i.e. a particular solid, liquid, or gas) separated by its surface from other forms.
the relationship in time between the successive states or cycles of an oscillating or repeating system (such as an alternating electric current or a light or sound wave) and either a fixed reference point or the states or cycles of another system with which it may or may not be in synchrony.
carry out (something) in gradual stages.
introduce something into (or withdraw something from) use in gradual stages.
adjust the phase of (something), especially so as to synchronize it with something else.
"the final phases of the war"
"you are not obsessed, but you are going through a phase"
"the work is being phased over a number of years"
"our armed forces policy was to be phased in over 10 years"
No phase transition evidence is found.没有发现任何相位跃迁的证据。
Distortion can result from phase shifts.相位变化将造成失真。
This is but one phase of the subject.这仅是问题的一个方面。
They are talking about the changing phases of society.他们谈论着不断变化的社会状况。
That project would enter a second phase at the beginning of 2007.该项目将在2007年初进入下一阶段。
If a nuclear war really breaks out, the world will enter a very dangerous phase.假如真的爆发核战争,世界将进入一个非常危险的时期。
The use of lead-free petrol is now being phased in.无铅汽油的应用现正逐步推广。
The old currency will have been phased out by 1990.旧币分阶段至1990年将全部禁止流通。
The modernization of the industry was phased over a 20-year period.工业现代化分20年逐步实现。

phenomenon

[fə'nɒmɪnən], [fə'nɑːmɪnən]


Image Search
n. 现象；奇人；奇事
a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause or explanation is in question.
a remarkable person, thing, or event.
the object of a person's perception; what the senses or the mind notice.
"glaciers are unique and interesting natural phenomena"
Their so-called prosperity is only a temporary phenomenon.但他们所谓的繁荣只是一个暂时的现象。
International terrorism is not just a recent phenomenon.国际恐怖主义并不是近年才有的现象。
Magnetism is a natural phenomenon.磁力是一种自然现象。
A child who could read at the age of one would indeed be a phenomenon.一个一岁的孩子能阅读，会被认为是个神童。
Beethoven was a phenomenon among musicians.贝多芬是音乐家中的奇才。
There are special reasons for this unusual phenomenon.这种奇事的发生，有其独特的原因。

philosophy

[fə'lɒsəfi], [fə'lɑːsəfi]
