Tomorrow is the effective date of regulations.明天就是条例的生效日期。
We need more elastic rules and regulations.我们需要更多的弹性规则和条例。

reign

[reɪn], [reɪn]


Image Search
n. 君主统治；在位期
v. 统治；支配
hold royal office; rule as king or queen.
be the best or most important in a particular area or domain.
(of a quality or condition) prevail; predominate.
(of a sports player or team) currently hold a particular title.
the period during which a sovereign rules.
the period during which someone or something is predominant or preeminent.
"Queen Elizabeth reigns over the UK"
"in America, baseball reigns supreme"
"confusion reigned"
"the original chapel was built in the reign of Charles I"
"these historic seconds inaugurated the reign of negative political advertising"
He has a tyrannical reign on his empire.他是个残暴的皇帝。
People will remember the tyrannies of his reign.人们不会忘记他统治时期的暴行。
The reign of Queen Victoria lasted more than sixty years.维多利亚女王的统治持续了六十多年。
The American Revolution took place during the reign of George III.美国独立战争发生在英王乔治三世统治时期。
He reigned over the country for forty years.他统治了这个国家四十年。
He will reign over the natural people of Israel.他将统治以色列的百姓。
Silence reigned everywhere.万籁俱寂。
Peace would then reign over the world.到那时和平会在整个世界上占上风。
It is better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.天堂为奴，不如地狱为主。

"they spend thousands of dollars that are not reimbursed by insurance"
I was reimbursed in full.我已得到全部补偿。

The company will reimburse you for travel expenses.公司会为你报销差旅费。
All expenses will be reimbursed to you.一切费用都能给你报销。

reinforced

[riːɪn'fɔːst], [riːɪn'fɔːst]


Image Search
adj. 加强的
动词reinforce的过去式和过去分词.
strengthen or support (an object or substance), especially with additional material.
strengthen (an existing feeling, idea, or habit).
strengthen (a military force) with additional personnel or equipment.
"the helmet has been reinforced with a double layer of cork"
"various actions of the leaders so reinforced fears and suspicions that war became unavoidable"
"paratroopers were sent to reinforce the troops already in the area"
A heavily reinforced building used for launch operations of missiles and space launch vehicles.火箭发射防护室用于发射导弹和太空飞行器的牢固建筑物
A covering for a wheel, usually made of rubber reinforced with cords of nylon, fiberglass, or other material and filled with compressed air.轮胎车轮的覆盖物，通常由用尼龙绳、玻璃纤维或其它材料加固的橡胶制成，并注入了压缩的空气
The concrete walls are reinforced with steel rods.混凝土墙是用钢筋加固的。
A lightweight protective helmet, usually of metal or reinforced plastic, worn by workers in industrial settings.安全帽一种工人们在工业生产环境中戴的通常用金属或加强塑料制成的轻型保护头盔

rejected

['riːdʒekt], ['riːdʒekt]


Image Search
vt. 拒绝；排斥；驳回；丢弃
n. 不合格产品；被拒之人
dismiss as inadequate, inappropriate, or not to one's taste.
refuse to agree to (a request).
fail to show due affection or concern for (someone); rebuff.
show an immune response to (a transplanted organ or tissue) so that it fails to survive.
"union negotiators rejected a 1.5 percent pay increase"
"an application to hold a pop concert at the club was rejected"
"she didn't want him to feel he had been rejected after his sister was born"
He rejected their offer of a job.他拒绝了他们给他的工作。
After the transplant his body rejected the new heart.他的身体对新移植的心脏产生了排斥作用。
If the application is unfounded, the people's court shall make an order to reject it.申请不成立的,裁定予以驳回。
The supermarket rejected all spotted apples.超级市场丢弃了所有的烂苹果。
The factory sells some of its better rejects cheaply, but it throws most of the rejects away.这家公司廉价出售略好一些的次品，但将大多数次品丢弃。
He was a reject from the varsity team.他被大学代表队拒绝了。

relaxed

[rɪ'lækst], [rɪ'lækst]


Image Search
adj. 放松的；松懈的；随意的
动词relax的过去式和过去分词.
free from tension and anxiety; at ease.
(of a muscle or other body part) not tense.
make or become less tense or anxious.
rest or engage in an enjoyable activity so as to become less tired or anxious.
cause (a limb or muscle) to become less rigid.
make (something) less firm or tight.
straighten or partially uncurl (hair) using a chemical product.
make (a rule or restriction) less strict while not abolishing it.
"we were having a great time and feeling very relaxed"
"he relaxed and smiled confidently"
"the team relaxes with a lot of skiing"
"relax the leg by bringing the knee toward the chest"
"Cicely relaxed her hold"
"they persuaded the local authorities concerned to relax their restrictions"
The dinner was a relaxed, unceremonious occasion.那次宴会很轻松，随随便便。
She remained peaceful and relaxed.她仍然是那样安详和放松。
Discipline is often relaxed at weekends.一到周末纪律往往松弛下来。
Among her friends, casual dress and a relaxed manner are the rule.她的朋友一般都衣着休闲，举止也轻松随意。

relay

['riːleɪ], ['riːleɪ]


Image Search
vt. 转播；转达；中继；接力；接替
n. 继电器；接力赛；替班
a group of people or animals engaged in a task or activity for a fixed period of time and then replaced by a similar group.
a race between teams usually of sprinters or swimmers, each team member in turn covering part of the total distance.
an electrical device, typically incorporating an electromagnet, that is activated by a current or signal in one circuit to open or close another circuit.
a device to receive, reinforce, and retransmit a broadcast or program.
a message or program transmitted by a relay.
receive and pass on (information or a message).
broadcast (something) by passing signals received from elsewhere through a transmitting station.
lay again or differently.
"the wagons were pulled by relays of horses"
"a 550-meter relay race"
"a relay of a performance live from the concert hall"
"she intended to relay everything she had learned"
"the speech was relayed live from the White House"
"they plan to relay about half a mile of the track"
Images of the war were relayed around the world.世界各地转播了战争的图像。
I will relay your opinion to the headmaster.我愿把你的意见转告校长。
The Relay Agent could not start up its main thread.中继代理无法启动其主线程。
Frame Relay Connection and Traffic Flow Control.帧中继连接和流量控制。
The anchor man in a relay team runs last.接力队中的主力跑最后一棒。
Our Torch Relay will break new ground.我们的火炬接力将开创新局面。
This relay connects one input to one output.该继电器将一个输入连接到一个输出。
Six teams competed in yesterday's relay race.六个队参加了昨天的接力赛。
The anchor man in a relay team runs last.接力队中的主力跑最后一棒。
A new relay of horses was harnessed to the cart.用作轮换的马都已套到了那辆马车上。

release

[rɪ'liːs], [rɪ'liːs]


Image Search
n. 释放；让渡；发行
vt. 释放；让与；准予发表；发射
allow or enable to escape from confinement; set free.
allow (something) to move, act, or flow freely.
remove restrictions or obligations from (someone or something) so that they become available for other activity.
remove (part of a machine or appliance) from a fixed position, allowing something else to move or function.
allow (something) to return to its resting position by ceasing to put pressure on it.
allow (information) to be generally available.
make (a movie or recording) available for general viewing or purchase.
remit or discharge (a debt).
surrender (a right).
make over (property or money) to another person or entity.
the action or process of releasing or being released.
a handle or catch that releases part of a mechanism.
the action of making a movie, recording, or other product available for general viewing or purchase.
a movie or other product issued for viewing or purchase.
the action of releasing property, money, or a right to another.
a document effecting a release of property, money, etc.
"the government announced that the prisoners would be released"
"she released his arm and pushed him aside"
"the strategy would release forces for service in other areas"
"he released the handbrake"
"press and release the reset button quickly"
"no details about the contents of the talks were released"
"nine singles and one album had been released"
"a campaign by the prisoner's mother resulted in his release"
"the film was withheld for two years before its release"
"his current album release has topped the charts for six months"
The prisoner was questioned before his release.囚犯被释放之前受到了审问。
The puffball is ready to release its spores.尘菌已经要释放孢子了。
The electrons in the upper band eventually release energy, thereby emitting photons.上层能带中的电子最后会发射光子释放能量。

relevant

['reləvənt], ['reləvənt]


Image Search
adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的
closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered.
appropriate to the current time, period, or circumstances; of contemporary interest.
"what small companies need is relevant advice"
"critics may find themselves unable to stay relevant in a changing world"
A paper relevant to this research was published by him.与本研究相关的一篇论文是他发表的。
Have you heard of the relevant report?你听说过相关的报道吗?
My next conclusion is more relevant.我的另一个结论更切题。
Portraits of people will draw readers'attention, especially if the images are relevant and tell a story.人物肖像可以吸引读者的注意,当图像切题并在讲述一个故事时更是如此。
These values are relevant in a relative sense.这些值只是在相对比较上才有中肯的意义。

reliance

[rɪ'laɪəns], [rɪ'laɪəns]


Image Search
n. 信赖；所信赖的人或物
dependence on or trust in someone or something.
a person or thing on which someone depends.
"the farmer's reliance on pesticides"
I place complete reliance on his judgment.我完全信赖他的判断。
I have no reliance about his assurance.我不信赖他的保证。
Don't place too much reliance on what he said.对他所说的话不要过于信赖。

relic

['relɪk], ['relɪk]


Image Search
n. 神圣的遗物；遗迹；纪念物
an object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
a part of a deceased holy person's body or belongings kept as an object of reverence.
an object, custom, or belief that has survived from an earlier time but is now outmoded.
all that is left of something.
"individualized computer programming and time-sharing would become expensive relics"
"relics of a lost civilization"
This stone axe is a relic of ancient times.这把石斧是古代的遗物。
Gold is still a barbaric relic whose value rises only when inflation is high.黄金仍然只是未开化时代的遗物，其价值只在通涨高企时才会上升。
The calorie is a historical relic.卡是历史的遗迹。
The building stands as the last remaining relic of the town's cotton industry.这座建筑物是小镇棉纺业仅存的遗迹。
This ruined bridge is a relic of the Korean War in1950.那个被毁的桥是朝鲜战争的纪念物。
Julie saw the means offered of carrying off her precious relic, which Monte Cristo had forgotten.尤莉看到基督山不留意那只钱袋，她可以带走她那宝贵的纪念物了，便拉她的丈夫到门口。

relish

['relɪʃ], ['relɪʃ]


Image Search
v. 享受；从...获得乐趣；品味；渴望；喜欢；有滋味
n. 滋味；爱好；调味品
great enjoyment.
liking for or pleasurable anticipation of something.
a condiment eaten with plain food to add flavor.
an appetizing flavor.
a distinctive taste or tinge.
enjoy greatly.
be pleased by or about.
make pleasant to the taste; add relish to.
"she swigged a mouthful of wine with relish"
"I was appointed to a position for which I had little relish"
"use salsa as a relish with grilled meat or fish"
"the relish of wine"
"he was relishing his moment of glory"
"I don't relish the thought of waiting on an invalid for the next few months"
"I have also a novel to relish my wine"
Take each day and relish each moment.认真过每一天并且好好享受每一时刻。
He seemed to relish the scandal.他似乎对这件丑闻十分欣赏。
Take a moment and relish this with me! Soon all will be revealed!和我一起品味这份经历吧！很快一切都会浮出水面！
His wife won't relish having to wash all those dishes.他的妻子不会喜欢洗这一大堆碟子的。
He drank up the wine with relish.他津津有味地把酒喝光了。
I tasted the fish my mother cooked with relish.我津津有味地品尝了我妈妈做的鱼。
The game will lose its relish when you grow old.你年纪大了以后,就会发现这种游戏的趣味大打折扣了。
I have no relish for witnessing cruelty.我对看残忍的场面不感兴趣。
The teacher had no relish for his jokes.老师对他的笑话不感兴趣。
Hunger is the best relish for food.饥饿是食物最佳佐料。
Put some relish on a slice of bread.将调味品涂到一片面包上。

reluctant

I was reluctant to do over the stitching in the dress.我不愿意把衣服上的线脚拆了重缝。

Margaret gave him a reluctant consent.玛格丽特勉强答应了他。

They can now only fondly reminisce about the Age of Aquarius.现在他们只能深情地缅怀以往的“宝瓶时代”。

He was filled with remorse after hitting the child.他打过孩子后感到悔恨不已。
Her anger gave place to remorse.她不再感到愤怒，而是感到悔恨。

['rɒndɪvuː], ['rɑːndɪvuː]


Image Search

vi. 汇合；集合

"I rendezvoused with Bea as planned"
He didn't recognize the address of the rendezvous.他没有辨认出约会的地点。
She made the rendezvous with only minutes to spare.她还差几分钟时才来赴约。
He didn't tell me the rendezvous.他没有告诉我约会时间与地点。
The cafe is a popular rendezvous for young lovers.这个咖啡馆是年轻恋人的约会圣地。
The Dutch must have a rendezvous.荷兰人必须有一个指定的集合地。
This cafe is a rendezvous for writers and artists.这家小餐馆是作家和艺术家经常聚会的地方。
They will rendezvous in the park.他们将在公园会合。
We'll rendezvous at the railway station tomorrow afternoon.我们明天下午在火车站会合。
They decided to rendezvous at the club.他们决定在俱乐部集合。

Have you nothing to repent of?你没有可懊悔的事吗？
He repented what he has done.他懊悔他的所作所为。

It's time to replenish the shop with the news year's goods.该为这家商店补充新年货物了。
These foods replenish the skeletal needs of the body.这些食物补充身体骨骼的需要。
Perhaps to replenish their energies for the coming week.可能是为新的一个星期的到来而补充能量。
Let me replenish your glass with some more wine.让我给你杯子里再添点葡萄酒。
Let me replenish your glass, eg with more wine.我给你把杯子再斟满吧.
Allow me to replenish your glass.让我再给您斟满。
We need to replenish our stocks of coal.我们需要再次补充煤的储备。
It's time to replenish the shop with the news year's goods.该为这家商店补充新年货物了。

required

in keeping with one's wishes; desired.

"the care and diligence required of him as a trustee"
I did more work than required.我做了比所被要求的来得更多的工作。
All passengers are required to show their tickets.所有乘客都必须出示车票。
Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.他出事后重新学习走路要有极大的毅力。
The ships required the protection of naval and air power.船只本身需要海军和空军的保护。

research

[rɪ'sɜːtʃ], [rɪ'sɜːrtʃ]


Image Search
n. 研究；调查
v. 研究；调查
the systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
acts or periods of investigation and study.
engaged in or intended for use in investigation and discovery.
investigate systematically.
discover facts by investigation for use in (a book, program, etc.).
"we are fighting meningitis by raising money for medical research"
"his pathological researches were included in official reports"
"a research student"
"she has spent the last five years researching her people's history"
"I was in New York researching my novel"
We all support his scientific research.我们都支持他的科学研究。
Research indicates that men find it easier to give up smoking than women.研究表明，男人比女人更容易戒烟。
My research is just bouncing along at present.目前我的调查进展得很顺利。
They have been researching the effects of the drug on mice.他们一直在研究老鼠对这种药物的反应。
He needs to research about the coffee market.他需要对咖啡市场进行调查。
We should get down to research more earnestly.我们一定要更加认真的调查。

resident

['rezɪdənt], ['rezɪdənt]


Image Search
n. 居民；住客；住院医生
adj. 居住的
a person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis.
a bird, butterfly, or other animal of a species that does not migrate.
a person who boards at a boarding school.
a British government agent in any semi-independent state, especially the Governor General's agent at the court of an Indian state.
a medical graduate engaged in specialized practice under supervision in a hospital.
living somewhere on a long-term basis.
having quarters on the premises of one's work.
attached to and working regularly for a particular institution.
(of a bird, butterfly, or other animal) nonmigratory; remaining in an area throughout the year.
(of a computer program, file, etc.) immediately available in computer memory, rather than having to be loaded from elsewhere.
"he has been resident in Brazil for a long time"
"resident farm workers"
"the film studio needed a resident historian"
The residents of the town are proud of its new library.该镇的居民都为镇上新建的图书馆感到自豪。
I have been resident in this hotel for two weeks.我已经在这家旅馆里住了两个星期了。
I would get the neurosurgery resident down here.我想请神经外科住院医师下楼到这儿来。
This dove was resident with us all the year round.这只鸽子一年到头居住在这里和我们为伴。
I've been resident in this hotel for five years.我住在这家旅馆五年了。

resilient

[rɪ'zɪliənt], [rɪ'zɪliənt]


Image Search
adj. 适应力强的；有弹力的
(of a person or animal) able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
(of a substance or object) able to recoil or spring back into shape after bending, stretching, or being compressed.
"babies are generally far more resilient than new parents realize"
"a shoe with resilient cushioning"
She is very resilient to change.她对变化有很强的适应力.
He'll get over it,young people are amazingly resilient.他会克服这些的，年轻人的适应力惊人。
The state and Confucianism were remarkably resilient.这种政治体制及儒学有着了不起的适应性。
Rubber is more resilient than wood.橡胶比木头弹性好。
The house had a squat, resilient look about it.房子低矮，但看上去很结实。

resolution

[ˌrezə'luːʃn], [ˌrezə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 决心；决定；解决；决议；坚决；分辨率
a firm decision to do or not to do something.
a formal expression of opinion or intention agreed on by a legislative body, committee, or other formal meeting, typically after taking a vote.
the quality of being determined or resolute.
the action of solving a problem, dispute, or contentious matter.
the passing of a discord into a concord during the course of changing harmony.
the disappearance of inflammation, or of any other symptom or condition.
the process of reducing or separating something into its components.
the replacing of a single force or other vector quantity by two or more jointly equivalent to it.
the smallest interval measurable by a scientific (especially optical) instrument; the resolving power.
the degree of detail visible in a photographic or television image.
the conversion of something abstract into another form.
the substitution of two short syllables for one long one.
"she kept her resolution not to see Anne any more"
"the conference passed two resolutions"
"he handled the last French actions of the war with resolution"
"the peaceful resolution of all disputes"
"the gradual resolution of an uncertain feeling into a named emotion"
Nothing can unsettle his resolution.什么也动摇不了他的决心。
Making resolution on new year's day is a custom that still prevail.在新年这一天下决心是一个依然流行的习俗。
The committee have adopted a resolution to build a park.委员会做出一个项决议，决定兴建一座公园。
His generosity led to the resolution of all our difficulties.他的慷慨相助使我们的困难全都得以解决。
We have passed a resolution to build a new laboratory.我们已通过决议建一个新实验室。
They declared that they responded with resolution to this statement .他们宣布他们坚决响应这一声明。
The early experiments were done with low resolution.早期的实验都是在低分辨率的条件下进行的。

resourceful

[rɪ'sɔːsfl], [rɪ'sɔːrsfl]


Image Search
adj. 资源丰富的；足智多谋的
having the ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties.
Til is a resourceful textile material.胡麻是一种资源丰富的纺织原料。
He is a keen and resourceful politician.他是个头脑敏锐又足智多谋的政治家。
He's an old man who is intelligent and resourceful.他是一位足智多谋的老叟。

resources

[rɪ'sɔːsɪz], [rɪ'sɔːsɪz]


Image Search
n. 资源；才智；储备力量
名词resource的复数形式.
a stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets that can be drawn on by a person or organization in order to function effectively.
a country's collective means of supporting itself or becoming wealthier, as represented by its reserves of minerals, land, and other assets.
available assets.
an action or strategy that may be adopted in adverse circumstances.
one's personal attributes and capabilities regarded as able to help or sustain one in adverse circumstances.
the ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties.
the possibility of aid or assistance.
a leisure occupation.
provide (a person or organization) with materials, money, staff, and other assets necessary for effective operation.
"local authorities complained that they lacked resources"
"sometimes anger is the only resource left in a situation like this"
"we had been left very much to our own resources"
"a man of resource"
"the flower of the French army was lost without resource"
"ensuring that primary health care workers are adequately resourced"
The wish of fully utilizing the natural resources will eventually come true.充分利用自然资源的愿望终究会实现。
Most people have come to accept the need for conservation of natural resources.现在大多数人已认识到保护自然资源的必要。
Resources management is an important business skill.资源管理是一项重要的经营技能。
The government tried to prevent the diminution of resources.政府试图阻止资源的减少。
He saw that he could improve their chromosomes in a godlike way to exploit these resources, making them even better adapted to the environment he had set up for them.他认为自己有神通，能通过改善它们染色体的方式来开发这些才智，使它们更加适应自己为它们创立的环境。
They threw all their resources into the new endeavor.他们集中全部力量进行新的尝试。

response

[rɪ'spɒns], [rɪ'spɑːns]


Image Search
n. 反应；回答；响应；答复
a verbal or written answer.
a written or verbal answer to a question in a test, questionnaire, survey, etc.
a reaction to something.
an excitation of a nerve impulse caused by a change or event; a physical reaction to a specific stimulus or situation.
the way in which a mechanical or electrical device responds to a stimulus or range of stimuli.
a part of a religious liturgy said or sung by a congregation in answer to a minister or cantor.
a bid made in answer to one's partner's preceding bid.
"without waiting for a response, she returned to her newspaper"
"an extended, jazzy piano solo drew the biggest response from the crowd"
The tax cuts produced a favourable response from the public.税额削减受到了公众的欢迎.
I'm sorry; the correct response is B.不好意思,正确回答应该是B。
There was an enthusiastic response to my suggestions.我的提议得到了热情的响应。
他提出指控后迅即得到答复。他提出指控後迅即得到答覆.

responsive

[rɪ'spɒnsɪv], [rɪ'spɑːnsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 回答的；应答的；易感应的
reacting quickly and positively.
responding readily and with interest or enthusiasm.
denoting or relating to a website whose page design changes automatically according to the size of the screen on which it is viewed.
answering.
(of a section of liturgy) using responses.
"a flexible service that is responsive to changing social and economic patterns"
"our most enthusiastic and responsive students"
"a responsive site that would work on PCs and tablets equally well"
"I'm distracted by a nibble on my line: I jig it several times, but there is no responsive tug"
Mentally responsive and perceptive; quick.思维敏捷的思维反应迅速且感觉灵敏的; 快速敏捷的
Not responsive, as to treatment or stimuli.无感应的对治疗或刺激没有反应的
Highly aware of and responsive to what is fashionable and up-to-date.赶时髦的，新潮的对于流行的和时新的东西很敏感的并且积极响应的

restore

[rɪ'stɔː(r)], [rɪ'stɔːr]


Image Search
vt. 恢复；归还；复原
bring back (a previous right, practice, custom, or situation); reinstate.
return (someone or something) to a former condition, place, or position.
repair or renovate (a building, work of art, vehicle, etc.) so as to return it to its original condition.
give (something previously stolen, taken away, or lost) back to the original owner or recipient.
"the government restored confidence in the housing market"
"the effort to restore him to office isn't working"
"the building has been lovingly restored"
"the government will restore land and property to those who lost it through confiscation"
The military government promised to restore democracy within one year.军人政府答应在一年内重新建立民主体制。
Drastic measures will have to be taken to restore order.为恢复秩序必须采取严厉措施。
The police must try to restore order.警方必须努力恢复治安。
The new manager's job is to restore the company to profitability.新经理的工作是让这家公司能恢复盈利状况。
I feel quite restored to health after my holiday.假期过后，我觉得健康恢复得相当不错。
The stolen property must be restored to its owner.赃物必须物归原主。
It's easy to kill,but impossible to restore life.杀生容易,回生难。

restraints

[rɪst'reɪnts], [rɪst'reɪnts]


Image Search
制约因素
a measure or condition that keeps someone or something under control or within limits.
the action of keeping someone or something under control.
deprivation or restriction of personal liberty or freedom of movement.
a device which limits or prevents freedom of movement.
unemotional, dispassionate, or moderate behavior; self-control.
understatement, especially of artistic expression.
"decisions are made within the financial restraints of the budget"
"he remained aggressive and required physical restraint"
"car safety restraints"
"he urged the protesters to exercise restraint"
"with strings and piano, all restraint vanished"
To construct well-off society in Hubei minority areas enjoys exceptional advantages as well as unfavorable restraints.摘要湖北民族地区全面建设小康社会，既有其得天独厚的条件和基础，也有其不利的制约因素。

restrict

[rɪ'strɪkt], [rɪ'strɪkt]


Image Search
vt. 限制；约束
put a limit on; keep under control.
deprive (someone or something) of freedom of movement or action.
limit someone to only doing or having (a particular thing) or staying in (a particular place).
limit something, especially an activity, to (a particular place, time, or category of people).
withhold (information) from general circulation or disclosure.
"some roads may have to be closed at peak times to restrict the number of visitors"
"cities can restrict groups of protesters from gathering on a residential street"
"I shall restrict myself to a single example"
"the zoological gardens were at first restricted to members and their guests"
"at first the government tried to restrict news of our involvement in Vietnam"
In a move to restrict imports, the government raised custom duties.政府在限制进口的措施中提高了关税。
Recent laws have tended to restrict the freedom of the press.新法例有限制新闻自由的趋势。
I restrict myself to smoking two cigarettes a day.我限定自己每天只抽两支烟。
Fog restricted visibility.雾天能见度很低。
You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine.携带的免税酒不得超过八升。
Their policy was to restrict our growth.他们的政策是限制我们的发展。
Will realty restrict Chinese economy?房地产会制约中国经济吗?

restricted

[rɪ'strɪktɪd], [rɪ'strɪktɪd]


Image Search
adj. 受限制的；有限的；保密的
动词restrict的过去式和过去分词.
limited in extent, number, scope, or action.
(of a document or information) for limited circulation and not to be revealed to the public for reasons of national security.
(of a virus) unable to reproduce at its normal rate in certain hosts.
(of DNA) subject to degradation by a restriction enzyme.
put a limit on; keep under control.
deprive (someone or something) of freedom of movement or action.
limit someone to only doing or having (a particular thing) or staying in (a particular place).
limit something, especially an activity, to (a particular place, time, or category of people).
withhold (information) from general circulation or disclosure.
"Western scientists had only restricted access to the site"
"some roads may have to be closed at peak times to restrict the number of visitors"
"cities can restrict groups of protesters from gathering on a residential street"
"I shall restrict myself to a single example"
"the Zoological Gardens were at first restricted to members and their guests"
"at first the government tried to restrict news of our involvement in Vietnam"
The drug has only a restricted commercial use.这种麻醉药用作商品是极受限制的。
He managed to twist himself round in the restricted space.他设法在有限的空间内转过身来。
He leads a very restricted life.他的生活面非常狭窄。
Don't show this restricted material to others.不要把这些内部参考资料给别人看。

retain

[rɪ'teɪn], [rɪ'teɪn]


Image Search
vt. 保持；保留；记住；聘请
continue to have (something); keep possession of.
not abolish, discard, or alter.
keep in one's memory.
absorb and continue to hold (a substance).
keep (something) in place; hold fixed.
keep (someone) engaged in one's service.
secure the services of (a person, especially an attorney) with a preliminary payment.
"built in 1830, the house retains many of its original features"
"the rights of defendants must be retained"
"I retained a few French words and phrases"
"limestone is known to retain water"
"remove the retaining bar"
"he has been retained as a freelance"
"retain an attorney to handle the client's business"
His speech could not retain the interest of his audience.他的讲话不能保持住听众的兴趣。
I will retain my right.我将保留我的权力。
Does it retain the key elements of the original story?它是否保留了原作的关键要素?
She has a good memory and finds it easy to retain matters.她记忆力好,很容易记住事情。
He retained the best lawyer in the state to defend his case.他为他的案子聘了该州最好的律师。

retrieve

[rɪ'triːv], [rɪ'triːv]


Image Search

"he made one last desperate attempt to retrieve the situation"
"he ruined himself beyond retrieve"

She tried to retrieve the situation by making profuse apologies.她不住的道歉,力图挽回局面。
I should like to retrieve my umbrella which I left in the car.我想取回我留在车上忘记带走的雨伞。
The dog is trained to retrieve.这狗受过训能找到并带回猎物。
This is a loss beyond retrieve.这是无可挽回的损失。
This is a loss beyond retrieve.这是无可挽回的损失。

The figures revealed by the report are astounding.这份报告透露的数字使人震惊。

He took off the hat and revealed his bald head.他脱下帽子，露出秃头。
The moonlight revealed her fair face.月光使她白的面孔显露出来。

revenue

['revənjuː], ['revənuː]


Image Search
n. 税收；收入；税务局
income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature.
a state's annual income from which public expenses are met.
items or amounts constituting a state's income.
the government department collecting revenues.
"the government's tax revenues"
National tax revenue grew by a large margin every year.国家税收连年大幅度增长。
The state does not collect enough revenue to cover its expenditure.政府征收的税收不能满足支出。
Rent is one form of revenue.房租是一种收入。
The document states that all revenue has to be declared to the tax office.该文件规定必须向税务局申报所有收入。
He reported his friend to the Inland Revenue for not paying his taxes.他向税务局揭发他的朋友漏税。

['revəri], ['revəri]


Image Search

"a knock on the door broke her reverie"
He was lost in reverie.他深深陷入幻想。
She fell into a reverie about her childhood.她沉浸在对童年往事的遐想中。
He is indulging in reveries about the future.他正沉浸于对未来的幻想之中。
He drifted off into reverie again.他迷迷糊糊的又陶醉在自己的白日梦中了。
His reverie had thrown him into severe commotion.他的白日梦把他带入了严重的混乱。

reverse

[rɪ'vɜːs], [rɪ'vɜːrs]


Image Search
v. 逆转；倒退；互换；改变
adj. 相反的；反面的；颠倒的
n. 相反；背面；失败；倒档
move backward.
cause (a vehicle) to move backward.
turn (something) the other way around or up or inside out.
make (something) the opposite of what it was.
exchange (the position or function) of two people or things.
revoke or annul (a judgment, sentence, or decree made by a lower court or authority).
(of an engine) work in a contrary direction.
make (type or a design) print as white in a block of solid color or a halftone.
going in or turned toward the direction opposite to that previously stated.
operating, behaving, or ordered in a way contrary or opposite to that which is usual or expected.
(of a voltage applied to a semiconductor junction) in the direction which does not allow significant current to flow.
denoting a fault or faulting in which a relative downward movement occurred in the strata situated on the underside of the fault plane.
a complete change of direction or action.
reverse gear on a motor vehicle; the position of a gear lever or selector corresponding to this.
a play in which the ballcarrier reverses the direction of attack by lateraling or handling the ball to a teammate moving in the opposite direction.
the opposite or contrary to that previously stated.
an adverse change of fortune; a setback or defeat.
the opposite side or face to the observer.
a left-hand page of an open book, or the back of a loose document.
the side of a coin or medal bearing the value or secondary design.
the design or inscription on the reverse side of a coin or medal.
"the truck reversed into the back of a bus"
"I got in the car, reversed it and drove it up the driveway"
"after completing a row of leaves or flowers I have reversed the pattern"
"the damage done to the ozone layer may be reversed"
"the experimenter and the subject reversed roles and the experiment was repeated"
"the court reversed his conviction"
"the ship's engines reversed and cut out altogether"
"their press ads had a headline reversed out of the illustration"
"the trend appears to be going in the reverse direction"
"here are the results in reverse order"
"the growth actuates a reverse of photosynthesis"
"he didn't feel homesick—quite the reverse"
"the team suffered its heaviest reverse of the season"
"the address is given on the reverse of this leaflet"
The government has failed to reverse the economic decline.政府未能扭转经济滑坡的趋势。
He reversed the car into a tree.他倒车撞到了树上。
Statistics showed a reverse trend to that recorded in other countries.统计数字表明这种趋向与其他国家所示情况迥异。
Count down in reverse order 10, 9, 8...倒数--10、 9、 8...
In hot weather, the reverse happens.在热天,情况相反。
There's a picture of an eagle on the reverse of the coin.这个硬币的背面是一只鹰的图案。
Put the car into reverse.把车挂上倒挡。

revision

[rɪ'vɪʒn], [rɪ'vɪʒn]


Image Search

the action of revising.
a revised edition or form of something.
"the plan needs drastic revision"
A revision of that dictionary has been published.那本词典的修订本已经出版。
The catalogue is under revision.目录正在修订之中。
She matured her novel by constant revision.她不断修改自己的小说以使其趋于完善。
The law is in need of revision.这法律需要修改。
Our budget needs drastic revision.我们的预算需作重大修改。
Friday afternoons are left free for revision.留出星期五下午的时间做复习。
You need enough revision for the test.为了考试你需要充分的复习。

revocation

[ˌrevə'keɪʃn], [ˌrevə'keɪʃn]


Image Search

the official cancellation of a decree, decision, or promise.
"for those who break the law, revocation of their liquor license may result"

revolution

[ˌrevə'luːʃn], [ˌrevə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 革命；变革；重大改变；旋转
a forcible overthrow of a government or social order, in favor of a new system.
the American Revolution.
(in Marxism) the class struggle which is expected to lead to political change and the triumph of communism.
a dramatic and wide-reaching change in the way something works or is organized or in people's ideas about it.
an instance of revolving.
the movement of an object in a circular or elliptical course around another or about an axis or center.
a single orbit of one object around another or about an axis or center.
"marketing underwent a revolution"
"one revolution a second"
"observing the revolution about the axis of rotation"
Most countries have had revolutions aganist the government.大多数国家发生过反对政府的革命。
The industrial revolution had taken place in England first.工业革命首先在英国发生。
Those people go around preaching revolution.那些人到处宣扬革命。
The invention of aircraft caused a revolution in our ways of travelling.飞机的发明引起了旅行方式的巨大改变。
Credit cards have brought about a revolution in people's spending habits.信用卡的使用给人们的消费习惯带来巨大改变.
The earth makes one revolution round the sun each year.地球每年绕太阳旋转一周。
The earth completes one revolution each day.地球每天完成一次自转。

rigid

['rɪdʒɪd], ['rɪdʒɪd]


Image Search
adj. 坚硬的；严格的；固执的；僵硬的；刻板的
unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible.
(of a person or part of the body) stiff and unmoving, especially as a result of shock or fear.
not able to be changed or adapted.
not adaptable in outlook, belief, or response.
"a seat of rigid orange plastic"
"his face grew rigid with fear"
"teachers are being asked to unlearn rigid rules for labeling children"
"ski instructors have become less rigid about style"
The tent has a rigid support.帐篷有一个坚硬的支柱。
He is a man of very rigid principles.他是一个原则性很强的人。
He's very rigid in his ideas.他的想法非常固执。
She was rigid with fear.她害怕得全身僵住了。
It's an exercise which adds a touch of the comic opera to his rigid training routines.这一练习给他那刻板的训练程序平添了一份滑稽的色彩。

rigorous

['rɪɡərəs], ['rɪɡərəs]


Image Search
adj. 严格的；严厉的；严峻的；细致的
extremely thorough, exhaustive, or accurate.
(of a rule, system, etc.) strictly applied or adhered to.
(of a person) adhering strictly or inflexibly to a belief, opinion, or way of doing something.
harsh and demanding.
"the rigorous testing of consumer products"
"rigorous controls on mergers"
"a rigorous teetotaler"
"my exercise regime is a little more rigorous than most"
The planes have to undergo rigorous safety checks.这些飞机得接受非常严格的安全检查。
The work failed to meet their rigorous standards.工作没有达到他们的严格标准。
It further implements the safe production responsibility system, and enforces rigorous safe production laws and regulations and a related accountability system.进一步实行安全生产责任体系，加强严厉的安全生产法规和相关责任体系。
He lived through the rigorous trials of revolutionary war.他经受了革命战争的严峻考验。
He makes a rigorous study of the plant in the area.他对该地的植物进行了慎密的研究。

role

[rəʊl], [roʊl]


Image Search
n. 作用；角色
an actor's part in a play, movie, etc.
the function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation.
"Dietrich's role as a wife in war-torn Paris"
"she greeted us all in her various roles of mother, friend, and daughter"
The Panama Canal has played a very important role in transportation.巴拿马运河在运输上起到了非常重要的作用。
The key role of the teacher in the learning process should not be neglected.教师在学习中的关键作用是不该忽视的。
The role of the railway declines in the transport system.在运输系统中,铁路的重要性逐渐下降。
She prefers to play comic roles.她更喜欢扮演滑稽角色。
He played a passive role in the marriage.他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。
His dual role as a composer and a conductor made him very busy.他作曲家和指挥家的双重身份使他非常繁忙。

rotate

[rəʊ'teɪt], ['roʊteɪt]


Image Search
v. 轮流；(使)旋转
adj. 车轮状的
move or cause to move in a circle around an axis or center.
pass to each member of a group in a regularly recurring order.
grow (different crops) in succession on a particular piece of land to avoid exhausting the soil and to control weeds, pests, and diseases.
change the position of (tires) on a motor vehicle to distribute wear evenly.
"the wheel continued to rotate"
"the job of chairing the meeting rotates"
"these crops were sometimes rotated with grass"
The post of chairman rotates among members of the committee.主席一职由委员会的成员轮流担任。
Interns have to rotate for a few months.实习医生轮流工作了几个月。
He rotates the handle gently.他轻轻地转动手柄。
Does the earth rotate on an axis?地球是绕轴旋转的吗？

rotating

[rəʊ'teɪtɪŋ], [rəʊ'teɪtɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 旋转的
动词rotate的现在分词.
move or cause to move in a circle around an axis or center.
pass to each member of a group in a regularly recurring order.
grow (different crops) in succession on a particular piece of land to avoid exhausting the soil and to control weeds, pests, and diseases.
change the position of (tires) on a motor vehicle to distribute wear evenly.
"the wheel continued to rotate"
"the job of chairing the meeting rotates"
"these crops were sometimes rotated with grass"
Eddies are swirls or rotating water flow.漩涡即旋转的水流。
In rotating, the shaft splashes oil up into the bearings.当轴旋转的时候就把油溅入轴承。

rotund

[rəʊ'tʌnd], [roʊ'tʌnd]


Image Search
adj. (指人)圆胖的；(声音)洪亮的
(of a person) plump.
round or spherical.
(of speech or literary style) indulging in grandiloquent expression.
"huge stoves held great rotund cauldrons"
He was a large rotund man with a very jovial nature and a compassionate disposition.他是一个又高又胖的男人，天性快乐并富有同情心。
These rotund amphibians can grow to 8 inches (20 centimeters) in length and would cover a good-size tea saucer.这种洪亮的两栖动物可以长到20厘米长，可以盖住一个大尺寸的茶托。

route

[ruːt], [ruːt]


Image Search
n. 路线；(固定)线路；途径
vt. 为 ... 安排路线；(按路线)发送
a way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination.
the line of a road, path, railroad, etc.
a circuit traveled in delivering, selling, or collecting goods.
a method or process leading to a specified result.
send or direct along a specified course.
"the most direct route is via Los Angeles"
"the many routes to a healthier diet will be described"
"all lines of communication were routed through Atlanta"
The route was once much travelled but has fallen into disuse.这条路线旅行的人以前常走，但是现在已不用了。
The bus route goes so far as that, so you'll need to take a taxi.汽车路线到此为止了，你得叫辆的士。
The plane deviated from its usual route.飞机偏离了正常的航线。
Professor Layard argues that higher income is a route to higher status.莱亚德教授提出,增加收入是提高地位的一个途径。
The flight is routed to Chicago via New York.这个航班被安排经纽约飞往芝加哥。
Our travel agent routed us through Italy.我们的旅行社安排我们途经义大利。
All train ferry traffic will be routed via Dover.所有的火车轮渡交通都将经多佛中转。

rowdy

['raʊdi], ['raʊdi]

noisy and disorderly.
a noisy and disorderly person.
"it was a rowdy but good-natured crowd"

The teacher made the rowdy class quiet down.老师使这吵闹的班级安静了下来。
He was beaten to death by a rowdy person.他被一个暴徒打得死去活来。

ruffle

['rʌfl], ['rʌfl]


Image Search
n. 褶饰；花边
v. 弄皱或弄乱某物；扰乱；激怒
disorder or disarrange (someone's hair), typically by running one's hands through it.
(of a bird) erect (its feathers) in anger or display.
disturb the smoothness or tranquility of.
disconcert or upset the composure of (someone).
ornament with or gather into a frill.
an ornamental gathered or goffered frill of lace or other cloth on a garment, especially around the wrist or neck.
a vibrating drumbeat.
"the father laughs and jovially ruffles his son's hair"
"on his departure to the high wires, the starling ruffled his feathers and flirted his wings"
"the evening breeze ruffled the surface of the pond in the yard"
"Brian had been ruffled by her questions"
"a blouse with a high ruffled neck"
Her blouse has a ruffle of lace around the neck.她的衬衫领子镶有褶裥花边。
The seamstress bound the hem of the dress with a ruffle.女裁缝用褶裥饰边给女上衣镶边。
A flag ruffled in the breeze.旗帜迎风飘扬。
A breeze ruffled the surface of the lake.一阵微风吹皱了湖面。
Don't ruffle my hair, I've just combed it.别把我的头发弄乱了
Nothing can ruffle her gentle disposition.她的温和性格使她遇到任何事情都不会恼火。
Anne is easily ruffled by awkward questions.安娜容易被一些难以回答的问题弄得心烦意乱。
Do not get so ruffled, you should not ruffle so easily.别那么生气,你不该那么容易发脾气。
He was determined, today, not to let Nancy Molineaux or anyone else ruffle him.他今天下了决心不让南希·莫利诺或者任何其他人激怒他。

rummage

['rʌmɪdʒ], ['rʌmɪdʒ]


Image Search
v. 到处翻寻；搜出；检查
n. 翻箱倒柜的寻找；临检
search unsystematically and untidily through a mass or receptacle.
find (something) by rummaging.
(of a customs officer) make a thorough search of (a vessel).
an unsystematic and untidy search through a mass or receptacle.
a thorough search of a vessel by a customs officer.
"he rummaged in his pocket for a handkerchief"
"Mick rummaged up his skateboard"
"our brief was to rummage as many of the vessels as possible"
Larry had to rummage through several cartons.拉里不得不翻了好几个纸盒。
The old lady began to rummage in her pocket for her spectacles.老太太开始在口袋里摸索，找她的眼镜。
I rummaged out some old clothes and give them to the man at the door?我找出些旧衣服送给门口的那个人。
He had a good rummage inside the sofa.他把沙发内部彻底搜寻了一翻。
She gave a good rummage around her basement but couldn't find her radio anywhere.她在地下室翻箱倒柜但是找不到她的收音机。

sabotage

['sæbətɑːʒ], ['sæbətɑːʒ]


Image Search
n. 怠工；破坏
vt. 破坏
deliberately destroy, damage, or obstruct (something), especially for political or military advantage.
the action of sabotaging something.
Their sabotage put back production badly.他们的怠工严重影响了生产。
The fire at the factory was caused by sabotage.那家工厂的火灾是有人蓄意破坏引起的。
They are carrying out subversion,sabotage,intervention and aggression everywhere in the world.他们在全世界到处进行颠覆，破坏，干涉和侵略。
They tried to sabotage my birthday party.他们企图破坏我的生日晚会。
The rebels had tried to sabotage the oil pipeline.反叛者试图破坏输油管道。

"low interest rates are offering the opportunity to safeguard their financial futures"
There is no safeguard against inappropriate data types being added.没有保护措施来防止添加不适当的数据类型。
We must safeguard our national interests.我们必须保卫国家的利益。
To safeguard the peace is one of the important tasks of the army.军队的重要任务之一是保卫和平。

There is no safeguard against inappropriate data types being added.没有保护措施来防止添加不适当的数据类型。

sage

[seɪdʒ], [seɪdʒ]


Image Search
n. 圣人；哲人
n. 鼠尾草；蒿属植物
adj. 贤明的；明智的
an aromatic plant with grayish-green leaves that are used as a culinary herb, native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean.
used in names of aromatic plants of the mint family that resemble sage, e.g., wood sage.
either of two bushy North American plants with silvery-gray leaves.
short for sagebrush.
a profoundly wise man, especially one who features in ancient history or legend.
having, showing, or indicating profound wisdom.
"they nodded in agreement with these sage remarks"
A sage has more than one teacher.圣人无常师。
Confucius is considered the greatest of the ancient Chinese sages.孔子被认为是中国古代最伟大的圣贤。
The sage is the instructor of a hundred ages.这位哲人是百代之师。
Sage has been known to symbolize strength for thousands of years.鼠尾草千百年来被当作强有力的象征。
The girl planted some scarlet sage in her garden.女孩在她的花园里种了些一串红。
I was grateful for the old man's sage advice.我很感激那位老人贤明的忠告。
It is habit of age to give sage advice to youth.给青年一些贤明的建议是老年人的一种习性。
What a sage reply you gave!多聪明的回答啊！
This is sage advice I can pass on to every writer and artist.这是一个我能够传达给每一个作家和艺术家的大师级建议。

The chapel became a sanctuary for the refugees.这座小教堂成为难民的庇护所。
His garden was his pride and joy and became a sanctuary for birds.他的花园是他的得意之作，并成为了鸟儿的庇护所。

The oral sanitary product containing the zedoary turmeric oil has the function of inhibiting various pathogenic bacteria and virus growth while guaranteeing the tooth sanitation.所述的含莪术油的口腔卫生产品在用于保证牙齿清洁的同时，具有抑制口腔和上呼吸道内各种致病细菌和病毒生长的作用。

scan

[skæn], [skæn]


Image Search
vt. 扫描；浏览；审视；细看
vi. 合韵律；划分音步
n. 扫描；浏览；细看
look at all parts of (something) carefully in order to detect some feature.
look quickly but not very thoroughly through (a document or other text) in order to identify relevant information.
cause (a surface, object, or part of the body) to be traversed by a detector or an electromagnetic beam.
cause (a beam) to traverse across a surface or object.
convert (a document or picture) into digital form for storage or processing on a computer.
resolve (a picture) into its elements of light and shade in a prearranged pattern for the purposes of television transmission.
analyze the meter of (a line of verse) by reading with the emphasis on its rhythm or by examining the pattern of feet or syllables.
(of verse) conform to metrical principles.
an act of scanning someone or something.
a medical examination using a scanner.
an image obtained by scanning or with a scanner.
"he raised his binoculars to scan the coast"
"we scan the papers for news from the trouble spots"
"their brains are scanned so that researchers can monitor the progress of the disease"
"we scanned the beam over a sector of 120°"
"text and pictures can be scanned into the computer"
"a quick scan of the sports page"
"a brain scan"
"we can't predict anything until we have seen the scan"
Could you teach me how to scan an image?你可以教我如何扫描一个影像吗?
I scanned the newspaper when I was waiting for the bus.等公共汽车的时候，我匆匆浏览了一下报纸。
She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.她审视他的脸,试图探寻他在思考什么。
I scanned my pocket for change.我仔细查看囗袋找零钱。
The verses scan well.这些诗句符合韵律。
The doctors gave him an ultrasonic brain scan.医生给他做了脑部超声波扫描检查。
I'm too busy to read the whole newspaper, I just scan the headline.我太忙了，没法看整份报纸，只是浏览了一下大标题。
Employers receive many resumes and must scan each of them quickly.雇主会收到许多简历，因此必须快速浏览它们。

a public housing complex.

"a classical rhyme scheme"
"the whole scheme is plunged into darkness, bar the light in Victor's house"
"he schemed to bring about the collapse of the government"
Their scheme was exposed.他们的阴谋被暴露了。
The police have uncovered a scheme of robbery.警察当局破获了一起阴谋抢劫案。
They were bitterly opposed to the scheme.他们强烈反对这个计划。
I rather doubt if such an ambitious scheme could be made a success of.我真怀疑这样一个雄心勃勃的计划是否会成功。
A rival company has set afloat a new credit scheme.一家竞争的公司已开始实施一项新的信用购物方案。
My contention is that the scheme will never work.我认为这个方案行不通。
He is scheming for power.他在图谋争权。
He schemed to keep his rivals in ignorance of his plans.他图谋不让他的对手们知道他的计划。
They schemed out a new method of bridge building.他们设计了一种新的造桥方法。
They have been scheming to overthrow the government.他们一直在策划推翻政府。
What do you scheme?你认为怎么样？

This is the argument of the school.这就是流行学派的论据。

The graduate school is recruiting students, you can try.研究生院在招生，你可以试试啊！
She should be schooled with her peers.她应当与她的同龄人一起接受教育。
I have schooled myself to remain calm under pressure.我练就一副在压力之下保持镇静的本领。

scope

[skəʊp], [skoʊp]


Image Search
n. 机会；范围；眼界；观看的仪器
vt. 仔细研究
the extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with or to which it is relevant.
the opportunity or possibility to do or deal with something.
a purpose, end, or intention.
a telescope, microscope, or other device having a name ending in -scope.
the length of cable extended when a ship rides at anchor.
the range of the effect of an operator such as a quantifier or conjunction.
assess or investigate (something).
set the scope of (a projected undertaking).
look at carefully; scan.
denoting an instrument for observing, viewing, or examining.
"we widened the scope of our investigation"
"the scope for major change is always limited by political realities"
"Plato maintains religion to be the chief aim and scope of human life"
"infrared night scopes"
"they'd scoped out their market"
"it is important that a project is scoped correctly to ensure the budget can be accurately defined"
"they watched him scoping the room, looking for Michael"
"microscope"
He gets a work that gives scope for his abilities.他得到了一份有机会发挥他才能的工作。
He has no scope for his particular talents.他没有施展自己特殊才能的机会。
It is within my scope.那是在我的范围之内。
This subject is outside the scope of our inquiry.这个问题不在我们探讨的范围之内。
We have to broaden our scope.咱们应当扩大一下眼界。
The scope for human error could also be minimised.人为出错的机会也尽可能减低。
He scopes the big picture of Israeli-Arab relations.他认真地查看关于以色列和阿拉伯关系的大图片。

scorch

[skɔːtʃ], [skɔːrtʃ]


Image Search
v. （使）烧焦；变焦；（使）枯萎
n. 烧焦
burn the surface of (something) with flame or heat.
become burned when exposed to heat or a flame.
(of the heat of the sun) cause (vegetation or a place) to become dried out and lifeless.
(of a person or vehicle) move very fast.
the burning or charring of the surface of something.

"surrounding houses were scorched by heat from the blast"
"the meat had scorched"
"a desolate, scorched landscape"
"a sports car scorching along the expressway"
"a scorch mark"
Jenny scorch her jacket carelessly while she is smoking her pipe.珍妮抽烟斗时不小心把夹克烧焦。
Luckily, flashes of such strong radiation occur so far away they will not scorch our planet.幸运的是，诸如这类的强辐射大发生离我们非常的遥远，他们不会烧焦我们的地球。
Jenny scorch her jacket carelessly while she is smoking her pipe.珍妮抽烟斗时不小心把夹克烧焦。
Luckily, flashes of such strong radiation occur so far away they will not scorch our planet.幸运的是，诸如这类的强辐射大发生离我们非常的遥远，他们不会烧焦我们的地球。

scour

['skaʊə(r)], ['skaʊər]


Image Search

an act of rubbing something hard to clean or brighten it.
diarrhea in livestock, especially cattle and pigs.
subject (a place, text, etc.) to a thorough search in order to locate something.

"he scoured the bathtub"

"he scoured up the ladder"

This rusted pan does not scour easily.这只生锈的锅不容易擦乾净。
The police scoured the area looking for the lost child.警方搜遍这个地区寻找这个走失的孩子。
The cleaning lady gave it a good scour.清洁女工将它好好地刷洗了一遍。
I gave the dirty floor a good scour.我把脏地板好好擦了一下。

section

['sekʃn], ['sekʃn]


Image Search
n. 部分；部门；章节；区域；断面；剖面图；零件；路段；切开

any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up.
a relatively distinct part of a book, newspaper, statute, or other document.
a measure of land, equal to one square mile.
a particular district of a town.
a distinct group within a larger body of people or things.
a group of players of a family of instruments within an orchestra.
a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately.
a specified military unit.
a subdivision of an army platoon.
a secondary taxonomic category, especially a subgenus.
the cutting of a solid by or along a plane.
the shape resulting from cutting a solid along a plane.
a representation of the internal structure of something as if it has been cut through vertically or horizontally.
a separation by cutting.
a thin slice of plant or animal tissue prepared for microscopic examination.
divide into sections.
separate an area from a larger one.
cut (animal or plant tissue) into thin slices for microscopic examination.
divide by cutting.

"arrange orange sections on a platter"
"the children's section of the library"
"the brass section"
"graduate students lead discussion sections for professors' lecture courses"
"a camouflage section was added to the army"
"she began to section the grapefruit"
"parts of the curved balcony had been sectioned off with wrought-iron grilles"
"it is common veterinary practice to section the nerves to the hoof of a limping horse"
"should she be sectioned?"
White lines divide the playing area into sections.这些白线把赛区分成各个部分。
I hope someone competent will join our section.我希望有能力的人加入本部门。
The report has a section on accidents at work.报告中有一段谈到工作中的事故问题。
She lives near the business section.她住在商业区附近。
This illustration shows a section through the timber.本图所示为木材的纵剖面。
The architect drew the house in section.建筑师画出房子的剖面图。
The shed comes in sections that you assemble yourself.这个棚子有几个部分
While driving on the bumpy section of the road, he switches on the shock-absorbers.在路面不平的路段他开启了减震器。
The surgeon performed a section on the vein.外科医生施行了静脉切开手术。

sector

['sektə(r)], ['sektər]


Image Search
n. 部门；部分；区域
n. [计]扇形；扇区
vt. 使分成部分
an area or portion that is distinct from others.
a distinct part or branch of a nation's economy or society or of a sphere of activity such as education.
a subdivision of an area for military operations.
a subdivision of a track on a magnetic disk.
the plane figure enclosed by two radii of a circle or ellipse and the arc between them.
a mathematical instrument consisting of two arms hinged at one end and marked with sines, tangents, etc. for making diagrams.
"the industrial and commercial sector"
perceive superficially
The government made an investigation of the employment in the public and private sectors.政府对国营和私营部门的就业情况作了一次调查。
Fashion is one sector of the beauty industry.时装是美容行业的一个部分。
We must be careful not to confuse a segment and a sector.我们必须小心不要把细分市场和部分市场混淆。
The enemy attacked in the southern sector.敌军对南部地区发起进攻。
A sector of a cylindrical capacitor may thus be utilized as an energy filter.柱面扇形电容器可作为能量过滤器。
Your professional reputation will be in the spotlight as this coming Friday's full moon will light up your honors and recognition sector.当即将到来周五的满月照亮你象征荣耀与褒奖的扇形面时，你职业上的名誉将得到瞩目。
There are several sectors unusable in this disk.这张磁盘有几个扇区坏了。

security

[sɪ'kjʊərəti], [sə'kjʊrəti]


Image Search
n. 安全；保证；证券；债券；抵押；防护措施
the state of being free from danger or threat.
the safety of a state or organization against criminal activity such as terrorism, theft, or espionage.
procedures followed or measures taken to ensure the safety of a state or organization.
the state of feeling safe, stable, and free from fear or anxiety.
a private police force that guards a building, campus, park, etc.
a thing deposited or pledged as a guarantee of the fulfillment of an undertaking or the repayment of a loan, to be forfeited in case of default.
a certificate attesting credit, the ownership of stocks or bonds, or the right to ownership connected with tradable derivatives.
"the system is designed to provide maximum security against toxic spills"
"a matter of national security"
"amid tight security the presidents met in the Colombian resort"
"this man could give the emotional security she needed"
I'll undertake for your security.我将保证你的安全。
The visitors were secarched for security reasons.为了安全起见,来宾受到了检查。
Our own actions are our security.我们的行为是自己的保证。
He traded in securities and became rich.他做证券交易发了财。
The value of a derivative is based on another security.金融衍生工具的价值以另一种债券为基准。
He has given his house as security for the loan.他以抵押自己的房屋作为贷款的担保。
A life insurance policy may serve as security for a loan.人寿保险可作贷款的抵押。
We need greater security in car parks.我们需要加强停车场的安全措施.

seek

[siːk], [siːk]


Image Search
vt. 寻求；追求；试图
vi. 寻找
attempt to find (something).
attempt or desire to obtain or achieve (something).
ask for (something) from someone.
search for and find someone or something.
go to (a place).
"they came here to seek shelter from biting winter winds"
"the new regime sought his extradition"
"he sought help from the police"
"it's his job to seek out new customers"
"I sought my bedroom each night to brood over it"
Tortured by fear, he decided to seek the aid of a psychiatrist.他终日恐惧不安,决定寻求心理医生的帮助。
Many single people are seeking that special someone.许多单身人士都在追求他们的唯一。
Some nations will seek the change of their energy supply sources to reduce emissions, or for other reasons.为了减少碳排量,或是出于其他原因,一些国家试图改变他们的能源供应来源。
You seek all day and you find it, and then you realize that it is worthless.你终日寻寻觅觅,找到了,之后却发现那根本不值得寻找。

select

mark (an option or section of text) on an electronic interface for a particular operation.
(of a group of people or things) carefully chosen from a larger number as being the best or most valuable.
(of a place or group of people) only used by or consisting of a wealthy or sophisticated elite; exclusive.
"he has been selected to take part"
"a phenotype can be selected against"
"click Tools on the menu bar and select Settings"
"he joined his select team of young Intelligence operatives"
"the opera was seen by a small and highly select audience"
Please select a channel to begin with from left.请从左边选择一个频道。
She lets her son select his own Christmas present.她让儿子自己选择圣诞礼物。
They select him to their leader.他们选择他为他们的领导人。
She selected a diamond ring from the collection.她从收藏品中挑选了一枚钻石戒指。
You may select those books you like best.你可以从那些书中挑选你最喜欢的书。
A select group were invited to the wedding reception.一群经过挑选的人士被邀请参加婚宴。
Select film excerpts will be played on the film festival.精选电影摘录将在电影节播放。
This is a very select area; you have to be rich to live here.这是高级住宅区，你必须有钱才能住在这里。

selective

[sɪ'lektɪv], [sɪ'lektɪv]


Image Search

"the mini-cow is the result of generations of selective breeding"

"modern pesticides are more selective in effect"
He seemed to have a very selective recall of past events.他好像对过去的事情有选择地回忆。
This medicine is selective in its action.这种药的药效有选择性的。
She is selective in the dresses she wears.她对于自己穿的衣服精挑细选。

self-seeking


Image Search
n. 利己主义；只顾自己
another term for self-serving.
concern for oneself before others.
Love is patient, Love is kind, love is not self seeking. 爱是刚强;爱是节制;爱是恒久忍耐.
Cynical, self seeking, materialistic and ungoverned by the principles of the Truth. 冷嘲热讽、寻求自己、注重物质利益，不愿意受真理的约束。
Let him seek peace and ensue it! 让他去追求和平并为和平而奔波吧。
The plaintiff is seeking remedy through the court. 原告通过法院请示获得救济。
I have been seeking it all round. 我一直在四处寻找它。
I do not like to go to the movies by my self. 我不喜欢自己一个人看电影。

sequence

['siːkwəns], ['siːkwəns]


Image Search

vt. 按顺序排好

a repetition of a phrase or melody at a higher or lower pitch.
the order in which amino acid or nucleotide residues are arranged in a protein, DNA, etc.
a set of related events, movements, or things that follow each other in a particular order.
a set of three or more playing cards of the same suit next to each other in value, for example 10, 9, 8.
an infinite ordered series of numerical quantities.
a part of a film dealing with one particular event or topic.
(in the Eucharist) a hymn said or sung after the Gradual or Alleluia that precedes the Gospel.
arrange in a particular order.
ascertain the sequence of amino acid or nucleotide residues in (a protein, DNA, etc.).
play or record (music) with a sequencer.
"the content of the program should follow a logical sequence"
"a grueling sequence of exercises"
"the famous underwater sequence"
"trainee librarians decide how a set of misfiled cards could be sequenced"
We will deal with events in historical sequence.我们将按照历史上的先后顺序研究这些事件。
She made a sequence of dance movements.她做了一个连续的舞蹈动作。
He described the events of that day in sequence.他按先后次序描述了那一天发生的种种事件。
A sequence of murders had prompted the police to actions.一连串的谋杀迫使警方不得不采取行动。
Please sequence the names in alphabetical order.请按字母顺序排列好名单。

Serene.
adj. 尊贵的
calm, peaceful, and untroubled; tranquil.

an expanse of clear sky or calm sea.
"her eyes were closed and she looked very serene"

"not a cloud obscured the deep serene"
His serene smile calmed all of us down.他脸上安详的微笑使我们都冷静下来。
The story took place in a serene summer night.故事发生在一个宁静的夏夜。
It was a beautiful morning, calm and serene.那是一个宁静、明媚的早晨。
Light music fills my heart with serene joyfulness.轻音乐能带给我平静的欢乐。

series

['sɪəriːz], ['sɪriːz]


Image Search
n. （单复同）系列；丛书；连续
a number of things, events, or people of a similar kind or related nature coming one after another.
a set of books, maps, periodicals, or other documents published in a common format or under a common title.
a set of games played between two teams, or among any number of individual competitors.
a line of products, especially vehicles or machines, sharing features of design or assembly and marketed with a separate number from other lines.
a set of stamps, banknotes, or coins issued at a particular time or having a common design or theme.
a set of related television or radio programs, especially of a specified kind.
another term for tone row.
denoting electrical circuits or components arranged so that the current passes through each successively.
(in chronostratigraphy) a range of strata corresponding to an epoch in time, being a subdivision of a system and itself subdivided into stages.
a set of elements with common properties or of compounds related in composition or structure.
a set of quantities constituting a progression or having the several values determined by a common relation.
a group of speech sounds having at least one phonetic feature in common but distinguished in other respects.
"the explosion was the latest in a series of accidents"
"a playoff series against Portland"
"early models of the 600D series incorporated a centrifugal oil filter"
"a new drama series"
"the Pliocene series"
"the metals of the lanthanide series"
The lecture series falls naturally into three parts.该系列讲座可自然分作三部分。
The theory is based on a series of wrong assumptions.这一理论是以一系列错误的设想为依据的。
He published a new series of readers for students of English.他出版了一套新的英语学习丛书。
After a series of unsuccessful attempts, he has finally passed the driving test.经过连续几次的失败，他最后终于通过了驾驶考试。

Image Search

a reversal or check in progress.
a plain, flat offset in a wall.

He met with many a setback in his lifetime.他一生中遭到过许多挫折。
This setback has drained away my keenness.这次挫折削弱了我的热情。
Undaunted by his first setback, he decided to try once more.不为最初的失败而动摇，他决定再试一次。
This latest arrest was just one minor setback.最近的逮捕只不过是一个小小的退步。

a person's genitals.
either of the two main categories (male and female) into which humans and most other living things are divided on the basis of their reproductive functions.
the members of either sex considered as a group.
the fact of belonging to either the male or female sex.
determine the sex of.
present something in a more interesting or lively way.
arouse or attempt to arouse someone sexually.
variant spelling of sexi-, shortened before a vowel (as in sexennial ), or shortened before a consonant (as in sexfoil ).
six; having six.
"they enjoyed talking about sex"
"adults of both sexes"
"she was well known for her efforts to improve the social condition of her sex"
"the same allowances for childcare should be available to all single parents irrespective of sex"

Everybody can come to this school,without respect to class, race, or sex.不论阶级、种族、性别,人人都可以进这所学校上课。
She disguised her true sex under a man's garment.她身穿男装来掩饰自己的真实性别。
Hunger and sex are elemental drives of human beings.食欲和性欲是人类的原始冲动。
The movie is full of sex and violence.这部电影充满了性和暴力。
It's difficult to sex newborn chicks.新生小鸡雏的性别是很难判断的。
They sex up their commercial advertisements to attract customers.他们使商业广告充满性感内容以吸引顾客。

sham

[ʃæm], [ʃæm]


Image Search
n. 假；赝品；骗子；枕头套
adj. 假的；伪造的
v. 假装；学样子
a thing that is not what it is purported to be.
pretense.
a person who pretends to be someone or something they are not.
short for pillow sham.
bogus; false.
falsely present something as the truth.
pretend to be or to be experiencing.
"the proposed legislation is a farce and a sham"
"it all turned out to be sham and hypocrisy"
"he was a sham, totally unqualified for his job as a senior doctor"
"a clergyman who arranged a sham marriage"
"was he ill or was he shamming?"
"she shams indifference"
His love was a sham; he only wanted her money.他爱她是假的，他只想要她的钱。
She claims to know all about computers but really she's a sham.她自称精通计算机，其实她是假充内行。
Are these real diamonds or only sham?这些是真的钻石还是赝品?
He a man! Hell! He was a hollow sham.他是男子汉？见鬼！他是个虚伪的骗子。
They cunningly played the game of sham peace.他们狡滑地玩弄假和平的把戏。
He's only shamming.他只是假装而已。

['ʃeɪmfl], ['ʃeɪmfl]


Image Search

worthy of or causing shame or disgrace.
"a shameful accusation"
It was shameful of them to surrender.他们投降是可耻的。
They considered her behaviour a shameful piece of snobbery.他们认为她为人势利，行为可耻。
These shameful manoeuvres were aimed at securing his election.这些可耻的伎俩都是为了能让他当选。
There is nothing shameful about that, since she was a witch who had used a pillow to deceive him.这没有什么对不起人的地方，她是会拿枕头和他变戏法的女怪。

shift

[ʃɪft], [ʃɪft]


Image Search
v. 移动；改变；换挡；字型转换
n. 轮班；变化；移动；计谋；轮班职工
move or cause to move from one place to another, especially over a small distance.
change the position of one's body, especially because one is nervous or uncomfortable.
change the emphasis, direction, or focus of.
change in emphasis, direction, or focus.
move (data) one or more places to the right or left in a register.
press the shift key on a typewriter or computer keyboard.
sell (something).
change gear in a vehicle.
be evasive or indirect.
a slight change in position, direction, or tendency.
the displacement of spectral lines.
a key on a typewriter or computer keyboard used to switch between two sets of characters or functions, principally between lower- and upper-case letters.
short for sound shift.
the gearshift or gear-changing mechanism in a motor vehicle.
the positioning of successive rows of bricks so that their ends do not coincide.
a movement of the digits of a word in a register one or more places to left or right, equivalent to multiplying or dividing the corresponding number by a power of whatever number is the base.
a change of position by two or more players before the ball is put into play.
one of two or more recurring periods in which different groups of workers do the same jobs in relay.
the group of people who work during a particular shift.
a woman's straight unwaisted dress.
a long, loose-fitting undergarment.
an ingenious or devious device or stratagem.
"I shift the weight back to the other leg"
"he shifted a little in his chair"
"she's shifting the blame onto me"
"the wind had shifted to the east"
"the partial remainder is shifted left"
"a lot of high-priced product you simply don't know how to shift"
"she shifted down to fourth"
"they know not how to shift and rob as the old ones do"
"a shift in public opinion"
"the night shift"
"the thousand shifts and devices of which Hannibal was a master"
The tools shift around in the car boot every time we turn a corner.我们每次转弯，汽车行李箱里的工具就来回动。
The Left is shifting their ground.左派正在改变立场。
You have to shift as you drive around the corner.你拐角时要换挡变速。
They were taking turns to be on the night shift.他们轮流做夜班。
This accident caused a dramatic shift in public opinion.这个意外引起了公众舆论的急剧变化。
The 21st century has been seeing a gradual shift of people from the country to the town.21世纪,人口开始渐渐由乡村向市镇转移。
As a temporary shift, he covered up the leak with a plastic bag.作为权宜之计，他用塑料袋把漏洞给包上了。

shortage

['ʃɔːtɪdʒ], ['ʃɔːrtɪdʒ]


Image Search
n. 不足；缺少，短缺
a state or situation in which something needed cannot be obtained in sufficient amounts.
"a shortage of hard cash"
The war was lost because of a shortage of munitions.战争因军火不足而失败。
Power shortage browned out the city that winter.那年冬天，由于电力不足，市里采取了部分停电供应措施。
He always bemoans the shortage of funds for research.他总是叹息研究经费不足。
Continuance of the war will mean shortage of the food.战争的持续意味着食品短缺。
The company's main problem is the shortage of skilled personnel.这家公司的主要问题是缺少有技术的人员。

a very small amount.

play a very fast, intricate style of rock lead guitar.

We haven't got a shred of evidence.我们没有丝毫证据。

significant

[sɪɡ'nɪfɪkənt], [sɪɡ'nɪfɪkənt]


Image Search
adj. 重要的；有意义的；意味深长的；显著的
sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; noteworthy.
having a particular meaning; indicative of something.
suggesting a meaning or message that is not explicitly stated.
relating to or having significance.
"a significant increase in sales"
"in times of stress her dreams seemed to her especially significant"
"she gave him a significant look"
The question under discussion is significant.讨论中的问题是重要的。
Economic conditions are significant in many ways.经济条件在许多方面都是很重要的。
All of us want our lives to be significant.我们每个人都希望我们的人生是有意义的。
It was truly a significant conversation.这是非常有意义的谈话。
Grandpa looked over and gave me a significant smile.爷爷看着我给了我一个意味深长的微笑。
His first appearance in literary history is curious and significant.他在文学史上的初露锋芒是奇特而意味深长的。

similar

['sɪmələ(r)], ['sɪmələr]


Image Search
adj. 类似的
resembling without being identical.
(of geometric figures) having the same shape, with the same angles and proportions, though not necessarily of the same size.
a person or thing similar to another.
a substance that produces effects resembling the symptoms of particular diseases (the basis of homeopathic treatment).
"a soft cheese similar to Brie"
"the principle of treatment by similars"
The two buildings are similar on the whole.从整体来看，这两幢楼是相似的。
I sympathize with you; I've had a similar unhappy experience myself.我很同情你，我自己也有过类似的不幸遭遇。
He talked about it in a similar way.他对此事有相似的说法。
Gold is similar in color to brass.金和铜颜色相仿。
We have similar opinions.我们的看法相同。

simulation

[ˌsɪmju'leɪʃn], [ˌsɪmju'leɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 模拟；仿真；赝品
imitation of a situation or process.
the action of pretending; deception.
the production of a computer model of something, especially for the purpose of study.
"simulation of blood flowing through arteries and veins"
"clever simulation that's good enough to trick you"
"the method was tested by computer simulation"
Simulation testing is key to a successful project.模拟测试是成功项目的关键。
The pilot's skills are tested through simulation.飞行员的技术是通过模拟飞行来检测的。
The simulation shows good result.仿真结果表明效果良好。
Simulation results show the effectiveness of the method.仿真结果表明了该方法的有效性。
This coat is really simulation.这件外套简直是赝品。

singular

['sɪŋɡjələ(r)], ['sɪŋɡjələr]


Image Search
(of a word or form) denoting or referring to just one person or thing.
single; unique.
exceptionally good or great; remarkable.
strange or eccentric in some respect.
(of a square matrix) having a zero determinant.
denoting a point that is a singularity.
the singular form of a word.
"she always thought of herself as singular, as his only daughter"
"the singular beauty of the desert"
"no explanation accompanied this rather singular statement"
"the first person singular"
"It" is the third-person singular neuter pronoun.“it”是第三人称单数的中性代名词。
I was struck with the man's singular appearance.那个人的奇特外貌给我留下了深刻的印象。
Talking to him is a singular experience.与他交谈是一种非同平常的体验。
She had a singular insight into life.她对于人生有一个非凡的了解。
The young man has a singular ear for music.这个年轻人对音乐有非凡的欣赏力。
But his vision was too singular to be stultified for long.但是他的洞察力是如此非凡，不可能长久地被愚弄。
Give the singular forms of the following nouns.写出下列名词的单数形式。
Singular nouns are used only in the singular, always with a determiner.单数名词只有单数形式，总是与限定词连用。

sinister

['sɪnɪstə(r)], ['sɪnɪstər]


Image Search
adj. 邪恶的；不祥的；灾难性的；左边的
giving the impression that something harmful or evil is happening or will happen.
evil or criminal.
of, on, or toward the left-hand side (in a coat of arms, from the bearer's point of view, i.e., the right as it is depicted).
"there was something sinister about that murmuring voice"
"there might be a more sinister motive behind the government's actions"
He showed his sinister motive at last.他终于露出了他那邪恶的用心。
The author's laconic prose manages to be both dexterous and sinister.这位作者简洁的文字做到既洗练又有邪恶的暗示。
Maston was oppressed by sinister forebodings.梅斯顿感到自己被一种不祥的预感紧紧地抓住了。
Events began to take on a more sinister aspect.事情开始呈现较为不祥的征兆。

site

[saɪt], [saɪt]


Image Search
n. 地点；位置；现场
vt. 使 ... 位于
an area of ground on which a town, building, or monument is constructed.
a place where a particular event or activity is occurring or has occurred.
short for building site.
a website.
fix or build (something) in a particular place.
"the proposed site of a hydroelectric dam"
"the site of the Battle of Antietam"
"the site has no ads and is not being promoted with banners"
"the rectory is sited behind the church"
That sale precludes further development on this site.卖出以后妨碍了这一地点的进一步发展。
The site is being developed by a London property company.这块地正在由伦敦的一家地产公司开发利用。
Excavation of the site will begin tomorrow.明天开始挖掘工作。
The house is built on the site of a medieval prison.这个房屋建立在中世纪监狱的位置。
Rescue workers rushed to the site of the plane crash.抢救人员冲向飞机坠毁的现场。
Is it safe to site the power station here?在这建造发电厂安全吗？
They have decided to site the new school in this town.他们已经决定把新校设于本镇。

skimp

[skɪmp], [skɪmp]


Image Search
v. 舍不得给；节省；克扣；敷衍
adj. 少的；不足的
expend or use less time, money, or material on something than is necessary in an attempt to economize.
"don't skimp on insurance when you travel overseas"
Don't skimp the butter when you make cakes.你做蛋糕时不要吝惜用奶油。
They have to skimp on fuel in winter.冬天他们得节省燃料。
Higher officials always skimp on the salaries of their staff.上级长官总是克扣下属们的薪饷。
Don't skimp on your employment section.一定要详细阐述你的工作 经验。

slake

[sleɪk], [sleɪk]


Image Search
vt. 消除；满足；(石灰）熟化
quench or satisfy (one's thirst).
satisfy (desires).
combine (quicklime) with water to produce calcium hydroxide.
"slake your thirst with some lemonade"
"restaurants worked to slake the Italian obsession with food"
We had to slake ourselves with rainwater in the desert.在沙漠中我们不得不用雨水解渴。
A menu will not satisfy your hunger, a formula will not slake your thirst.菜单不可能填饱你的肚子，一套准则也不可能消除你的饥渴。
We returned to the barn and slake our thirst with tea我们回到谷仓,饮茶解渴
I shall not seek a well to slake the burning thirst of my heart,我不会找一口井来消除内心强烈的渴望，
Hasn't NATO slaked his lust for blood?难道北约还没有满足他的血腥的欲望吗？

a detective.

"scientists began their genetic sleuthing for honey mushrooms four years ago"
"No, ma'am." Replied the sleuth, "It's prettyclear that he was following you."“没有
I had to go out sleuthing to find your address.我得出去侦查一番才找到你的住址。

sluggish

['slʌɡɪʃ], ['slʌɡɪʃ]


Image Search
adj. 缓慢的；懒惰的；迟钝的；萧条的；无精打采的
slow-moving or inactive.
lacking energy or alertness.
slow to respond or make progress.
"a sluggish stream"
"Alex woke late feeling tired and sluggish"
"the car had been sluggish all morning"
There is a sluggish stream.那有一条流速缓慢的溪流。
The professor would try to awake their dormant and sluggish faculties.这位教授应该试图唤醒他们沉睡和懒散的天赋。
This humid heat makes you feel rather sluggish.这种湿热的天气使人感到懒洋洋的。
Some cities have been sluggish in their provision.有些城市在作出规定方面行动迟缓。
These tablets make me feel rather sluggish.我吃了这些药片感到困倦无力。

smug

He needn't be so smug, I know something he didn't know.他用不着那么沾沾自喜，我懂得某些他不懂得的东西。
